sequence: Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 29, 2019, on Indian Country 11. According to authorities, the band’s district court has a no-tolerance policy regarding domestic violence. As a result, the case is being prosecuted under tribal law. As for the victims, they were from the Choctaw community. Their identities and the cause of their deaths will remain undisclosed at the request of the Choctaw community, according to authorities. Officials have also noted the importance of this case not being tried in federal court.

PARIS ( Reuters ) - Longchamp , one of France ’ s leading handbag makers , plans to increase its retail network to more than 100 shops worldwide by 2012 from the current 72 as part of a 50 million euros ($67.6 million) investment plan, it said. The company is aiming to have 25 more shops in Europe and 30 more shops abroad, with a particular focus on the United States , Canada, the United Arab Emirates , Kuwait , Singapore and South Korea, Longchamp ’ s Chief Executive Bruno Pavlovsky said.

Teams of programmers and engineers at Google have created a custom Android app , different versions of which have been leaked onto Google's public Nexus device, that allows users to remotely take photos and videos, trigger the device's microphone, record surroundings, take pictures, and record the device's screen. For now, you're probably not at all concerned about this app, which has leaked onto Android devices in its unreleased state. But if it ever hits Google Play, it would be a very, very scary app indeed.

Progressive Networks ' RealAudio and RealVideo streaming products got a shot in the arm today with the news that Microsoft will include the companies' technology with its Internet Explorer 4 browser. The two companies said they will team up to support the RealAudio streaming technology within Internet Explorer. The announcement came as Microsoft readied a preview of Internet Explorer 5, its upgrade to its popular Web browser. "The inclusion of our technology in Microsoft's newest browser is a significant step for us in our mission to create the most ubiquitious streaming media format available," said Bill Guralnick, president of Progressive Networks.

SHENANDOAH -- A church in Schuylkill County is preparing to honor the late Fr. Walter Ciszek, S.J. this weekend. He was a priest from Shenandoah who is being considered for sainthood. So much has changed at the Fr. Walter Ciszek Prayer League Center in Shenandoah. It's a museum that details the life of Fr. Ciszek. He was a Jesuit missionary to the Soviet Union, accused of being a spy for the Vatican and held prisoner until he was returned to the United States in 1963. He died in 1984 at the age of 80. QUETTA - At least eleven people including two women and two children died and 18 others sustained injuries in a collision between a passenger van and a truck on National Highway near Ghanja Dhori area of Mastung district on Tuesday. According to Levies sources, a Quetta-bound passenger van carrying commuters from Karachi was on the way when it hit a truck which was coming from opposite direction due to overspeeding. As a result, eleven people including women and children died on the spot while 18 others received wounds. The bodies and injured were shifted to nearby Nawab Shaheed Ghaus Bakhsh Hospital.

A pair of Metro Vancouver thieves have been arrested and charged after they allegedly conducted an extended period of mail and identity theft. After Coquitlam RCMP and Canadian Postal Inspectors worked together to investigate the thefts, investigators identified a primary suspect, made arrests, and used search warrants to acquire a large amount of evidence, according to a November 11 news release from Coquitlam RCMP. Heine Hut, a 49-year-old Surrey man who is well-known to police, is facing six counts of charges that include mail theft, unlawful using a mail key, and possessing stolen mail and a stolen credit card.

OMAHA , Neb . – Nebraska men & apos ; s basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion of driving while under the intoxication influence of alcohol or different intoxicant by police in Omaha, Neb. The 6-foot-5 sophomore from Lincoln was cited on Tuesday after police observed his vehicle stalling and weaving through traffic in the early evening. The 20-year-old, who starred at Millard North High School, was released to go back to his dorm. The Cornhuskers (2-1) were scheduled to face off against Oral Roberts in the CBI Tournament on Tuesday. Biggs averaged 1.4 points and 1.2 rebounds in 13.7 mins this past year.

On Thursday, LightSquared submitted final arguments for its $7 billion dollar proposal to launch an LTE network. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has plenty of July 4th reading to do: a thousand-page recommendation from LightSquared and members of the GPS industry, on whether or not America will be getting a new wholesale 4G LTE provider as early as next year. On Thursday, LightSquared and the FCC-mandated Technical Working Group (TWG), which is made up of representatives from both GPS-dependant industries and LightSquared, submitted final arguments for and against LightSquared's $7 billion dollar proposal.

Really? Was it this complex? The Green Bay Press-Gazette reports that authorities say they are two to three weeks away from completing an investigation into an alleged sexual assault involving Packers cornerback Brandon Underwood. Underwood has been accused by two Milwaukee women of assaulting them in Lake Delton, Wis., a resort area, following a charity event. The alleged incident happened on June 5 and days after the incident police officials said they doubted any charges could result from the incident. One of the big hang-ups? The stories told by the women reportedly changed, at first implicating multiple Packers and then just Underwood.

It 's safe to say Cleveland Browns cornerback and ASU alum Damarious Randall was n't expecting a response like this from former teammate Johnny Manziel. Randall and Browns offensive coordinator Kyle Shanahan spoke about Johnny Manziel on Tuesday night following their Week 14 matchup with the Tennessee Titans, and Shanahan made sure to say that Manziel has a big role with the team and is not being phased out. Manziel and Randall did not play together in Cleveland as the Browns traded Manziel to Cleveland, but the two were teammates in Cleveland for two seasons.

A senior citizen , 85-year-old Baburam Patil , was turned away for the third time when he to pay his 18-year-old daughter’s marriage in a marriage hall . After being rejected thrice by marriage hall owners, Baburam decided to get married to his 24-year-old daughter himself. Baburam is a pensioner and lives in Kannad in Pune district . He has no other children to support him . When the news of his marriage was told, people gathered in large numbers . They also helped him with the financial arrangements . “We will help him in his financial needs and even support him with medical expenses.

She ’ d grown up in a predominantly white , working class housing estate . “ We were the only black family here, and we’ d moved into this estate because my father was a docker, so I guess I was used to being in mixed environments because of that. But, it was quite hard because I’ m quite tall and I’ ve got very curly hair so it stood out more than some of the other kids. “ So, I used to get the odd little bit of banter.

If the U.S. presidential election were resolved on social media, Barack Obama would be the clear winner this year over Republican challenger Mitt Romney. The Obama campaign has embraced social media, with the president holding a huge lead in Facebook and Twitter followers, and the affiliated Democratic National Committee is using private social networking tools to communicate with some campaign operatives. There's also evidence that the Obama campaign has tapped into social media analytics to gauge voter sentiment and track the popularity of the campaign's messages. Neither campaign, contacted to discuss their social media strategies, returned messages.

Avid has ‘ redesigned and reimagined ’ Media Composer , relaunching it to appeal to future generations of editors . But while the latest version has been redesigned , it seems it hasn’t been updated enough, with some video editors expressing frustration over what they say are major issues. The new version of Media Composer , dubbed Media Composer 2018, is designed to appeal to editors who are younger, better trained and better equipped for the modern, collaborative world. Avid says it has spent years talking to users and editors to learn what would be useful and helpful in the post-production workflow.

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski means Arsenal are not under extra pressure to buy another striker in January. The Gunners resume domestic action on Saturday looking to respond from the 1-0 defeat at Manchester United with victory over third-placed Southampton to stay top of the Barclays Premier League. Walcott is set to face his old club following some two months sidelined by an abdominal problem which needed surgery. Podolski, meanwhile, is on course to be available again by the end of December after being out since August 27 with a hamstring injury.

Plenty of reasons exist to be skeptical of the 'smart home' in its current form, but Amazon's Echo virtual assistant shows glimpses of genuine potential. Here's why. I roll my eyes at the concept of the "smart" refrigerator. I don't need a 'fridge tweet to tell me I'm out of orange marmalade. Smart toaster oven? I scoff. And smart locks on the doors to your home seem like a particularly dumb idea — unless you crave the company of criminals. I understand why you might want a smart thermostat, such as Nest, however overpriced it may be.

Seton Catholic ’ s Jenna Barker set a sectional record by winning the 1,600-meter run in 5 minutes , 13.04 seconds at the New Prairie Sectional at Merrillville last week. It was good for the top spot and qualification to the IHSAA girls state track meet May 17-18 in Charlestown. The Pirates’ 4X100-meter relay team of Jada Davis, Barker, Chloe Chandler, and Hannah Chandler finished 10th in 50.46. Also advancing to state on the girls side was Griffith’s Tori Jones, who was fourth in the 800-meter run in 2:22.75.

Hull - Where the US goes the UK often follows . This is especially true of negatives . If the US decides to make war on Russia , it is likely that we will go with them . This doesn't necessarily mean a shooting war but the UK has a way of supporting the US militarily , financially , diplomatically and in other ways that I won't go into here . It could well happen and the sooner the better for the world . Living in the Midlands myself, I share many of the same concerns that you do.

Sen. Martha McSally urged secretaries of the Army , Navy , and Air Force and universities to look at the challenges facing the armed forces and help solve them as part of the DoD’s new initiative to engage with universities. In her call for cooperation she said that the DoD can benefit from working with universities on issues including cyber security, training and retaining personnel, as well as researching new technology. “Our military and our universities are both on the cutting edge of research and development, so together we have an obligation to help our servicemembers succeed,” she said.

German business sentiment dropped sharply in October to its lowest in more than 2-1/2 years, the sixth consecutive fall dispelling any lingering doubt that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of some 7,000 firms, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro hit a one-week low against the dollar and European shares turned negative following Ifo's release.

On Saturday, August 8th, Ukraine’s Interfax News Service announced that the Security Bureau of Ukraine had just issued, on Friday, a list of 14 ‘artists’ (mainly Russian actors) who ‘pose a threat to Ukraine’s national security.’ The Ukrainian State Film Agency is, under Ukrainian law, now prohibited from authorizing or allowing distribution of their films or other works. These artists are thus officially banned. The list also includes French actor Gerard Depardieu, and even Russian economist Mikhail Khazin. Khazin claims that the gold price has been manipulated downward, and that gold is therefore way undervalued.

Narendra Modi’s Election Challenge: Create Jobs. Lots of Them. The Indian government’s failure to create millions of new jobs for its young population may be its undoing in elections. Aashique Ahmed Iqbal had no reason to think he wouldn’t find a job. Although from a modest background, he’d studied at one of India’s top schools, attended one of its best universities, and completed a doctorate in history at Oxford University after being awarded a highly competitive scholarship. When he returned to India, in 2017, he was optimistic that he could find work as an academic.

UPDATED: The ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce application in particular will enable users to be able to automatically log all calls, voicemails and SMS messages. ShoreTel and Salesforce.com have announced a new partnership that will match up two resources for hopefully the greater good -- as far as big data is concerned. In a nutshell, customers of both parties could look forward to the end-to-end integration of each company's most prized product and resource: Salesforce's CRM applications and ShoreTel's phone data. There are two applications at work under the plan: ShoreTel for Salesforce and ShoreTel Sky for Salesforce.

Ely , in northeastern Minnesota , is the gateway to the sprawling Superior National Forest and its 1 million-acre Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, one of the most popular canoeing areas in the United States. In the 1890s Ely was the main iron-ore shipping center for the Vermillion and Mesaba Range iron ranges, and the mines still supply much of the nation's iron. Ely today is a tourist and recreation center with numerous lodgings, resorts, and recreation facilities. Ely has an airport for tourist flights, and the area is accessible by major highways.

To involve private sector in healthcare, what is really required is a heavy increase in public sector investment to reach out to more people. The nation has a new health policy after 14 years. The long gap itself indicates the priority, or the lack thereof, accorded to a sector that is in need of some urgent attention and has deep linkages with the nation’s aspiration to grow faster and emerge as a strong economy in the global order. The new policy has proposed seven key shifts in organising healthcare services, among them a welcome change in primary care from selective to assured comprehensive care with linkages to referral hospitals.

UNITED NATIONS , July 6 , updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire at the end of this month, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Monday urged the Security Council to extend it. In an updated report on UNIS, the UN Peacekeeping Mission in the country, he wrote that it "has performed its mission in an effective and efficient manner." He noted, however, that "the situation remains fluid and volatile" in the Sudan and that it will be "challenging" to assess the situation in Darfur "with a view to determining the appropriate future United Nations presence there."

Dundee has long been a city of rich character , great wealth and extreme poverty . If the new V&A museum is just a little piece of this city , it is the perfect symbol . There are few cities in the UK where you can still experience the vagaries of urban life which is why it has been chosen to host the newest V&A museum. The museum itself is a triumph of design and will offer the chance for the city to regenerate it’s waterfront while offering a glimpse of another world . The museum will be located on the Caledonian Quay .

Margaret O ’ Brien , 69 , moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971 , got married , had three kids , divorced , became an NHS nurse , and worked for 28 years at West Park hospital , but had to stop working in 1999 as she had had 2 strokes. Margaret now lives in Tettenhall , and is the vice-chair and treasurer of the Tettenhall Residents Association . Margaret says , “ We have a lovely area with good transport links , and Tettenhall has got some great shops, but a lot of people don’t even know where it is.

Dublin : Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland 's first bill on abortion , legalising the practice in the once deeply Catholic country and overruling the government's own legislation in the process. The move was hailed as a victory for women 's rights by the bill's backers , but met by angry condemnation by Catholic and religious conservatives , some of whom held a sit-in at parliament in protest. The legislation also allows for abortions to be authorised when the mother's life is judged to be in danger or there is a risk of suicide.

LOS ANGELES – A bid to grant subpoena power to the watchdog commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department will go to voters in March 2020, after failing to gain adoption by the Board of Supervisors today. Backers of the “Reform L.A. Jails Initiative” gathered nearly a quarter-million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to study reducing the county jail population and reallocating jail construction dollars into alternatives to incarceration. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said more of the county’s 10 million-plus residents should be allowed to weigh in.

To involve private sector in healthcare , what is really required is a heavy increase in public sector investment to ensure that public spending is at a level that is equal to its actual requirements to maintain a reasonable social safety net and ensure access to education, food , health and shelter to all citizens. There are no short cuts to social and economic development, and there is a strong case to be made for a strong public sector in health and education, and in other areas such as public transportation and communications, and in infrastructure more generally.

Every year the Howick Village Business Association , in conjunction with Bernard and Diana Harding , host the Howick Village Art Trail to raise money for the upkeep of Howick Village. Each artist decorates a window of one of the participating shops in the Howick Village, which then becomes the artist’s space to display his or her work. Art lovers come from near and far to admire the window-art displays and view the artists in their studios. The Trail is run over the first two weekends of November and is always a highlight on the Howick calendar.

According to analyses by Net experts , the mass-mailing MyDoom worm , which began last week , should be coming to a halt soon because its mastermind , a German teenager , has moved on to other things . "By the time we got to MyDoom , the kid was already onto something else , and he wasn't working on MyDoom any longer ," said Steve Santorelli of the computer security company @stake , one of the security firms involved in taking MyDoom off-line . "It was pretty much over ," Santorelli said .

The location of the potential Maroon Creek Reservoir , which would be located just below the confluence of East and West Maroon creek, is 9,000 feet. The Maroon Bells Wilderness is a 12,363-acre protected area located in the Elk Mountains of the White River National Forest in central Colorado, United States. It is managed by the White River National Forest. The 1,200,000 acre White River National Forest is one of the largest protected areas in Colorado and contains 20 wilderness areas, all of which are managed as roadless areas. The White River National Forest is located entirely within Eagle County.

Want to end the war on whistleblowers? Revise the Espionage Act. Over the past 100 years, the act has metastasized into a tool for government secrecy. The evolution of the Espionage Act has done much to shape the freedom of political debate in the modern U.S. What began as a vague statute that gave President Woodrow Wilson power to jail critics and censor the news media during World War I has transformed into a powerful law that regulates political discourse by policing secrets, not speech. Censorship did not end when the war did. It evolved. Despite its name, the Espionage Act has always been a broad statute.

Russian President Vladimir Putin called Turkey ’ s downing of a Russian fighter jet today ( 24 November ) a provocative action , and said his country could not be satisfied by condemnations . Putin’s comments came during a meeting with the leadership of the Federal Security Service of Russia . The Russian president’s statement came on a day when world leaders expressed their grief at the attack on Paris by Islamic State militants. Putin described the incident with the bomber as a direct act of aggression by the Turkish authorities and warned of the risks that it could trigger an escalation of Russian-Turkish relations .

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it’s not coming from extremists, but politicians. Residents appealed for government help to prevent another attack on their island community which one of them said was triggered by the residents’ refusal to commit support to the incumbent mayor, Anton Burahan. “We are powerless,” said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangon, one of the villages on Pata island. Jubail recalled an attack on the island town allegedly by followers of Burahan on Jan. 2 who were armed with M203 grenade launcher, and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

THE pound has surged against the euro and dollar as Theresa May announced plans to launch a snap election later this year. The Prime Minister is calling for a General Election on June 8 with the intention of strengthening her hand as she sets about Brexit negotiations. British politicians have had their say on May's surprise move, here's what the pound did this morning. How is the pound performing against the dollar? Sterling has risen against the dollar to hit $1.251 this morning as May makes her case for a snap election.

The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association has released numbers confirming the expectations of many analysts: the number of actively operating shipyards around the world has fallen by more than 40 percent from what it was seven years ago. The study defined an active yard as a facility with at least one ship on its backlog. Active Chinese yards were down from 380 to 140 and Japanese yards fell from 70 to 60 over the same period, the association said. Even worse, the biggest shipyards in the world – DSME, Hyundai Heavy and Samsung Heavy – may well have empty space and unused capacity sometime next year.

In a rare instance, Dhoni, who was not even meant to be on the field of play, lost his cool and rushed out of the dug-out to challenge umpire Ulhas Gandhe after he flip-flopped on a no ball during the IPL match against Rajasthan Royals on Thursday night. "He was certainly fired up the way the decision was handled and why it was overturned. It was a lack of clarity, obviously from him and he wanted to get it clarified at a key moment," Fleming said in the post-match press conference.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to provide access to social programmes and services in the northern region of Pará which has been hit hard by violence, crime and poverty. Fome Zero (Zero Hunger) is an initiative by the Brazilian Government aiming to eradicate poverty and hunger in Brazil in 10 years. The programme, which was implemented by the government in 2003, was a major step in tackling hunger and poverty in the country, and has been hailed by the Brazilian Government as the biggest social programme of the 20th Century in Brazil.

Mr. Hidetoshi Sakuma has been serving as President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank , Ltd. since March 1, 2017. He is also serving as President and Representative Director in four other subsidiaries. Prior to joining the Company, he served as Managing Executive Officer, Deputy Director of Retail Business in Main Office, Director of Retail Business and Executive Officer in Retail Banking Group in Mizuho Bank, Ltd. He also used to serve as Director of Planning, Director of Sales Planning, Director of Sales Promotion in the Company and Representative Director in other subsidiaries.

Without much fuss or fanfare , but , happily , with plenty of shoppers , Salisbury quietly reopened its central parking garage this afternoon. The city had closed off the upper level of the city’s central parking deck, near the corner of Washington and North streets, for about 10 days for a safety inspection . The inspection was triggered after cracks were found in the concrete of a section of the upper level in late October. It was unclear when exactly the deck would reopen, but it happened a little after 1 p.m. today . Gone are the yellow crime scene tape .

Jeremy Tucker is leaving the top marketing position at Nissan North American to “ pursue other opportunities , ” according to the car company. As for his departure, Tucker had this to say: “ I am proud of the work our teams have done to elevate the brand in the past year. We’ve made significant improvements across the entire organization in terms of our marketing, product and consumer experiences and dealership operations.”
His departure follows an investigation into Nissan alleging the misuse of corporate assets at its Canton, Michigan, assembly plant. The carmaker said it has begun an independent investigation into this alleged misuse.

FOXBOROUGH - They are Camelot's football team, extending perfection (17-0) into the new year, one victory shy of playing in their fourth Super Bowl in seven seasons. The New England Patriots advanced to the AFC Championship game with a 31-20 victory over the Jacksonville Jaguars at Gillette Stadium last night. One week from today Bill Belichick's History Boys will play the San Diego Chargers or Indianapolis Colts in Foxborough for the right to advance to Super Bowl XLII in Arizona Feb. 3. "We played well enough to win," said Belichick. "It gets tougher every step of the way in the playoffs.

Shooting Reported at North Carolina University; Suspect on the Loose
North Carolina State University confirmed on its Twitter account that law enforcement agencies were at the scene to investigate. A shooting has occurred on North Carolina State University's main campus in Raleigh .

MBOMBELA - National Assembly speaker Baleka Mbete on Saturday appealed to parents in general to be "polite" so that their children can open up and express their feelings to them. Mbete was addressing about 3 000 mourners at KaNyamazane Stadium at Mbombela in Mpumalanga during the funeral service of Nokhwezi Mthembu, the daughter of African National Congress chief whip Jackson Mthembu. “There is this feeling among our children that we, as parents, want to determine who they should be,” said Mbete. Nokhwezi committed suicide by hanging herself from curtain rails in her room at their Pelican Park parliamentary village home in Cape Town on March 20.

( Left to right ) Sam and Teska Frisby , Marsha Thompson and Boheme Opera NJ Maestro Joseph Pucciatti . On Saturday March 21, Boheme Opera NJ staged a gala fundraiser, to help with expenses for next year’s upcoming productions of La Traviata and The Elixir of Love. Over 60 of New Jersey’s elite gathered at the Park Restaurant in Montclair to celebrate with the company on their second season. Guests, including opera lovers, business leaders, and local artists, mingled with the singers from the Boheme Opera company throughout the night.

There are a range of useful commands which can be accessed through the game console, or entered into the .con files. To open the console, press the tilde (~) key. To close the console, press ~ again. You can bring up a full list of commands for each category (Console, Game, Chat, Renderer, Sound, Admin, Debug and Profiler) in the console by typing the group name (e.g. Game.) and then pressing the TAB key repeatedly to first see the group list, then the correct usage of the commands.

Speaker Nabih Berri and Syria ’ s ambassador to Lebanon Friday discussed “ Israeli-Western schemes ” in the Syrian civil war. Berri told journalists after an audience with Syria’s ambassador Ghazi Kenaan that he “conveyed to him what the Syrian people have been subjected to over the past months.” He added: “Israeli and Western plans to topple Syria are in full swing. Syria is determined to liberate its land at all cost.” Kanaan arrived in Lebanon on Friday as part of Syria ’ s effort to restore ties with its Arab neighbors.

ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) - Mike Minor got to finish what he started, something the lefty never got a chance to do for the Texas Rangers last season in his return to a rotation. The Angels are 2-14 in their last 16 road games dating back to last September - a span in which they are 12-2 at home. ... The Rangers have homered in all 10 of their home games, the longest season-opening home HR streak in Texas history. ... It was the second shutout of the season for Texas, both at home after having only one shutout win at home last season.

Everyone knows where and what they were doing when this nightmare called 9/11 happened. Chuck was getting ready for work and I was on the computer watching FOX when those horrible images appeared. I had the TV on mute so all I saw were flames coming out of one of the Towers in NY. I turned on the sound and the words were incomprehensible. For some reason, even before I knew why and what, tears had sprung from my eyes. It's funny how your gut instincts take over before your mind even registers what's happening.

`` Fox & Friends '' convenes all-male panel to judge whether women are `` covering up their lady-parts '' On the latest episode of “Fox & Friends”, co-host Pete Hegseth assembled a panel of all men to discuss a story about whether or not women are supposedly covering up their lady-parts too much, and whether or not the government should step in and regulate how much a woman’s legs or breasts should be exposed. Co-host Ed Henry began the conversation by discussing that there was recently a woman in Michigan who got a ticket for wearing leggings in court, despite not having committed any offense.

DARTMOUTH — On June 14, Flag Day, the students of the James M. Quinn Elementary School in Dartmouth gathered outside to celebrate Flag Day. This in itself is not unusual, but this year it took on a more personal meaning. The reason being is that Dr. Carol Karafotis' cousin, Ted Cote from New Bedford is serving in Iraq. Earlier in the year around Veteran's Day, Dr. Karafotis asked her students to send cards to Staff Sergeant Cote in order to cheer him up. The students responded and made cards that were then sent to Iraq.

Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer wiped the floor with Wall Street 's third-quarter estimates , but one comment made by CEO Ian Read on Tuesday was a red flag. "Our portfolio of high value products has continued to grow and in 2014, 17 of our top 20 brands had year over year growth in revenue," Read said on a conference call. This is a red flag because it means that the company relies heavily on drugs like Viagra , Lipitor , and Celebrex . It also means that when those drugs lose patent protection, Pfizer will eventually face the same fate that many pharmaceutical companies have faced recently.

The University of Sri Jayewardenepura celebrated 60 years of excellence in higher education on 18th February 2019, reaching a significant landmark in its historical journey. The Diamonds Jubilee will be celebrated with the participation of President Maithreepala Sirisena, Chancellor, Most Venerable Dr. Ittapana Dhammalankara, Vice Chancellor of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura Senior Prof. Sampath Amaratunge and other dignitaries at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) on 2nd April 2019. The rich and vibrant history of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura - initially as the Vidyodaya Pirivena - dates back to 1873.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China , with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese mainland last year . That came on the heels of increased tensions with Huawei , one of China's most important telecommunications companies, after President Donald Trump put the firm on a list of foreign entities that pose a national security risk to the U.S. The Chinese government has previously denied Google accusations that Huawei has been cooperating with the country's Ministry of Public Security and China Mobile Research Institute in conducting illicit work related to so-called " deep packet inspection ".

Rep. Francis D. Gibson speaks on the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill that he sponsored as Utah Legislators gather at the state Capitol during the 2019 Legislative Session Tuesday, March 5, 2019. (Al Hartmann/The Salt Lake Tribune)
SALT LAKE CITY — House lawmakers have approved a Utah Inland Port Authority bill aimed at creating the state-owned entity and pave the way for negotiations with federal and county leaders about a proposed project. Dubbed “The Utah Inland Port Act,” the legislation would create a 24-member board, appoint 10 of those members and establish a five-member executive committee to run it.

Demonstrations erupt in Yemen , Tunisia , Egypt , Gaza , over film made in US which insults Prophet Muhammed. Hundreds in the streets of Tunis and Algiers and thousands in Gaza and Suez , to express anger over an American movie that insulted prophet Muhammad. The protesters, mostly young people, marched towards US embassies in Suez and Cairo , where they clashed with security forces. They also burned US flags in Tunis and Algiers . The US ambassador in Tunisia had to escape by helicopter after an angry mob besieged his house in Tunisia.

WASHINGTON , March 1 - Coming off a year of record-setting $ 1 billion-plus natural disasters , representatives of leading disaster relief charities and government officials today met with members of Congress to urge the passage of Hurricane Sandy aid legislation and other critical measures needed to address the disaster recovery needs of communities across the country. Leaders from the American Red Cross, Feeding America, the National Volunteer Fire Council and the National VOAD joined members of the House Appropriations Committee to call on Congress to act quickly to pass the legislation and to approve the Sandy Supplemental Emergency Appropriations bill by March 14, 2013, the end of this year's fiscal session.

Hetton-born Northern Powergrid boss remembers dad as he gets OBE The Queen’s New Year’s Honours list. Rod Gardner, Norhern Powergrid's Head of Network Operations who is originally from Hetton received an OBE in The Queen's New Year Honour's list. The boss of an energy company who hails from Hetton has been awarded an OBE in The Queen's New Year's Honours list. Rod Gardner, 50, Northern Powergrid’s Head of Network Operations, was named an Officer of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire for his services to energy resilience.

The Hashemite Library remained a beacon of knowledge and a destination for readers and intellectuals until 2000 , when the Royal Library was renovated, and became Jordan Library in 2010 to become the main reference center for the Hashemite Kingdom. It was opened in Amman on 20th of March, 1922. The Library was originally a private collection, until His Majesty King Abdallah I decided to donate the entire collection to the Jordanian people in 1962. His Majesty King Hussien I added his collection in 1988, and His Majesty the King has added several thousand volumes since.

Shiv Sena executive president Uddhav Thackeray has urged Union agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar to resign from the Union cabinet and come to Maharashtra to protect the interest of farmers reeling under drought. After visiting the house of farmer Gajanan Ghotekar, who recently committed suicide and blamed the Congress and NCP for the plight of farmers in a suicide note, Thackeray told mediapersons here yesterday that he has appealed to the farmers not to vote for NCP and Congress. Uddhav met the family members of the deceased and though he did not offer any instant financial assistance, he promised to bear the expenses of his kids' education.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel, Jeddah. Gliha noted that the event was organized by the Saudi-American Business Council (SABC) under the patronage of HRH Prince Abdullah Bin Abdul Aziz Al-Saud, president of the SABC, and with the support of the Consulate. “The Consulate was very pleased to help bring the 2018 GulfWest Food Expo to fruition. I think it's really important for us to showcase the wonderful food we have in all the GCC countries. I think it's very helpful that we have an expo like this,” said Gliha.

There’s a Speed Graphic camera, once standard equipment in newsrooms across the country. You may have seen them in 1930s and ’40s-era movies that featured gaggles of photographers, “Press” placards stuck in there fedora hatbands. Heavy, bulky and requiring light-bulb-sized flashbulbs to shoot at night, a Speed Graphic was the first camera I used professionally, for my high-school yearbook and the paper I worked for part-time while in high school and college. The one in my office used sheet film -- you’d take a shot, pull out the sheet holder, put in another.

Caroline Flack engagement ring - when did Andrew Brady propose and will she give it back now they 've split? CAROLINE Flack has called time on her engagement to fiance Andrew Brady. The couple announced their engagement in December 2019, and after less than a year of dating. But the TV host, 40, has now ended her relationship with the property developer. What did Andrew Brady buy Caroline Flack? The couple announced they were engaged in a video filmed on the show The Xtra Factor, in which Caroline told Andrew she was pregnant with his baby.

Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma, Calif., on Friday, Mar. 6, 2009. As a parent and someone who has worked with parents for many years, I was struck by the focus of the front-page report on the heartbreaking death of a baby in El Cerrito ("Baby's death in car tragic lesson for all parents," June 10). The premise that parents can "easily forget that their children are in the backseat" is, sadly, all too true.

HARRISBURG , Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General 's Office announced it is releasing more than $ 55 million in grant funds that had been held up since June. The funds are now available to programs that serve thousands of Pennsylvania children and families. Eligible families, including those who are homeless or have children in state care, should begin receiving services now, according to Auditor General Eugene DePasquale. Grant money is allocated through state departments such as the state Department of Education, the Department of Human Services and Department of Health as well as local school districts, social service agencies, and county and local courts.

German business sentiment dropped sharply in October to its lowest in more than 2-1/2 years , the sixth consecutive fall, amid concerns over the global economy and political tensions. Industry confidence dropped to 96.7 in October from a revised 98.9 in September, according to the ZEW, a research institute in Mannheim, western Germany. The reading was below economists' expectations of a drop to 98.2, and the biggest month-on-month fall since February 2012. ZEW economist Achim Wambach said that although the mood among German manufacturers had improved slightly, overall expectations for the German economy were still pessimistic.

KENTON , Del . - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a possible link to an outbreak of E. coli infections in Pennsylvania has resumed operations. FDA said in a news release it inspected the plant after receiving complaints that some cheeses made there might be contaminated. Eight of the 24 cases of the illness in Pennsylvania are being linked to cheeses from the Kenton-based Gordy's Cheese. The cheeses are being recalled. Officials said Wednesday that the plant has resumed production. FDA and the U.S. Department of Agriculture will continue to investigate the plant to ensure the facility is operating properly.

The likeliest of sources stepped up for the Boston Red Sox on Sunday . David Ortiz , never one to hold back on his admiration for Bautista, took to social media with an open letter in response to those who called on the Blue Jays third baseman to retire . The New York Rangers won their first game against the Tampa Bay Lightning on Wednesday and their third game against the Calgary Flames in just over five days on Saturday night. They had 41 goals at that point in nine games, but then lost 10 of their next 11 and now have scored just 11 in those 11 games.

Bhubaneswar : Shashi Bhushan Behera , Minister Finance & Excise has hoped , IOCL to participate in the Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) formed for Odisha’s first Petrochemical plant which will come up in Dhamra , Jajpur. The Minister said this in the presence of Shailesh Kumar Dash, Managing Director of Indian Oil Corporation Ltd.
“I hope that IOCL would like to participate in the SPV to be constituted by the state government for Dhamra oil terminal. Once the terminal is operational ,it will be beneficial to the IOCL units also”, said the Finance Minister.

Forget announcing your latest album with a gigantic, budget-crippling open-air concert - Oasis have been hiring street musicians to do the heavy promo work for them. A gaggle of buskers and street performers were collected on Friday to perform new Oasis songs at various sites around Manhattan. The ragtag group included violinists, guitarists, and – we can only hope – some of those human statues covered in gold spray paint. From subway platforms to park clearings, they played across the five boroughs – even in the pouring rain. Thoth and Dominic Del Principe were some of those who got rained on.

Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to launch the club ’ s branch in Welwyn. The club already has over 350 members playing in Watford , and has been running since 1998. They are looking for more players, of all age and abilities and hope the grant will help to attract more young players to the sport. Sports Development Officer at the club said “ Baseball is a fun and exciting sport for youngsters to get involved in and play. It’s suitable for anyone, regardless of size, shape or experience.

Haidilao went public in September , and it 's been a lucrative time for China 's largest hotpot chain . Shares in the company have risen from 38.7 yuan ($A7.55) at IPO to 59.85 yuan ($A11.59) as of Thursday's market close. Chinese stocks are up more than 50 per cent in 2017 and the hotpot chain was not immune. Haidilao shares have risen about 160 per cent year-to-date after surging 45 per cent in September, the month it listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong, or HKEX.

This month , Drake finished his residency at the O2 Arena in London . But he wasn ’ t quite done with his tour. He announced that he would be coming to the United States, with stops in Chicago, Las Vegas, and New York. The tour is aptly named the Would You Like A Tour? Tour. And it’s not a bad title. The tour will begin in early 2019. What’s really interesting about this is how many people are excited to hear Drake come to America, when he was a big enough name to start with.

A popular Belgium waffles franchise has opened in Dubai with the help of the government’s agency to support small and medium enterprises. Yummy Waffles Cafe opened in Dubai Festival City on Sunday under a franchisee agreement with Dubai SME, the Department of Economic Development agency mandated to develop the SME sector. The cafe is part of the So Good Company Franchise, best known for making waffle dough. It already has stores across Europe and in North America, South Africa, Turkey, Hong Kong and mainland China. Chairman Abdul Salam Hammadi said the Dubai cafe also would serve some Arabian flavours.

Magic — that’s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy’s Hurricanes Championship win in Levin. In only the academy’s second year, the Trish Hina-coached Lytton under-15 girls beat Wanganui 66-0, Feilding 42-0 and Kapiti 49-0 on Day 1. On Day 2, they beat Wairarapa-Bush Combined 61-0 and Mana College 73-5 before hammering Feilding 63-10 in the final. The Lytton team are a tight unit and conceded only three tries in six games. “The girls have worked really hard to get to where they are now,” said Hina, a former Black Fern.

New York bachelor Bobby (Matthew Scott) takes stock of his romantic life in “Company,” at Signature Theatre through June 30. Arlington  For Bobby, the word marriage is actually a sentence — a jail sentence. A perpetual bachelor, he is turning 35 and surrounded by five married couples who all have an opinion about his lifestyle in the Stephen Sondheim musical “Company,” now playing at Signature Theatre. Whether with envy or mild disapproval, “Company” features Bobby’s friends battling him and one another in a series of comic scenarios as he struggles to commit to commitment.

ABC TV political discussion program Insiders is coming to Byron Bay. Host Barrie Cassidy will guide a visiting panel that will include journalists David Marr, Alice Workman and Peter van Onselen, to discuss the big political developments of 2018. David Marr is regarded as one of Australia's most influential commentators, writing on subjects ranging from politics and censorship to the media and the arts. He has been a journalist since 1973 and is the recipient of four Walkley awards for journalism. Alice Workman is the political reporter for BuzzFeed News, based in the press gallery at Parliament House.

You have to admire Lego Cuusoo : The website does a great job at bringing a community of Lego fans together in a way similar to KickStarter. For those of you that don't know, Cuusoo is where you can post your own ideas for Lego models. Then, the community votes on the models they like the best. If the Cuusoo team decides to manufacture that model then you can buy it! The Cuusoo community has created over 4,000 models to date! Lego Cuusoo's latest creation, a 7149-10140 Star Destroyer has already gotten 8,000+ fans. That's a big accomplishment!

Google is trying to save presentation audiences from having to sit through long rambling questions with a new feature it is introducing into Google Slides. Announced by the company this week, Q&A is an extension that will enable presenters to ask questions to the audience during the presentation. Once added, the extension will display a ‘question box’ that allows users to ask their question to the whole room or individual members. The questions show as comments in the same way as comments in a Google document and the questions will also appear as comments in the question box as they are being asked by the audience.

The annual meeting of the Kelly Gang is normally a festive affair . The get-together , the brainchild of New Delhi's legendary barrister J.N. Singh, takes place usually in January, but this year it was scheduled at the end of March, to coincide with the annual Delhi International Book Fair. The occasion is a time for a group of people to get together over drinks and food, a time to socialise. For the last 16 years, the gang has been getting together every year at J.N. Singh’s home at New Friends Colony in Delhi.

BLOOMINGTON – The U.S. Attorney’s office has charged two local men with conspiring to distribute crack cocaine in the Bloomington area, and a former McLean County assistant state’s attorney is leading the government’s case against the pair. Raymone Stephens,30, and 23-year old Khalil Hood, 23, were two of the four men arrested early Friday morning when authorities raided two apartments on East Empire and another on Fairmont Drive. Stephens and Hood are charged with conspiracy to manufacture and distribute more than 28 grams of crack cocaine, which carry penalties of five to 40 years in prison if they’re found guilty.

The overstuffed roster for X-Men: Days of Future Past just got a little bit smaller. Although Anna Paquin‘s Rogue was reported as being part of the sequel all the way back in January, director Bryan Singer now reveals that the character has sadly been cut out of the film altogether. Hit the jump to find out why. According to EW, Paquin was set for just one scene in the movie — a big rescue sequence featuring Rogue, Magneto (Ian McKellen), Professor X (Patrick Stewart), and Iceman (Shawn Ashmore).

THE first acknowledgement of Brent Moloney 's redemption for an after-match drinking binge came midway through the season when he was voted the Lakers' best player. The second came with his appointment as captain-coach of the club for the first time in its history. Moloney, 25, is not your average Aussie Rules footballer. For starters he has an engineering degree. He is also an accomplished surfer and skier. The Lakers play in the Victorian Amateur Football Association (VAFA) third division. Moloney says he took the Brent Moloney Lakers coaching job because it fitted his lifestyle.

DELRAY BEACH — Overdoses are on the decline in Delray Beach, continuing a trend that started last year. The latest data collected by the Delray Beach Police Department shows there were fewer citywide drug overdoses in March than that time frame last year and in 2016, when there was a record-breaking number of reported overdoses. As the country grapples with the widespread opioid epidemic, Delray Beach, often regarded as the rehab capital of the nation, is seeing fewer sober homes and fewer overdoses, data shows. There were 21 overdoses in March, roughly a third of the 59 reported overdoses in March 2017.

At NSE, shares of Nestle climbed 5.35 per cent to Rs 6,185.05. At BSE the stocks surged by 5.23 per cent to Rs 6,180. Share prices of Nestle climbed after the CFTRI report stated that led levels in Maggi were under permissible limits. Nestle jumped over 5 per cent after the FMCG major said its popular product Maggi cleared tests conducted by Central Food Technological Research Institute (CFTRI) under the directive of Supreme Court, reiterating that the instant noodles brand is safe for consumption. The stock after making a positive opening, jumped further by 5.23 per cent to Rs 6,180 on BSE.

The centerpiece of the rebuild is the warehouse, which was constructed in 1943, according to the date scrawled in concrete. It is made of wood. The roof leaks. There is no air conditioning, let alone a cold-storage unit for fresh fruits and vegetables. The warehouse should have been leveled years ago. But those at Poverello House trudged on, as they always have, doing a lot with very little. When it rains, it pours inside. The extreme temperatures spoil our food. And it presents serious pest-control problems.

ALBANY — Gov . Andrew Cuomo — who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers — called the social media network a “waste of time” when he was asked about it for the second time in two months. “Twitter is a great medium. It is a waste of time, if you use it as a communications medium,” Cuomo told the Albany Times Union. “It’s a time-sucking machine.”
Cuomo, a former attorney, also said he had never sent a tweet. But the Twitter-savvy governor has plenty of people on his payroll who use the site regularly.

A rumored-to-be pregnant Kylie Jenner was finally caught in public . The 20-year-old was spotted at a construction site in Los Angeles on Friday (April 29th) where she was dressed down in a grey T-shirt, denim shorts, and a baseball cap. Earlier that day, Kylie sparked speculation she’s expecting a baby, which she has yet to confirm herself, by being absent from an event in Malibu, which her sister Khloe and mother Kris attended. Instead of joining them on the red carpet, she was seen inside, looking to be having fun with a group of girls.

Central American referee Carlos Batres has fallen for the worst dive of the World Cup by the most theatrical Italian since Federico Fellini. By doing so, he cost New Zealand's All Whites a famous win over football's reigning world champions. The scenes were reminiscent of Australia's defeat to Italy in the 2006 World Cup. Then, the 10-man Italian team scored an injury-time penalty after Fabio Grosso tumbled over defender Lucas Neill. Fabio Grosso goes down after a challenge by Lucas Neill during the 2006 World Cup. Make no bones about it - Italy, winners of four World Cup crowns, cheated to get back into the game.

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to bring an end to one of the hardest-fought and most expensive election campaigns ever. Facing them was a choice between two men with very different visions of how to get economically struggling America back firmly on its feet. More than 100 people were already patiently waiting in line at the Falls Church community centre for more than half an hour when the basement gymnasium turned polling station threw open its doors at precisely 6am. "The polls are open! Go on in!"

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years . Despite intense scientific inquiry , there is still little understanding of how human behavior develops from birth, particularly how we acquire speech, language and other complex cognitive abilities. That's because scientists have only been studying humans in real-time for a little over a hundred years. That's the question being tackled by a team of researchers in Sweden , who have reconstructed the DNA of a 700,000-year-old modern human. The scientists sequenced mitochondrial DNA taken from a 20-year-old woman whose remains were found in Sweden .

The data center market in Russia continues to grow . One needs to look only at the considerable increase in investments and construction of new projects. The Russian data center market in 2019 is expected to show a noticeable growth rate, despite a global slowdown, and the fact that Russia is experiencing its worst economic slump since 2015. The total area of data centers in Russia and the CIS in 2019 is expected to increase to 17.5 million sq. m., and in the next 5 years, this area should be in the area of more than 50 million sq.

Let's stop trying to put a label on them and just be happy! OK, I'm just going to put this out there for everyone speculating whether or not Taylor Swift and Calvin Harris are a couple: they're just dating. "Something happens when everybody finds out/ See the vultures circlin', dark clouds/ Love's a fragile little flame it can burn out," she sings. Just hang in there, HarriSwift.

Contiki has launched its European campaign, ‘Manny does Contiki’, featuring their hottest new star, Manny the mannequin. Manny will influence many channels (social, cinema, digital) but his first appearance is in a hero video. Made with agency Common Ventures, the strategy for the campaign was threefold. The first was to breathe new life in the core brand proposition to Travel with No Regrets, secondly to show the difference travelling with Contiki can have on someone. And finally, sell the Contiki Europe experience which is the social connection and moments between all the big sites that stick with you forever.

Gaza is the world’s biggest prison. Nearly two million Palestinian people are locked up there by Israel’s military blockade. Last year, racist Israel killed over 2,000 Palestinians in Gaza, including 547 children. The Pentagon rushed in more bombs when the Zionist state ran low on ­ammunition. Baltimore, similar to Palestine, is under a racist military occupation. The Baltimore police force — the sixth largest in the 26th largest U.S. city — treats Black people like prisoners. According to the 2010 U.S. census, while 72 percent of the Baltimore population are people of color, 46 percent of the police are white.

Recently , my elderly mother visited her bank located in Eastland shopping center in West Covina . On leaving , she walked past a man who was standing outside the entrance . She said , ” Is there an ATM in the bank ? ” and he asked , ” Are you 66 years old ? ” She said , ” Yes, and I am looking for an ATM . ” He said , ” I’m sorry . I don’t know the way . ”
She was offended and said , ” Well, if you don’t know the way , how come you are standing here ?

Warning : There are graphic images in the video above . SODUS , N.Y. ( WHEC ) -- A new video showing graphic surveillance video of the shooting of a 21-year-old in upstate New York was released Monday, according to CNN, as the family's attorney continues to demand answers from law enforcement. 21-year-old Joseph Clark is seen lying in an intersection after being shot at least nine times on June 22, according to a release from his family's attorney. The video shows the man was shot while sitting on the curb after being pulled over by police, CNN reported.

Where were you when you received your 40 Under 40 award? It was 2009 and I was in my ninth year at Grubb & Ellis. In retrospect, I was a young professional, still honing my craft of brokerage in the commercial real estate business, building my expertise and perfecting my client service delivery. What has been your biggest accomplishment since you were awarded? While I appreciate being named a top producer within the company or local market, and have achieved high placement on the volume of deals completed annually, I am most proud of my successes on behalf of my clients.

Man robs jewellery on crutches ! A man with a bandaged leg and using crutches fled a British hospital after he had his wrist slashed to remove an electronic security bracelet on his arm. The unnamed 31-year-old is currently on the run after he used the crutches to get past the metal detector at Queen's Hospital, Romford, and swiped his wrist to remove the device. The incident occured around 11am on Monday when a nurse was called into a room and asked if she would remove the electronic bracelet on the patient's arm to make him feel more comfortable, as the bracelet was making the wrist sore.

A local state representative is calling for fundamental reform of the state ’ s standardized testing system after the “absolutely dismal” scores that came out last week. Monday’s results showed that 24 out of 32 districts, including the five largest in Massachusetts, posted a decline in proficiency in English and math compared to the same exams given in 2005. The tests are administered to students in grades 4, 8 and 10 in English language arts and math, and in grade 10 in science and technology/engineering. Proficiency in those subjects is measured in three levels: Below basic, basic and proficient.

Can you put a price on faith? That is the question churchgoers are asking as the tradition of tithing -- giving 10% of your income to the church -- is increasingly challenged. Opponents of tithing say it is a misreading of the Bible, a practice created by man, not God. They say they should be free to donate whatever amount they choose, and they are arguing with pastors, writing letters and quitting congregations in protest. In response, some pastors have changed their teaching and rejected what has been a favored form of fund raising for decades.

Haidilao went public in September, and it's been a lucrative time for China's largest hotpot chain. The fortunes of Haidilao founders are among one of the world's fastest-growing. CHINA'S insatiable demand for spicy hotpot is placing the founders of a restaurant chain atop one of the world's fastest-growing fortunes, allowing them to outpace many of the wealthiest families globally. As of Monday, Zhang Yong, chairman of Haidilao International Holding Ltd, and his wife Shu Ping, had grown US$6 billion richer in 2019, a 79 per cent jump in just over three months.

As a veteran of the movement to combat climate change, I have been conditioned to expect disappointment. So when, as administration coordinator for Fossil Free Stanford, I was called into the office of the senior assistant to the Stanford University president in early May, I approached the meeting with apprehension. There were good reasons for my concern. That very morning, Harvard had arrested a student demanding an open dialogue on fossil fuel divestment. Last fall, Brown University flatly refused student calls to sever ties with thirteen of the dirtiest coal companies. Efforts to implement climate policies at a national and international level had fared no better.

Brands should resist the temptation to take on a hot-button issue in the Super Bowl as a way to stand out, said Aimee Drolet, professor of marketing and behavioral decision making at the University of California, Los Angeles’s Anderson School of Management. “It’s generally not the best venue for doing that because the audience is so broad, so invariably you’re going to piss off half the people,” she said. In other matters, U.C. officials announced that the 10-campus system had set a new fundraising record in 2017-18, bringing in more than with $2.7 billion.

The voter scam has been confirmed in several states , including Mississippi . Louisiana 's chief election officer is warning voters against fraudulent phone calls. The most common calls say voters should confirm their information over the phone, while others claim they are calling from the Election Assistance Commission, which oversees all federal voting laws. Even if you use your phone, you're likely to be fine, but if you are using a shared or public computer, you should log out of any accounts you were using beforehand. This includes Google accounts , Microsoft accounts and Gmail, for instance.

RICH KARLGAARD : You should look at 4 areas . One is financial regulations , which still makes it hard for people to start new businesses . Second is energy , and third is tax reform . Fourth would be infrastructure. The president says we need 3 trillion dollars , that's a lot. But that's not really a lot. What's the time frame for it ? If it's over 3 years , that's probably not the way to do it. You're going to have to do something where you're going to do it quickly.

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen, who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow, a journal of political research, literature, and art at Columbia University. She previously served as editor in chief of the Columbia Journal and blog editor at Asymptote and Words Without Borders. Had Poe lived to read Alejandra Pizarnik, she would have given him nightmares. Revered by writers such as Octavio Paz, Roberto Bolaño, and César Aira—the latter calling her “the greatest, and the last” poet—Pizarnik is one of the most important contributors to twentieth-century Argentine poetry.

While giant and spectacular circus shows now roam the Earth, it’s good to be reminded how they evolved from what was essentially street theatre. This Colombian acrobatic troupe, a dozen or so young performers delivering the world premiere of their latest show, are one of the main attractions of Blackpool’s now firmly-established February half-term Showzam Festival, featuring acts from around the world. Circolombia head to London after five days of performance here but nothing is ever going to quite match seeing them in the roccoco surroundings of the circus ring that nestles between the legs of Blackpool Tower.

This is general clerical and secretarial work performed in aschool . An employee in this classperforms routine to varied office and clerical duties requiring knowledge of business procedures and practices. Work involves the application of judgement in planning and in the selection of methods for the accomplishment of work tasks. This class is distinguished from a higher level Administrative Support Worker II by its responsibility for providing technical support and/or services to students, teachers or administrators in a variety of specialized areas of administration and/or instruction. Work assignments are received in the form of general directions with a degree of judgment exercised in the determination of the method of obtaining the work required.

A bride and groom in Canada spent their first night of marital bliss behind bars after their wedding party turns into a bar brawl. The wild husband and wife fisticuffs erupted at Denizen Hall in downtown Edmonton only 15 minutes after the party arrived at the drinking establishment, according to eyewitnesses. 'I've seen bar fights, but it was pretty different to see this lady in a wedding gown right in the thick of it,' said eyewitness Ryan Bychowski, 34, of Edmonton, Canada about the Saturday night melee to Inside Edition.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin Murphy as permanent head of the Community Correction Department. There was no change in his existing pay of $123,380. Murphy was put in charge after Gov. Asa Hutchinson fired Sheila Sharp for raising questions about the sufficiency of agency parole and probation officer staffing. Murphy brings a checkered resume to the job. At one time he had a deal being paid by a nonprofit that worked in behalf of agency employees and also drew Correction Department retirement.

Trisha Pollard believes the Texas social services system relies too much on the courts to police Medicaid fraud and not enough on a tool placed in its hands nearly nine years ago: criminal background checks. "It just seems like something so simple," Pollard said Tuesday. "People in other walks of life are routinely put through background checks." The 52-year-old retired attorney stumbled across the issue last fall when she served as a Harris County grand jury forewoman. During her term, Pollard and fellow grand jurors returned indictments against two Medicaid providers, each of whom had a criminal past that included involvement in Medicaid fraud.

Maureen Wildes argues it is time to find out the true impact of the Vietnam War on the veterans 'and on us'
Vietnam veterans returned home after their tours of duty to a nation that was still trying to come to terms with the deaths of millions of civilians in the Holocaust. The GI generation that had fought the Axis powers was now the object of widespread protests and often hostile receptions. But for the vast majority of these men and women, this new experience of being reviled and vilified for their military service was an unwelcome and even frightening challenge.

The General Accounting Office reported last month that the Small Business Administration needs to improve its planning for a new technology initiative, but it has been able to move the project along despite past problems. Under the Technology Investment Management Project, the SBA is moving to an integrated automated accounting system that will include data from loan, grants, disaster-recovery, business-center and business-outreach applications. SBA is also redeveloping its website and implementing a new human-resource and financial system as part of the ITMP. The General Accounting Office report found that the project has improved since SBA took corrective actions.

In Lean Times, Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie don't usually top the list of America's favorite sweets. But in Depression-era America, these and other desperation pies that survive today showed off home cooks' ingenuity. Some desperation pies, like green tomato pie, still enjoy niche popularity today. Imagine yourself as a resourceful farmer during the Great Depression. You'd like to make a dessert for your family, but traditional pie ingredients, like cherries or pecans, are too expensive or not available.

If the U.S. presidential election were resolved on social media , Barack Obama would be the clear winner this year. AUGUSTA, Maine (AP) — The Maine Warden Service says a hunter's body has been found in the town of Shirley. Officials say 54-year-old Dean Poulin of Waterville was hunting near Routes 6-15 on Saturday when he was separated from the rest of his hunting party. When he failed to return at the end of the day, members of his party searched for him. Poulin's body was located in a clear-cut in the area where he had been hunting. Officials say his death is believed to be the result of a medical incident.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will check to see if your claims regarding the accounts receivable balance can be proved. These claims are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proved by confirmation can help you understand why your auditor asks for multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations mainly serve to prove the existence assertion.

The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country’s embassy in the Jordanian capital, Amman, amid growing fears of an assault on the mission similar to last week’s attack in Egypt. Fears of violent anti-Israel protests similar to those that erupted in Cairo were sparked following calls for a “million-man march” outside Israel’s embassy in Amman. The action, scheduled for Thursday, had been organized via Facebook. The motto, “No Zionist embassy on Jordanian territory” was published online earlier this week and has already attracted thousands of pledges to attend the demonstration.

A facility manager wears many hats. It isn’t uncommon for a facility manager to lead a meeting, provide plumbing advice, present a renovation proposal and ensure that the floors are cleaned properly – all in one day. Facility managers take into account the safety and health of all building users, as they consider how a facility runs. A strong background in management, technical skills, construction fundamentals and technology is needed to be a successful facility manager. A facility manager provides oversight for the physical plant of a building or structural campus.

Leon Conaway, 56, who was owner and operator of Twisted Roots, entered a plea agreement that recommending a sentence of three years' probation. A Carlsbad smoke shop owner pleaded guilty to drug paraphernalia charges in federal court in Las Cruces last week. Leon Conaway, 56, owner and operator of Twisted Roots in Carlsbad, entered a plea agreement which recommended a sentence of three years probation. The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record . NL Partners of Portland , Maine , worked with the Maine Lottery on media buying and PR strategy. Fuseideas won the creative and design work, and will handle strategy, media planning, buying and production for advertising, including TV spots and online advertising. THE Australian men 's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification clash at the London Olympic Games. Australia, who lost their opening match to the USA on Monday, were leading 10-9 with just four minutes left. "We were all over the top of them for most of that game and played really good water polo," Australian captain Aaron Younger said. "But it's always disappointing when you get that close and then it just slips away." Hungary recovered to claim a narrow 11-10 victory which sees them advance to the semi-finals.

A CONSERVATIVE candidate standing in the local election has been suspended from the party after failing to declare a pending drink-driving court case, where he was later convicted. Ben Wong, 48, of South Dragon House takeaway on Silver Street, put his name forward to stand in the Victoria ward in the May 2 elections under the Conservative party, but has since been suspended following his conviction. Nominations closed to stand for election on April 3, but he stood trial at Taunton Magistrates' Court on March 21 - something the local Somerset Conservatives were unaware of.

A police officer has been struck from the force for his behaviour with his partner during their relationship. A five-day event to promote cultural tourism using creative media will be held in August in the Gobi Desert, in the Inner Mongolia autonomous region. The event, called GobiHeaven, combines camping and creative cultural activities and is intended to create a temporary community where human interaction and co-operation are encouraged. The activities will include music performances, film screenings and a wide range of artwork displays, from painting and sculpture to installation and animation, presenting an inclusive and interactive fusion of culture, creativity and entertainment. The event is being hosted by the China Cultural Media Group.

By detaining Haniyeh, Israel sent a message that Palestinian cash smuggling is coming to an end. It is an open secret that Hamas has been smuggling millions of dollars into Gaza through the Rafah crossing ever since the international community cut financial aid to the Palestinian Authority following Hamas's rise to power earlier this year. Yet Prime Minister Ehud Olmert's decision on Thursday to close the Rafah crossing to keep PA Prime Minister Ismail Haniyeh from bringing $35 million into Gaza was the first time Israel has actively intervened to stop the money flow.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at a museum in France. French archaeologists, who found the mummy crouched in a fetal position, have been careful to preserve the integrity of the remains by keeping it in the same configuration as when it was discovered. Former Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in the killing of 17-year-old Laquan McDonald, more than four years after the shooting. Jason Van Dyke, the former Chicago cop whose fatal 2014 shooting of black teenager Laquan McDonald reignited the fervent nationwide conversation about police shootings, was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in prison. The veteran police officer was convicted in October of second-degree murder and 16 counts of aggravated battery with a firearm for the shooting in October 2014. The shooting and video of it prompted protests throughout Chicago and calls for Van Dyke to face serious prison time.

They look a bit frightful, but vultures are nature's greatest cleanup crew. They're amazing creatures with an incredible sense of smell, the ability to soar for hours without flapping and guts of steel. Learn about them Sept. 1 at Hawk Mountain in Kempton during Vulture Awareness Day. See a presentation by Red Creek Environmental Center at noon. Kids can do an "Eating Like a Vulture" activity and track vultures from the lookouts. The event runs 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. The activities are free; but trail fees are $6; $5, seniors; $3, ages 6-12.

TICKETS for Manchester United 's pre-season friendly against Barcelona are on sale for almost £1,000 each . And a season ticket holder would have to pay £202 to get in through the turnstile if they didn't renew their seat. But the cheapest seat in the 50,000-seater stadium will cost just £20. Manchester United will be hoping to put on a show against Barca, which would give their 2013-14 Premier League campaign some much needed optimism. But fans who want to see the game in the cheapest seats will have to pay almost a month's salary.

U.S. government debt yields rose on Friday after the U.S. government said that job creation was stronger than expected in March, but wages grew at a sluggish pace. The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.538%, while the yield on the 30-year Treasury bond climbed to 2.947%. Bond yields move inversely to prices. Job creation snapped higher in March after an anemic February print, with nonfarm payrolls expanding by 196,000, according to a Bureau of Labor Statistics report released Friday. The unemployment rate held steady at 3.8%, meeting expectations.

New Zealand’s Abortion Supervisory Committee is appealing a High Court judge’s decision that said there is reason to doubt the legality of many abortions in the country. A registered practitioner may legally perform an abortion in New Zealand only if acting under a certificate approved by two consultants, who are appointed by the Abortion Supervisory Committee. The appeal also argues that the Court made a legal error in concluding that the committee can form its own opinion about the lawfulness of consultants’ decisions to grant or to refuse approval for an abortion.

The sidewalk would narrow the existing roadway by about 2 1/2 feet, to 15 1/2 feet once completed. The Boys & Girls Club and Sawdust Art Festival sit along the road.
