Venezuela began suffering from nationwide blackouts last week. President Nicolas Maduro labelled the outages “sabotage” orchestrated by the US. He said that several “saboteurs” have been apprehended while trying to tamper with the power grid. He earlier accused Washington of plotting a coup against him, among other alleged subversive activities.

Micron Technology ( MU ) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts ' expectations and issued fourth-quarter guidance that was better than expected. Micron shares are up 3.7% in recent trading. The memory chip company reported third-quarter net income rose to $1.15 billion, or $2.15 a share, from $844 million, or $1.56 a share, a year earlier. The FactSet EPS consensus was $2.05. Revenue rose to $8.15 billion from $5.89 billion, also above the FactSet revenue consensus of $7.85 billion.

Austria , Spain and South Korea have been approved as founding members of the Asia Infrastructure and Investment Bank (AIIB) after a meeting in the Kazakhstan capital, Astana, on Friday (16 June 2016). Britain , France and Italy have also expressed their interest in becoming founding members of AIIB and are expected to be officially admitted later this month. Sri Lanka too has applied to join the new Asian bank. It is an alternative to the Asian Development Bank (ADB), a multilateral financial institution which was set up in 1966.

Some apps set out to change the world , others are hell-bent on bringing beauty to your pocket gadgets . If you’re an Instagram fan, and you happen to own an iPhone , then you should check out the following apps , which are sure to add a fresh new touch to your favorite social network. If there’s one company that has mastered the art of design , it just has to be Apple . And now you’ll be able to apply the company’s design sensibility to your photos , thanks to this handy iPhone app .

BASEL, Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases the H1N1 flu becoming resistant to Tamiflu, which it calls a very low percentage. A good sign is that the people who had the resistant strain have not passed the disease on to other people, said David Reddy, leader of Roche's Tamiflu pandemic task force. And the resistant variety has been like the widespread version of the virus in that it typically produces only mild symptoms. The 13 cases were scattered around the world in Europe, the United States and Asia, said Reddy.

Manfred Weber ( 41 ) is the newly elected chairman of the European People ’ s Party ( EPP ) group. He will serve in this capacity until the next European Parliament elections in 2019, when he will run for a seat in the European Parliament. Weber is a former MEP from the Bavaria region, Germany. He entered the European Parliament at the age of 26 and has been a member of the Bundestag (German parliament) since 1994. As a young MEP he was a member of the European Social Democrats (PES).

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames after police halted their underwater searches due to poor visibility. Ellis Downes jumped into the water to cool off with friends on Saturday evening, but got into difficulty as he tried to swim back to the riverbank and disappeared from view. The 16-year-old's family were highly critical of Thames Valley Police after the force said it was awaiting specialist teams to continue the underwater searches. Ellis' mother Emma thanked the volunteers, saying: "If it wasn't for you our little boy would still be in that river now."

Girls Like Biology , Boys Like Physics ? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls and boys and some of them are true, but they don't really explain much. A new study takes a look at the differences in achievement and motivation between girls and boys in physics classes and shows that, in fact, a lot of the differences may have something to do with stereotypes. Girls and boys may be interested in physics, but there is a gender achievement gap at the high school level, with boys having better results in both physics and math.

It 's been more than a decade since Eminem 's one and only starring role in 8 Mile , and in the time since then, a number of movies have taken their shot at telling the story of the working-class rapper . Eight Mile was released in 2002 and is based on Eminem's life growing up in Michigan , with his struggles in poverty and how he managed to become the success story that he is now. Eminem has starred in several films since then, including 8 Mile: The Road to Success, but has yet to star in another film based on his life.

A rumored-to-be pregnant Kylie Jenner was finally caught in public. The 20-year-old was spotted at a construction site in Hidden Hills on Wednesday in a baggy black sweatshirt and sweatpants, accompanied by her best pal Jordyn Woods and Kris Jenner, TMZ reported. The Kardashian-Jenner family has yet to confirm Kylie's pregnancy, but multiple outlets, including TMZ, said she was about five months pregnant and expecting a girl with boyfriend Travis Scott back in September. Jenner did appear in a Calvin Klein ad along with her sisters last week, but her stomach was covered as to not show off a possible baby bump.

Not everyone grew to love it. In these days, “clearing” sent hordes of last-minute placements to what they fondly anticipated as the cloistered life of Queen’s College, St Andrews.

Magic — that ’ s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy ’ s Hurricanes Championship in the 2017 B.C Rugby School Rugby Provincial Championship in Victoria, BC. After a 27 – 0 shutout of the St. Michael’s College School (SMC) team in the semis, the Lytton Hurricanes took the final 12-11 over Sentinels Secondary School (SSS) in overtime Saturday, October 14, at Camosun College, with two converted tries apiece, 14 minutes apart. The Sentinels took the early lead 5 – 0, with the score knotted 5 all at the half.

Delicious, the original king of shared online bookmarking, is now in the hands of YouTube's founders, after a popular outcry saved it from being shut down by Yahoo. Chad Hurley and Steven Chen, who sold YouTube to Google for $1.65 billion dollars in 2006, will integrate Delicious into their new company, AVOS, and start running Delicious in July. Delicious, one of the pioneers of the idea of taking something users used to do privately and making it public, was snapped up by Yahoo in 2005 for a reported $30 million.

NFL player Keenan Allen had a few things to say about Bell 's song . According to TMZ , during an interview with Complex , Bell talked about his 2015 hit single " Lose Yourself " with Eminem . According to Allen , he's been a Detroit Lions fan for a long time, and he's got the receipts to back it up . Allen claims that he had been collecting Detroit sports memorabilia dating back to the 1990s. Allen also claims he has an autographed photo of Eminem with the Lions jersey #16 , from way back in 2002 when he played for the Lions .

The images we have published out of Yemen may be as unsettling as anything we have used before . Here is why we think they are important . We were sent a collection of images on the situation in Yemen over the last week. While it is well-known that there has been heavy fighting and bombings in Yemen, it was hard to tell the full extent of the story from the images we had previously published in the last week. In the following images we see the devastation of war and bombings in its most basic form . We think it is important for people around the world to see this level of devastation.

The Hashemite Library remained a beacon of knowledge and a destination for readers and intellectuals until 2000, when the number of readers started to dwindle, given the tough economic situation in the Strip. In the 1950s, the Hashemite Library was commissioned to sell newspapers and books from prominent Egyptian publishing and distribution houses. It was also a space for writers and intellectuals to meet. However, the Internet’s invasion and the poverty of Gaza Strip’s inhabitants have inhibited these activities. “Due to the rise of the Internet and the economic stagnation, we no longer got books for distribution or sale.

Upbeat on their maiden housing project in Cavite, property developer Century Properties Group Inc. (CPG) and Mitsubishi Corp. signed on Wednesday a deal to create a new joint venture corporation that will bring to the property market around P57 billion worth of affordable homes in the next five years. Seeking to cover part of the country’s huge backlog of 6.6 million housing units, the new venture plans to launch about 15 new housing projects equivalent to around 33,000 housing units within the next five years. Each unit will be priced between the P1 million and P6 million range, targeting middle-income first time homebuyers.

Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a grocery shop while infected. The alert is the fourth of its kind in recent weeks. The most recent infected person visited a number of public spaces between Sunday January 27 and Wednesday January 30. 30 January: on train from Aubin Grove to Perth between 10:25 - 11:15am, and from Canning Bridge to Mandurah between 2:20-3:15pm. On bus 100 between Canning Bridge and Cannington between 10:50-11:40am, and bus 101 from Curtin University to Canning Bridge between 2-2:50pm.

Moving into modern times, mobile game tool developer Corona Labs has acquired mobile cloud services startup Game Minion. Terms of the deal weren’t disclosed. Corona has one of the most popular software development kits for making mobile games, with more than 200,000 users. But the acquisition will help accelerate the creation of apps for all developers, according to the two companies. The Game Minion services will be rebranded as Corona Cloud. Game Minion, headed by Mohamed Hamedi (pictured right), has developed a full suite of cross-platform cloud services that mobile game developers can adopt and easily insert into their games.

A new poll reveals that more Americans would choose the Internet as their only news source than TV, radio and newspapers combined, and Internet reports are considered much more reliable that other media. It also shows only 1 in 200 people surveyed believes newspapers will be a dominant source of information in 2014. The survey discovered 56 percent of adults nationwide would pick the Internet if they were allowed just one source for their news, while television, newspapers and radio earned the support of 41 percent – together. Among Republicans, 56 percent would choose the Internet for their news, while among Democrats that figure was 50 percent.

A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). Additional Sessions Judge Kamini Lau granted relief to Bansal, a nephew of Kejriwal, on a personal bond of Rs two lakh with one surety of like amount, advocate B S Joon, appearing for the accused, said.

NASA will plunge a small robot into a volcano in Hawaii in order to map data and geographical features of the mountain’s interior. The $8 million, four-year project will include multiple robotic scouts to map active regions as well as dormant sections of the Hawaii volcano. According to the University of Hawaii, the robot is designed to traverse through deep, hot lava tubes. The robot will also explore the inner core of Kīlauea and provide data to help determine when eruptions will take place, and how they will play out.

Google is updating its Google Drive Android app with a new Material Design look, as well as a few new features. First is a small improvement to its search tool – it now updates the results while you’re typing to save you some time while looking for a document. Next up, you can now add messages when you share a file to give details about why you’re sharing, as well as change privacy sharing for files. Finally, the PDF viewer is getting an update to let you search for and copy text from a PDF without needing to enter a separate app.

Bhubaneswar: Shashi Bhushan Behera, Minister Finance & Excise has hoped, IOCL to participate in the Special Purpose Vehicles created for development of PCPIR at Paradip and also the Plastic Park at Paradip through equity participation. Besides, an attractive pricing mechanism for feedstock needs to be worked out by IOCL to incentivize units to set up base at Paradip. State Government has also requested Ministry of chemicals & Petrochemicals, Government of India for providing budgetary support of at least Rs 3000 crore to take up necessary infrastructure development activities for the region, Sri Behera said.

Royals Hang On For 3-2 Win To Take Lead In World Series : The Two-Way Following two high-scoring games in Kansas City, Game 3 of the World Series turned into a bit more of a pitchers' duel as the Royals prevailed in San Francisco. Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer celebrates after Giants Hunter Pence grounded out to end Game 3 of the World Series on Friday. Game 3 of the World Series turned into a pitchers'-duel-by-committee on Friday, as eight relievers struck out nine in 7 1/3 innings of shutout baseball for the Giants and Royals.

Will UBS Tap Bob McCann Or Sallie Krawcheck For Top Wealth Management Job ? Former Merill Lynch brokerage head Bob McCann leads the list of names to potentially take over the leadership role at wealth management group, which has seen its profitability plummet. UBS Chairman Axel Weber said he expects the group to decide by the end of this month on a leader for its wealth-management unit. Weber has yet to appoint a CEO, a post that Weber took on temporarily in March. He is stepping back from that job after Swiss regulations prevented Weber from becoming the permanent CEO.

I have just been reminded of why I quit financial journalism after 11 years in the saddle, including a spell as a Wall Street correspondent. While the world of finance had its fascinations, I grew increasingly disillusioned by the dominant narrative that it was always about the money, rather than any other considerations such as values and social impacts. They never registered on the radar. That's not altogether surprising, given the testosterone-fuelled dealing rooms and the fact there is very little connection between the decisions of City executives and their impact on ordinary peoples' lives.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea might not "be around much longer," Twitter was forced to explain why the President was not banned from the service. In a six-part tweet from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes "newsworthiness" and "public interest" into account when determining whether a user has violated its rules. Those considerations have long been used internally when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future. The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in the city and ensures its operations go smoothly. Plastic, cardboard, glass and other common materials are moved, pulverized or shifted for reuse in a compound on North Bentsen Road. The operation presents a profitable and a facilitation of services toward the public good. Clean streets, quality drainage systems and maintaining the mission of Keep McAllen Beautiful are among the services of working this sector, Alonzo said. Poor products harm the community, and her work turns the negatives into positives.

U.S. government debt yields rose on Friday after the U.S. government said that job creation was stronger than expected in July, easing concerns a slowdown in wage gains was starting to hurt the economy. The government reported that 209,000 jobs were added in July, compared to estimates for 195,000 jobs. Average hourly earnings rose 0.3% and were up 2.5% from a year earlier, in line with economists’ forecasts. Investor appetite for safe-haven U.S. government debt declined earlier in the week as fears about a slowdown in the United States economy mounted, driving up demand for the dollar.

WASHINGTON (Alliance News) - Gold prices held steady on Thursday after the Fed's latest report on the economy said businesses across the US have become less optimistic in recent months. Spot gold edged up 0.2% to USD1,294.11 per ounce, while US gold futures were virtually unchanged at USD1,293.75 per ounce. As economic headwinds mount, the Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady at least until June. The dollar took a breather today after recent gains, while the British pound steadied after British Prime Minister Theresa May won a confidence vote in the parliament and urged lawmakers to break the impasse on a Brexit divorce agreement.

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website. The letter described Butler as 'bright, intelligent and determined'. She later admitted her staff came up with the words and Obama just signed it. Before entering the Commons, Butler worked as an officer for the GMB union. She replaced Paul Boateng as MP for Brent South in 2005, becoming the third black female MP. She was promoted to her present job in September 2008. Butler is the daughter of immigrants from Jamaica. She was brought up in London where her parents own a small West Indian and European bakery.

A video posted on social media that allegedly promotes a dangerous sport in NSW has been condemned by the police, who believe it is an attempt to lure young people into a potentially dangerous pastime.

Jeremy Tucker is leaving the top marketing position at Nissan North American to “pursue other opportunities,” according to the automaker. A well-placed source says Tucker, who was vice president, Nissan marketing communications and media, was fired. However, Tucker describes it as a "mutually agreeable parting." Sales at the automaker have been lackluster and there has been some discontent among dealers about the brand’s lack of national advertising, according to another source. The automaker’s total calendar year 2018 U.S. sales were down 6.2% compared to the prior year.

AURORA , Ill. – A suburban teen has died after a tragic accident in the parking lot of a high school. It happened at 3:10 p.m. at West Aurora High School, 333 N. Lake St. in AURORA on Thursday. The teen, a 16-year-old boy, was standing in the parking lot talking to a group of friends. At that time, two cars pulled up, and when the driver of the second vehicle tried to get out of his car, he hit the teen. According to police, no one in either vehicle saw the teen, and it's unclear how the 16-year-old got hit by the second driver.

Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies will move to BU 's Engineering and Science building . Two companies plan to create 15 jobs and occupy 12,000 square feet of lease space at the Massachusetts Biomedical Innovations Center in Worcester, the companies said this week. The companies are expected to move in next year. The Worcester center will be the home base for research, production and sales of the BaceApp technology, which is part of a patented process that eliminates harmful levels of benzene in waste water from a wide range of sources, including the pulp- and paper industry and petroleum-refining operations.

Sen. Martha McSally urged secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault. Sen. Martha McSally continued to speak about her experiences with sexual assault Thursday during a keynote address to service secretaries and university leaders about combating sexual assault during a conference at the U.S. Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland. During her 30-minute address, McSally, R-Ariz., urged service secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to take a fresh look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault — such as putting 21-year-old service members in charge of 18-year-olds.

Young African-Americans embrace computers as integral to their futures , but they may be missing out on key opportunities to explore their own heritage on the Web. A new study, released Friday by the Institute for Multiracial America, an organization that works to help multiracial people find their roots, shows that 27 percent of African Americans between ages 13 and 34, or almost 8 million people, have computers in their homes but do not use them for researching their family backgrounds. Another 19 percent, or 6.6 million, know that the Web could be useful to them but have never used it to learn about their ancestors.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative. Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it will soon offer a 401(k) platform for employers. In other words, your retirement fund may one day be run by code. The wealth management startup has made a name for itself in the past few years for its so-called robo-adviser services. A toilet door recovered from a historic South Tyneside building now takes pride of place at one of the North East’s most popular visitor attractions. During a survey of a Regency townhouse in Beach Road, South Shields, staff at North-East company AAG Archaeology found what is possibbly the only lavatory door to make it into a museum collection. It was eagle-eyed archaeologist Ron Brown who spotted what is thought to be the best-surviving example of a classic North-East netty door sticking out of the rubble of a demolished toilet.

Members of the Boone Area Chamber of Commerce community participated in the inaugural Committed to the Cause volunteer day , which was held on June 9. The event was put on by the Chamber’s Committed to Community (CTC) committee as part of the Chamber’s annual 16 Days of Activism. Volunteers met at 9 a.m. to carpool to the YMCA, where they were greeted by staff and Y members, who helped organize the event and provide light snacks. CTC members were split into two groups, with each group taking on different assignments.

Scout Gil Brandt of the Dallas Cowboys, the last member of the original group that built the Cowboys from scratch, was dismissed by new owner Jerry Jones on Tuesday. "(Jones) told me finances was the reason, that he's losing $29,000 a day," Brandt said. "He'll probably fire four or five scouts, including Bob Griffin. "I told him I know I did as good a job as possible. I feel good about the 29 years I had with the Cowboys. But it's a bad way for it to end.

President Barack Obama has postponed two stops on his four-nation Asian tour because of the government shutdown. The White House said it was "logistically... not possible" to go ahead with the trips to Malaysia and the Philippines at the end of his tour. But he would still be attending regional summits in Indonesia and Brunei, the White House added. The US government has partially shut down after the two houses of Congress failed to agree a new budget. More than 700,000 federal employees face unpaid leave, and national parks, museums and many buildings are closed.

Manfred Weber (41) is the newly elected chairman of the European People’s Party (EPP), the largest political group represented in the European Parliament following the 2014 elections. He hails from Germany’s Bavarian conservative Christian Social Union (CSU). Weber spoke with EURACTIV Germany’s Dario Sarmadi. David Cameron wants the United Kingdom to leave the EU if Jean-Claude Juncker becomes president of the European Commission. What do you have to say to the British prime minister? The United Kingdom belongs in the EU – and is, itself, stronger within the community.

Four-term Governor Terry Branstad officially begins his fifth term today . Branstad , a Republican , left office in January 1999 after eight years as the state's longest serving governor. He is also the longest serving governor in U.S. history. Branstad defeated Democrat Fred Hubbell 53 to 42 percent in November's election. Branstad is 73 years old. His wife Chris Branstad is 67. The couple was married 36 years ago. This morning, Branstad will be sworn into office by Iowa Supreme Court Chief Justice Mark Cady. Branstad and Cady are not strangers to each other.

Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine 's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs . Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze has announced that Ukraine is ready to implement all agreements in its relations with the EU signed during the Eastern Partnership (EaP) summit in Brussels. "I can say that we will fulfill all commitments that Ukraine and the European Union agreed to in Brussels on May 17. And this will be a serious breakthrough in the development of European-Ukrainian cooperation" , - said the head of Ukrainian delegation on the Eastern Partnership summit.

Vodafone has announced changes to its roaming data charges . The new changes will benefit those who useless than 5MB of data while on holiday, as data charges will only be applicable when a user exceeds that 5MB of data on the Vodafone Global Roaming Network. This will save customers up to 20%, depending on which country they are visiting and how they roam. Vodafone already has unlimited roaming available for customers using its Red and Red X packages, but it will now apply the cap to its Gold 20GB package customers too.

MELBOURNE, Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4, 4-6, 6-2 on Saturday before advancing to the fourth round of the Australian Open. Hampton, who needed a medical timeout for a lower back problem before she served out the second set and winced in pain, frequently on the verge of tears, throughout the third, still managed to hit 41 winners to keep the top-ranked Azarenka under pressure. Azarenka appeared frustrated at times, but overcame an early break and fended off triple break point in the seventh game of the deciding set before clinching the match in 2 hours, 9 minutes.

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara. What was initially reported as a three-car crash yesterday, police now believe were two separate crashes in almost the same spot near Apata Station Rd. A St John Ambulance spokeswoman said two people were taken from the scene to Tauranga Hospital - one in a serious condition and one in a moderate condition. Police were first called to the area about 1.10pm. "Two crashes took place within a short space of time at the same location. It appears a ute went off the road, and after that a crash occurred between a car and a truck.

Hearst Magazines will be busy in 2018, finalizing the acquisition of Rodale, snapping up some magazines in the Netherlands and upping the frequency of two of its newest titles. The Pioneer Woman Magazine, a joint venture with blogger and Food Network star Ree Drummond, published two sellout issues in 2017 and will double the frequency to four issues in 2018, Hearst Magazines president David Carey told staffers in his annual year-in-review letter. That’s a nice change for Airbnb, which tried on its own in 2014 to launch a magazine called Pineapple, which lasted only one issue.

SANTA MARIA, Brazil – Penny-pinching by a band known for its onstage pyrotechnic displays may have cost more than 230 people their lives at a nightclub in southern Brazil, according to a state police inspector leading the investigation into this weekend's deadly blaze. Inspector Marcelo Arigony told reporters at a news conference Tuesday that members of the band knowingly purchased flares meant for outdoor use because they cost a mere $1.25 a piece, compared with the $35 price tag for an indoor flare. "The flare lit was for outdoor use only, and the people who lit them know that," said Arigony.

Surplex is an online auctioneer and marketplace that specialises in the sale of used metalworking and woodworking machinery. The company’s new mobile app is making it easier than ever for businesses to buy and sell industrial equipment — allowing bids to be made on the move. Surplex has been hosting machinery sales and auctions for more than 15 years now. After strong and steady growth throughout Europe, the Surplex website now has more than 150,000 visitors every month, from 150 countries. The online services offered by this growing company now include various payment facilities, transport cost calculators and a comprehensive online search facility.

Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs. Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze, tasked with European integration, described in an interview the importance of the country’s Association Agreement with the EU. EURACTIV Spain reports. The Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement entered into force on 1 September 1 – an important step for bilateral relations. For the past three months, Ukrainians have been able to travel to the EU without a visa. Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze explained what this agreement entails for her country, what her government has done until now and what Ukraine can offer to the EU.

Brandon Raub , the former Marine taken into custody after federal agents questioned him about Facebook posts critical of the government, is out of the hospital and back home. “Today, Brandon Raub is finally a free man after being held against his will for a week. He was not charged and released. His only "crime" was speaking his mind about government policy. The federal government must explain its actions, why Brandon was not charged, and why he was held against his will for a week,” his legal team posted on his website .

A CONSERVATIVE candidate standing in the local election has been suspended from the party after failing to declare a pending court case on his nomination form. Craig McWilliams, who is standing to be councillor for Ballyclare in the forthcoming elections, admitted he forgot to mention the case on his paperwork submitted to Mid and East Antrim Council. His nomination was accepted on Monday after the deadline for objections had passed. The incident has raised questions as to whether other candidates who have declared a pending court case in their nomination form have been dishonest about the situation.

Avid has ‘redesigned and reimagined’ Media Composer, relaunching it to appeal to future generations of editors. At the company’s Avid Connect event, held in Las Vegas just before NAB 2019, Avid unveiled Media Composer 2019, which has been designed to try to keep both current and future users happy. Avid describes Media Composer 2019 as providing “a new user experience”, with a customisable role-based user interface. The Avid bins have been redesigned and the software now features task-based workspaces, showing only the things the user might need for that task.

2019 is on the horizon, and plenty of companies hire fresh talent at the beginning of the new fiscal year. A strong resume is crucial when you're competing with other qualified job seekers. A great resume confidently conveys your abilities and experiences with concise language and quantifiable skills. It should have a simple format that's easy to read, clearly defined sections that focus on your achievements, and careful phrasing that emphasizes how your skill set matches the job requirements. Crafting your ideal resume doesn't have to be painful. These quick tips can help you create a powerful resume that'll have you landing interviews in no time.

The carrier operates 744 mainline planes that vary in size , carrying 50 to 366 passengers each . For a total of 11,408 passengers a day , while its regional carrier affiliate American Eagle , with 550 flights a day , operates about 374 aircraft and 7,800 employees to serve more than 45 million customers each year . American Eagle operates more than 1,800 flights a day to more than 160 destinations in North America and beyond . American is the largest carrier by passenger traffic in the world, with 242.6 million annual passengers in 2009 . Its headquarters is in Fort Worth in the suburban Dallas metropolitan area.

Don Draper : Who 's crying now ? When Jon Hamm last hosted “ Saturday Night Live ” in January, his monologue made fun of his character's struggles to win over fans who are angry that the show is ending. Don Draper is about to find out if his campaign worked . The fictional ad man will be playing himself on Saturday's show. Don Draper isn’t crying — and neither are his fans. Hamm is returning to “SNL” after hosting in January, during the show’s final run of episodes before it goes dark until the fall.

[ Written by Jonathan Starling ] It is not unusual to read and hear complaints about the amount of trash being generated by the tourism industry. However, many people fail to recognize that there are many businesses that also generate a lot of trash that can be recycled or disposed of in the proper manner. Read more...
Bermuda Rehabilitation and Training School to hold its 1st Birthday Bash and Open House on August 17
[ Written by Jonathan Starling ] The Bermuda Rehabilitation and Training School (BRTS) will be celebrating its first birthday on Saturday August 17 at the school on South Road with an open house from 12pm to 4 pm.

We are recruiting for a Freelance Trainer Assessor to work with us at Apprentice Assessments Limited ( AAL ) . The role of the freelance assessor will be to conduct apprentice training and assessments. The apprentice training will take place with learners from a range of Apprenticeship Standards at varying levels and across the country. This will include the delivery and assessment of workshops on the apprenticeship standards and the subsequent assessment of learners in the workshop. The post holder will work as part of a small team to deliver high quality apprenticeship training. • Appropriate professional training, development and/or experience.

Tom Petty – who was on stage alongside Prince when the late superstar played in tribute to George Harrison at the 2004 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame ceremony – has spoken about Prince’s performance that day. The performance of The Beatles‘ ‘While My Guitar Gently Weeps’ saw the pair play alongside Jeff Lynne and Steve Winwood at the 2004 induction, and has been getting a lot of attention since Prince passed away last week, on April 21. The cause of Prince’s death has not yet been confirmed, though earlier today it was revealed that an investigation into a possible overdose is underway.

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website . The letter, which said she'd "inspired millions of Americans," has now been removed after her mother said she never asked the president's team if she could use the letter. But it seems the 15 minutes of internet fame hasn't been enough for the starlet. The 16-year-old actress has just signed a deal with Lionsgate films to play the lead role of 'Sue' in the big screen version of cult TV show 'Mad Men'.

Will UBS Tap Bob McCann Or Sallie Krawcheck For Top Wealth Management Job? Former Merill Lynch brokerage head Bob McCann and former Citigroup wealth management bosslady Sallie Krawcheck are both under consideration to take over the top job at UBS's wealth management unit. Investment News reported that two industry recruiters say both names are "already circulating." Earlier, the Financial Times had reported the UBS new chief executive, Oswald Grubel, had decided not to sell the company's US wealth management business yet, despite speculation in recent months that he might offload this business following tax-evasion accusations and the ensuing scandal.

Mickey Boodaei has been a leading entrepreneur in the security space for years. He co-founded Imperva, which went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2011, and he co-founded Trusteer, which was sold to IBM for $1 billion in 2013. Soon after the latter acquisition, he founded Transmit Security. Interestingly, Boodaei did so without seeking venture capital. He indicated that by putting his own money (and that of co-founder Rakesh Loonkar) into the start-up, it felt more like when he founded his first firms, but in this case, there was no one else to answer to.

The ride-hailer returns to Taiwan with a redesigned business model that it claims will meet local regulations this time. Uber halted its services in Taiwan two months ago, but it's set to return this Thursday. You just can't stop Uber, as Taiwan has just discovered. The global ride-hailing service will relaunch its operations in the nation this Thursday after exiting two months ago, reports the Central News Agency. Uber ceased operations in Taiwan in February after it was dealt with penalties amounting to nearly $36 million under a new law barring unlicensed taxi services.

In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week, NFL Hall of Famer Ladainian Tomlinson gave his projection for the No. 1 pick in the 2019 NFL draft. In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week, NFL Hall of Famer LaDainian Tomlinson offered his prediction for the No. 1 pick in the 2019 NFL draft. Heisman Trophy winning Oklahoma quarterback Kyler Murray. "I think he's going to be the No. 1 pick," Tomlinson said on NFL Network. "I think he's going to be the No. 1 pick.

A father who broke his back trying to stop thieves from stealing his car has stunned doctors by walking down the aisle on his own two feet to marry his fiancée, a year after his injury. Alan Dryden had just stepped out to collect his car when he heard the alarm go off. The dad-of-two from Manchester was rushed to hospital after the incident, where medics said they feared he would have to learn to walk again. Doctors were astounded when the devoted Manchester United fan got back on his feet just four months later and was able to stand at his daughter's wedding on 29th September.

Georgetown University is a respected , private university located in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington , D.C . This area is often considered the most upscale area of DC, and is known as the home to the rich, powerful, and influential. The main university campus is known for its Georgian architecture, many historical landmarks, and its proximity to many of the city’s cultural and historic destinations. The University of Maryland is an enormous university located in the College Park suburb of the city. This area is known as the home to the University of Maryland Terrapins.

The TTP is appare­ntly not able to fund its operat­ions for the want of money . ISLAMABAD : The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) is under financial pressure due to the blockade of funds from abroad and is reportedly forced to look for sources in Pakistan to raise resources for its operations, a media report says. The TTP is appare­ntly not able to fund its operat­ions for the want of money. In a video message, released by TTP spokesman Mohammed Khurass­tan Seh­iwat, the terrorist group’s deputy chief Omar khuras­tani criticised Pakista­ni people for their silence on the government’s actions against the terrorist group.

Royals Hang On For 3-2 Win To Take Lead In World Series : The Two-Way Following two high-scoring games in the World Series, Tuesday featured a 3-2 score in Game 3 that could have gone either way — if not for a key defensive stand in the eighth inning. Austin Jackson's two-run homer off Kansas City Royals reliever Wade Davis gave the Detroit Tigers a 3-0 lead over the Royals at the time. But Kansas City tied the game in the seventh, when Salvador Perez hit a ground ball that bounced past second baseman Omar Infante and scored two runs.

NASA will plunge a small robot into a volcano in Hawaii in order to map data and geographical features of its insides, such as fissures and volcanic vents. A similar robot is already exploring the volcano. “We don't know exactly how volcanoes erupt. We have models but they are all very, very simplified. This project aims to help make those models more realistic,” Carolyn Parcheta, a postdoctoral fellow based at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, said, according to NASA. The robot, developed by NASA, can climb into areas that are inaccessible to humans.

"Of all the German surface warships, the British feared Bismarck the most. Her size, speed, and firepower made her a definite threat to Allied shipping in the Atlantic, and it was imperative that she be neutralized." In July 2001, the wreck of the Hood was found 9,334 feet below the surface of the Denmark Straight. She lies in three sections with the bow on its side, the mid section upside down, and the stern speared into the seabed. In 2013, the wreck was more fully explored with a remote-control vehicle.

Members of Lubbock's Muslim community reacted with surprise and dismay at the news of the Feb. 23 arrest of Saudi-born Lubbock resident Khalid Ali-M Aldawsari on charges of attempted use of a weapon of mass destruction. Imam Samer Altabaa of the Islamic Center of the South Plains had just begun to contact people in the Saudi community when contacted for comment Feb. 24. He said he did not know Aldawsari and had not heard of him before the arrest. He also said that no one in the Saudi community seemed to know Aldawsari, who identified as Muslim on his Facebook page.

A Catholic church in Port Aransas is left without a priest after he was removed Wednesday by the bishop of the Diocese of Corpus Christi. Rev. Krzysztof Bauta, known as Father Kris by his parishioners, said he was called into the bishop's office Wednesday and was told he was being removed from St. Joseph Parish. "I was very distraught and shocked," Bauta said. "I asked him why and I was not given a reason." He received a letter from the Bishop Michael Mulvey that states the removal "is for the just cause of the pastoral good of the people of St. Joseph Parish."

If you've come to this page, you've probably decided that it's time to make physical activity a regular part of your life  or you want to get more ideas to boost your regular physical activity program. The Heart and Stroke Foundation recommends that adults get 30 to 60 minutes of physical activity, most days of the week. Children should be active 60 to 90 minutes a day, most days of the week. Try to fit physical activity throughout your day  walking to work, taking a physical activity break at lunch time, going for an after-dinner stroll.

OTTAWA, March 20 (Reuters) - In a fresh blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a legislator quit his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since Feb. 7 over allegations top officials working for him leaned on former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure construction firm SNC-Lavalin Group Inc avoided a corruption trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of re-election in a vote scheduled for October this year.

Blue Turtle Technologies, South Africa's leading enterprise technology management company, has entered into an alliance with ThreatMetrix, a LexisNexis Risk Solutions company, as reseller of its leading fraud prevention solutions. Through the agreement, the company will now be able to deliver effortless authentication through digital user identification to customers in the Africa region. Blue Turtle will integrate the ThreatMetrix software into its fintech solutions portfolio, where it aims to assist clients in unlocking the power of fraud prevention. With ThreatMetrix ID, an advanced digital identity technology, customers can better button down their security no matter the industry.

FOXBOROUGH - They are Camelot 's football team , extending perfection ( 17-0 ) into the new year , one win away from a national title . But, like King Arthur's knights, they are no longer on their way to the Camelot of 2004 . This week , with only one more regular season game and then the Eastern Conference title and possible trip to the final game of the MLS playoffs, the Patriots are at the crossroads , one win away from a dream season and a shot at the MLS Cup - or one loss away from the heart-wrenching loss they know too well from last year's playoffs.

JURGEN KLOPP has revealed his delight at ending Pep Guardiola 's 22-game unbeaten run with Manchester City , exclaiming live on camera: "We are in the race again." The EFL Cup tie ended City's 13-year unbeaten run in all competitions when they lost 3-1 to Liverpool in their second game in five days. And Klopp could not contain his glee as he ran into the Liverpool fans after a superb comeback. The Kop chanted: "Liverpool are going to win the league", before the German manager celebrated on camera.

How the internet has caught up with the ways of the world. The early web: UNIX command was beautiful if you knew what to do. This month, the World Wide Web turned 20, and its birthday was celebrated the world over. It was a pleasant change since the medium, once a new frontier of hope, has been regarded with suspicion ever since the Cambridge Analytica scandal broke. We had spent years outraging over the possibility that our choice of washing machines and underwear was being conditioned by smart web advertising, and, in 2018, we learned that even voter choice was open to manipulation.

Expect sunshine today as high pressure builds in this weekend . After a cold start , temperatures will warm to around 13C later today. Overnight showery rain in the east will die out this evening with clear spells developing. Cloudy skies this afternoon with highs reaching the upper 60s and lows falling to the upper 40s. Cloud will thicken on Saturday afternoon and a front will bring a risk of scattered showers across the country. Temperatures will peak in the lower 70s with a south or southeasterly wind 10 to 15 mph becoming north in the afternoon.

Tech execs discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations. For many organisations and their workers, technology automation is an opportunity and a threat. On one hand, using robotic process automation and other tools creates efficiencies by automating manual and repetitive tasks. On the other, it has the potential to make jobs redundant. Tech execs gathered at roundtable events in Sydney and Melbourne recently to discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations. A key issue raised during the discussion was the challenge of ensuring governance policies and procedures are followed as ‘bots’ replace tasks carried out by humans across the business.

In two weeks , two people have been bit by rattlesnakes . The first was on April 23 on Mount Washington. A man was hiking with his two dogs and the snake struck one dog and then the owner. The man is in good condition. He was able to treat the snake bite and get to the ranger station. The second bite happened on April 24th and also on Mt Washington. A woman was hiking with friends and was bit in the leg. The rangers were unable to find the rattlesnake so it is believed the snake got away.

Keen to kickstart pension reforms, the finance ministry has asked the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) to notify all regulations by the end of the month. The government is also considering giving tax breaks to customers of National Pension Scheme (NPS) at the time of exit. The regulator will soon notify 14 or 15 regulations which will bring in more clarity in the segment. The PFRDA Act was passed in 2013 and notified in February, 2014. The norms will cover the role of various stakeholders, aggregators, trustees, record-keeping agencies and custodians.

Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a child care centre in Sydney’s southwest. The person, who was infectious between August 27 and 30, travelled on a train and bus on September 5. Healthcare professionals have been alerted. The infected person visited the Wollongong Botanical Garden and child care centre between 10am and 10.40am on September 5, the Liverpool and Campbelltown campuses of the University of Wollongong between 11.30am and 3.10pm, and the Macarthur Hospital between 3.15pm and 5.20pm.

Northern Ireland was today branded the race hate capital of Europe , in a report on racist violence in the UK. Nearly three-quarters of race-related incidents in Britain were recorded in Northern Ireland during the seven years to 2004, according to a study. A total of 2,748 racist incidents - including arson and assaults - were reported in Northern Ireland, 71% of the total, said the study by the anti-discrimination group Hope not Hate. The number fell to 1,646 last year - still the highest figure in the UK, said the charity.

Moving into modern times , mobile game tool developer Corona Labs has acquired mobile cloud services startup Game Minion . Game Minion’s mission, according to its website, is to give game developers “a single platform on which to create, publish and manage games for every major mobile device,” including the iPhone, Android and BlackBerry . It’s not clear at this point what Corona wants with Game Minion. I’ve contacted Corona Labs for more information, and I’ll update this story if and when they reply.

Here a Palestinian man burns the US flag during demonstrations in Gaza City on September 12. Protesters angered by an anti-Islam film storm the US Embassy in Yemen(***)s capital. A Libyan man holds a placard in English during a demonstration against the attack on the US consulate that killed four Americans, including the ambassador, in Benghazi, Libya.

This quaint home is located at the end of a cul-de-sac which is situated on the highest point in Fairfield Glade. It offers 3BR/2BA with tile or laminate floors throughout. The MBA has a single sink with a tiled walk in shower. The home also offers a galley kitchen with a separate eating area adjacent to the kitchen. If you want to relax after a hard day on the links then take advantage of the huge screened in porch that expands almost the length of the house. If you need extra storage then make use of the large closet/cabinet in the garage.

(Host) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars last year in gifts from drug companies. The companies can withhold some of the names under a law that protects trade secrets. The groups say that loophole should be closed. (Dillon) Last year, physicians and other health care providers in Vermont got about $3.1 million dollars in gifts from pharmaceutical companies. Vermont is one of a few states that require the drug companies to disclose these kinds of marketing expenses. The payments include consulting fees, travel, gifts and money for lectures.

The company said improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost contributed to increased profitability during the quarter. JK Paper on Tuesday reported a 72.26 percent jump in standalone net profit to Rs 120.26 crore for the third quarter ended December 2018 on account of improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 69.81 crore in the October-December quarter last year. Total income during the quarter under review rose 10.94 percent to Rs 883.11 crore. It stood at Rs 796.01 crore in the December quarter of 2017-18, JK Paper said in a BSE filing.

New Girl is about to come back , and our main characters are in very interesting places in their relationships. I'm excited to see if they can resolve them in a satisfying way. The finale of New Girl left Schmidt (Max Greenfield) proposing to Cece (Hannah Simone), and Jess (Zooey Deschanel) seeming like she's getting over her old love Nick (Jake Johnson) with a new beau Robby (Donald Glover). The season 5 premiere is titled "Housekeeping," which is a good clue to what the episode's major theme is.

It is easy to lose democratic mechanisms but difficult to get them back , says the incoming General Secretary of Social Democrat International (SDI) Stefan Lehne in a recent interview on socialdemokratin.se. He is also very critical on Sweden and the Swedish social democrats:
It is a paradox that the strongest social-democratic country in Europe is also one of the biggest losers of the European Social Democratic movement. SDI is a network consisting of parties that share the ideology of social democracy. Its members represent approximately 200 million citizens in 42 countries – that makes up 40 per cent of the European Union and 20 per cent of the global economy.

Britain 's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his debut race in the one-day distance. The three-time Olympic champion and the world champion in 70.3-mile race, clocked 3 hours, 44 minutes and 44 seconds. It was 20 minutes better than the time he clocked last month to win in Abu Dhabi on his first outing of 2019. Although Brownlee came into the race as favourite to win, his strong performance on the day surprised everyone. “I’m a little bit blown away.

Google recently launched real estate features including home services advertising and will soon unveil a mortgage comparison tool. Google investment arms back two online real estate marketplaces and one agent-matching site. The Internet giant is pioneering 3-D virtual tour and smart home technology. A top-producing real estate broker recently received an invitation to attend an exclusive workshop at the headquarters of Google. The purpose of “Google Ignite Real Estate,” an invitation-only event slated for mid-September, is to stoke interest and discussion around how to use Google tools, products and data to beef up the online real estate marketing and digital strategies of real estate brands.

Millennials are not a homogenous group of individuals , so a one-size-fits-all marcomms approach wo n't work . Millennials want to be heard by marketers. The 42-year-old Warburton spent a few minutes near the Giants' bench before the game, but was not in the game program. He was spotted on the team's bench before the game and was sitting with Giants owner John Mara, but did not stay in his seat during the game . Warburton also portrays ``Sebastian the Crab'' in Disney's animated film ``Disney/Pixar's `Little Mermaid ` II: Return to the Sea .''

Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2. Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2. According to U.S. Attorney Mike Hurst and FBI Special Agent in Charge Christopher Freeze, Jerome Steve, 33, and Keenan Martin, 26, both of Philadelphia entered their pleas Tuesday before U.S. District Judge Daniel P. Jordan III. The murder took place in the Tucker community of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians near Philadelphia.

Will Chelsea switch gears vs. Arsenal ? Judging by his body language , you would never think Chelsea is only one game away from potentially winning the Premier League. "I think we need to forget what happened in the first game and prepare for the second leg in the right way". I think it has changed the mentality of the team since we came back to the group, and now we must keep working like this, not in a way that you are happy to win but in a way to try to win.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $ 7.5 million worth of bitcoin currency that he had received as payment for a hack. The computer was later sold to a used computer dealer, the Guardian reported. The drive was then sent on to a metal recycling center in the town of Bury, north of Manchester. The computer dealer sold the hard drive for about $ 100 and was unaware that it contained bitcoins that could have been worth $ 8,000 at the time. Bitcoins are a virtual currency designed to make it possible to send and receive payments through the Internet.

WASHINGTON - RFK Stadium , the once and future home of major league baseball in the nation 's capital , will host its first playoff game in eight years tonight when the New York Mets face the Chicago Cubs in the best-of-five National League Division Series. RFK has been home of the Mets for 27 years. But that will not be the case next year, when New York moves into its own ballpark. The Washington Nationals will then play at RFK for two more years, then at a stadium the team is helping to pay for near the Anacostia River on the Southeast side of Washington.

BATON ROUGE , LA ( WAFB ) - Golfers in Baton Rouge could have fewer places to tee off after a proposed ordinance could make it harder to open new miniature golf or driving ranges in the city. Golfers and city planners are debating how new miniature golf and driving ranges can operate in city limits as officials consider an ordinance that could restrict where the facilities can be located. A public hearing on the ordinance was held on Tuesday at City Hall. The proposed ordinance could make it hard to open a driving range or miniature golf facility in neighborhoods zoned as either residential or commercial.

CAROLINE Flack and Andrew Brady's whirlwind romance came to a crashing end not long after he popped the question. What was Caroline Flack's engagement ring? The Grant bar and grill is a lively place with local musicians playing Thursday , Friday and Saturday nights and live bands and DJs on most Friday and Saturdays. The Grant Bar is a popular local hangout and has been recently refurbished to offer an enjoyable venue for both the local community and tourists. The Grant is a traditional country pub with its own unique atmosphere, and is a perfect place to sit back and watch the world go by. There are comfy sofas and armchairs, and plenty of tables and chairs inside as well as a beer garden and a large outside area.

According to analysts, the market is entering a consolidation phase after the recent run-up. NEW DELHI: A below-normal monsoon forecast by private weather agency Skymet proved to be a big dampener for stock benchmarks on Wednesday, which surrendered the day's gains after scaling all-time highs. According to Skymet, monsoon in 2019 is likely to be ‘below normal’ to the tune of 93 per cent of the long period average (LPA) of 887 mm for four months starting from June to September. This sent the bulls hurtling downwards, wiping off the earlier gains, as the market ended in negative territory.

US President Donald Trump said his homeland security officials will make a plea to congressional leaders for a border wall and indicated he would not drop his demand for US$5 billion in wall funding that triggered a partial government shutdown. WASHINGTON (REUTERS) - Congressional leaders arrived at the White House on Wednesday (Jan 2) for a briefing in which President Donald Trump and homeland security officials will press their case for a border wall as he held fast to his demand for US$5 billion (S$6.8 billion) in wall funding that triggered a partial government shutdown now in its 12th day.

It was another quarter of rapid growth for the optical-equipment maker , but shares fell as investors were uninspired by its margins. It was another strong quarter of growth for Corning, which continues to show strong demand for Gorilla Glass and fiber optic cable for smartphone makers. Sales rose 27% to $2.57 billion, beating expectations, and the company beat earnings estimates as well, with profit rising 29% to $0.37 per diluted share. Margins were better than expected, too, as the company's cost-cutting efforts paid off.

About the Coastal Access Program
In the 1990’s there was a great push to gain access for the general public to our beautiful coastal resources. Since then the California Coastal Commission has adopted an Access Plan for the entire California Coastline. This is one of the many tools which the Coastal Commission employs.

Wallarm has raised $8 million in a Series A round of funding that will be used to help the company further develop and expand the capabilities of its application security platform. Wallarm is looking to gain share in the growing market for application security, with continued advancements to the company's Framework for Automatic Security Testing, or FAST, platform. On Oct. 22, Wallarm announced that it raised $8 million in a Series A round of funding, led by Toba Capital and including the participation of Y Combinator, Partech and Gagarin Capital.

THOMAS Duffy is a sculptor who is preparing a commemorative bronze to celebrate the life of a father he never knew. He will also unveil his first major public sculpture in his adopted home city of Manchester later this month. He will use the unveiling at Salford's Imperial War Museum North as an opportunity to launch a new charitable venture. "I'm not sure how to put it in a sentence," said Duffy. "But the short version is that I've never met my dad and I've never heard about him.

Amitabh Bachchan is not just a legend for his contribution in Hindi cinema but also his inclination towards social welfare. He has proved this in the past when he decided to be the brand ambassador of the Swachch Bharat Abhiyan, an initiative of the Indian government to make the country clean. The 75-year-old actor has now decided to launch a social media campaign with the motto “Khul Ja Sakte Hain”. He took to social media to announce the initiative. He wrote on his Facebook, “Khul Ja Sakte Hain, is my new initiative for a clean India.

If this was supposed to be a measuring stick game for the Flyers, they came up a bit short. Coming off a 12-1-1 dash since Jan. 12, the Flyers skated squarely into a wall named the Tampa Bay Lightning on Tuesday night and it was a reality check. The team with the best record (46-11-4) in the NHL easily skated past the Flyers on the way to a 5-2 win at the Wells Fargo Center, sweeping the season series. With Pittsburgh winning at New Jersey, the Flyers fell back to eight points out of a playoff spot again.

To a watching world , the sight of Britain on fire this week has surely been shocking . The looting , pillaging , rampages by a sub-culture which has long been regarded as the preserve of the poor , uneducated , black youths , seem to confirm what a great majority of us have long believed – that the Welfare State has become a sink of moral degeneration , that it is time the whole of the welfare system was radically overhauled and reformed . Yet the truth of the matter is a good deal more complicated , for the causes of this crisis can be seen to stem from a variety of problems .

Israeli PM says he will deliver major policy speech for achieving peace with Palestinians . The prime minister has so far made only vague references to a potential peace deal with the Palestinians, saying it must be "an agreed peace". The Palestinians seek to establish an independent state along with the Gaza strip and the West Bank. House Democrats to Investigate Trump's Deals With Saudi Arabia and UAE Over Khashoggi Khashoggi, 59, who was a prominent critic of the crown prince, went missing after visiting the Saudi consulate in Turkey last week.

THE Australian men's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification stage semi-final, going down 10-9, and will now playoff for seventh position on Sunday. As they have shown many times throughout this Olympic campaign, Australia is just a goal or two away from beating the very best teams in the world on a regular basis. They seriously challenged pre-tournament favourites Serbia in their semi-final before giving up a three goal lead late in the game and today led with just under five minutes left on the clock.

After The Floods, Colorado Hospital Braces For Winter : Shots - Health News A hospital in Estes Park, Colo., escaped the flood damage that affected much of the area this month. But the small hospital in the mountains now relies on a single road to evacuate critical patients. A bad snowstorm could stop traffic and ground helicopters, leaving the hospital isolated. As snow begins falling in Colorado's Rocky Mountain National Park, the town at its doorstep, finds itself newly isolated. The only year-round road into or out of Estes Park, Colo., now is the Peak to Peak Highway.

WASHINGTON, March 1 - Coming off a year of record-setting $1 billion-plus natural disasters, representatives of leading insurance companies said today that costs to taxpayers and businesses from extreme weather will continue to soar because of climate change. The insurers joined Sens. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Sheldon Whitehouse (D-R.I.) at a press conference to discuss the mounting financial impact of global warming. Both Vermont and Rhode Island last August felt the brunt of Tropical Storm Irene, one of the record 14 natural disasters in the United States last year that each caused more than $1 billion in damage.

In order to cause “ a diversion , ” foreign actors hit the nation ’ s key power stations which supply most of the nation ’ s oil and gas production . The key power stations were not hit , however, the oil and gas pipelines were damaged severely , leading to a drop in the nation ’ s oil and gas production , thus, an economic and political backlash.

A few students have had what might be politely described as a �disagreement� at Graham Middle School . Kim Davis, 12, a sixth grader at the school, told me she was sitting in her math class on Jan. 31 when she started to feel ill. She had a bad headache and her stomach started hurting. �We all started feeling sick in math class and I went to the restroom, but it just kept getting worse and worse,� Davis said. It was a Saturday morning. August. I remember it vividly. I was online, sat up in bed, browsing, not looking for anything in particular. An article caught my eye: it was about the refugee crisis. Men, women and children were risking their lives to get to western Europe, and many were dying in the process. It was a story of endurance and terrible trauma. In response I expected compassion, a swell of fellow feeling. But my heart sank as I read the comments. There was so much cruelty.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency , rather than by the current district system. The island-wide constituency will be in place by 2024, after being approved by both Guernsey's states and legislature. It means the number of representatives will increase from 24 to 38, and all islanders will cast a ballot for one candidate in 38 districts, instead of voting for one representative from 24. Speaking at Guernsey's States Assembly this week, chief minister Gavin St Pier said the new constituency boundaries would be created by the end of March next year.

DENVER ( AP ) — The nonpartisan administrator of Colorado ’ s state Senate has warned staff , aides and lobbyists not to use the n- word or other racial slurs amid controversy surrounding a series of racial slurs and comments. In a memo to Senate employees dated Monday, Secretary of the Senate Kelly M. Oxenham also warned those in the Senate not to use the n- word in reference to U.S. President Donald J. Trump “ or other racial slurs or epithets toward any person.”
She also urged those in the Senate to report any other offensive comments to the Secretary of the Senate’s office.

A collection of powerful short films where children explain , in their own words , what it is like to live with mental health problems such as depression and anxiety. The films aim to help young people feel they are not alone by showing how other children cope with these issues and what help they may find. The first of the two short films is called 'Being me'. The film was created by a young person who has had depression and has been talking to a professional about the help that they have been offered to help with their condition.

Did Donald Trump Release Donald Trump ’ s Tax Return ? For a moment , it seemed that Rachel Maddow was going to scoop Donald Trump ’ s tax return on air. But it was a tease. In an email to supporters, Maddow said, “I am not allowed to reveal what I know before it meets our standards of complete accuracy. So I’ll be back soon with more on this.” What are you talking about here? Maddow didn’t release Trump’s tax returns, and she never will. Trump is not going to release them.

WINTER HAVEN - The city of Winter Haven is offering boxing fitness classes that give everyone who participates a challenging workout. Four times a year the city offers six-week boxing sessions, with two sessions happening at the same time and in the same place. This year, one session is at Winter Haven Community Center and the other is at Winter Haven High School. This is a cardio workout, not a full-contact sport. But participants get to hit the heavy-duty speed bags, jump rope and work out with the jumping mats. It is designed by the USA Boxing Association, so instructors have boxing experience.

The Bible teaches, “Resist the devil and he will flee from you” (James 4:7). It also tells us to turn away from those who are led by various lusts (see 1 Tim.3:5-6). Many great people in God have fallen into fleshly temptations and potentially ruined their lives and ministries. One person has said, “It takes a lifetime to build integrity and a minute to lose it.” This is a true saying! I believe one of the most important reasons leaders fall is that most have never intentionally set up mental and emotional firewalls.

Delicious , the original king of shared online bookmarking , is now in the hands of YouTube 's founders , and it looks like they are not messing with it . Delicious was recently sold to AVOS , YouTube co-founders who also happen to be Google executives. At the time , the deal made some users worried that Delicious might end up as one of Google's services. Now , we know that Delicious will be owned by AVOS , and will remain an independent , standalone service : "AVOS Systems LLC is the parent company for a family of consumer internet products.

The new head of the national children ’ s hospital board has said it would be “ bad business ” for the service to outsource its paediatric intensive care unit ( PICU ) to an overseas provider, as has been proposed by the HSE. In its draft capital plan for 2018 , the HSE has proposed that the 35-bed unit be outsourced to a private provider to improve its efficiency. The unit has been struggling to maintain adequate staffing for some years. In July 2016, the PICU stopped taking admissions because the number of paediatric intensive-care consultants on duty was less than the minimum required in the HSE document.

Brandon Raub, the former Marine taken into custody after federal agents questioned him about Facebook posts critical of the government, has been transferred to a Veterans Administration (VA) psychiatric ward on the other side of the Virginia. The Rutherford Institute, Raub's legal council, released this statement: "Special Justice Walter Douglass Stokes for the General District Court for the City of Hopewell, Va., has denied an emergency motion filed ... to stop ... Raub from being forcibly transferred to a psychiatric facility more than three hours away from his family, friends and legal team."

Summer is the time to start thinking of how to pack a delicious — and smart — picnic . Eating on the trail is always a treat, but some of our favorite snacks tend to be a bit more challenging when packed in a small, portable cooler. So how do you pack a tasty, healthy and, most importantly, easy-to-eat picnic? Here are a few ideas. We'll start with a classic: cheese and crackers. There is something about the combination of the salty cheese with the slightly-sweet cracker that makes it such an all-American favorite.

A Montrose pensioner has been left shocked and upset after being ordered by Angus Council to remove all bird feeders from her front garden.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform. Battles, a safety, was brought in as a free agent to provide depth in the defensive secondary. Battles, who played his college ball at Vanderbilt, was one of the few undrafted rookie free agents to earn an opening day roster spot for the Steelers in 2000. He spent two seasons with Pittsburgh and one with Jacksonville, playing in 45 games, starting 17, and intercepting three passes. But, Battles lost his love for the game last year and quit just two weeks into training camp with the Buffalo Bills.

Every year the Howick Village Business Association, in conjunction with Bernard and Diana Harding, host the Howick Village Lighting Display. The entire Fencible Walk Park is covered in a wonderland of lights, blow up figures and even a snow machine. Inside the Snow Cave is a vast array of Christmas toys and displays, many of which are "hands on". Santa will be in his grotto for one hour at 8.00pm from Monday the 17th of December through to and including Monday the 24th. In the meantime, you can leave a letter for him in his special mail box outside the Snow Cave.

The EEC Business Intelligence is the most widely used system in the sector, with more than 1600 users in more than 115 countries. The Board of Intermediate Education Karachi (BIEK) on Thursday reported 20 cases of cheating to the board’s committee looking over the matter. According to the board, 16 students were in possession of cheating materials, whereas three candidates were found using mobile phones and another tore an examination copy. The BIEK had on Wednesday reported at least one case of impersonation, while another student was said to have made away with his answer script from the examination centre among eight other cases. In another incident a student was caught using a smartwatch to solve his paper.

The location of the potential Maroon Creek Reservoir, which would be located just below the confluence of East and West Maroon creeks, in view of the Maroon Bells, and partially in the Maroon Bells-Snowmass Wilderness. American Rivers and Colorado Trout Unlimited are the latest of 10 opposing parties to sign agreements with the city of Aspen stating that the city will move its conditional water storage rights out of the upper Castle and Maroon creek valleys to five other locations.

A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal 's relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to the seizure of allegedly illegal foreign exchange in 2011. Special Judge Sanjeev Kumar granted the bail to Bansal on the ground that he was not named in the FIR and was not a promoter of the company. However, the court dismissed Bansal's plea for an exemption from appearing before the trial court during the period of bail. On August 3, the Enforcement Directorate had filed a supplementary chargesheet in the Rs 2,000-crore alleged hawala racket case, in which Bansal is accused.

The sixth race of the Charlevoix Yacht Club's summer series was sailed on Aug. 8 in light and variable winds. Twenty-two boats finished the race, which consisted of a shortened course of six windward-leeward legs. Affinity was the fastest boat overall, and only 26 seconds corrected time separated the first three boats of the Spinnaker A fleet this week. Two more races and one more drop will determine the summer series totals. Race results provided by Mike Miller and Keith Attee, committee chairs. Jib and Main fleet: 1 - Sonnett (Lepmann); 2 - Exitus (Pung).

Stark County’s unemployment rate in August fell to 6.8 percent, the lowest it’s been since September 2008. For the first time since 2008, Stark County’s jobless rate slipped below 7 percent, and a variety of factors likely contributed to the decline. A leading suspect is the influx of businesses coming to the area because of oil and natural gas drilling in the Utica shale. Oil exploration companies have moved in, followed by engineering and construction firms that provide different services. Manufacturing also has seen growth because of increased demand locally and nationwide for steel and drilling equipment.

Summary : Southeast Toyota Distributors , LLC ( SET ) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Yaris , Rav4 , Toyota Highlander , Camry , Toyota Prius and Corolla vehicles manufactured November 12, 2015, to November 17, 2015. If the seat belt pre-tensioner is activated the air bag may be damaged. Consequence : Damage to the front air bag may result in injury or death to the front seat occupants. Additionally, if the frontal air bag is not working properly, the vehicle will not meet the minimum performance standard for the frontal air bag.

VIDEO: On March 30, 2017, Atlanta drivers on I-85 north found themselves in a stunning situation when materials stored beneath the interstate overpass spanning Piedmont Road and Monroe Drive caught fire. The overpass then collapsed. Despite the 2017 I-85 bridge collapse that threw Atlanta into a two-month traffic nightmare — or the massive sinkholes that have erupted around town — Georgia infrastructure is actually among the very best in the nation. That’s according to researchers over at 24/7 Wall Street, who created an index using the share of potentially hazardous bridges, roads or dams to identify which states fare worst of all when it comes to infrastructure.

FAU defeated Louisiana Tech in convincing fashion, 69-61, behind a big game from Xavian Stapleton. The Owls (13-9, 4-5 Conference USA) took their first lead of the game with 13:33 to go in the first half and didn’t look back, holding on to the advantage over the Bulldogs (15-7, 5-4 C-USA) for the rest of the night. The Owls had four double-digit scorers tonight, including Stapleton, who had 19 points and nine rebounds. Big man Karlis Silis had a double-double, scoring 14 to go along with 10 rebounds.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future . The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in McAllen, but she also serves on the state’s Local Government Advisory Council. In this role, she helps shape how recycling will change over the next 10 years and how other cities and counties can get better at it. “It is one of the most important things I have on my agenda,” she said recently, speaking during an interview for the Texas Tribune podcast. The state has created a recycling strategy that sets the goal of 75 percent waste diversion by 2030.

The daughter of a leading Kannada tabloid editor, who was arrested for allegedly hiring a contract killer to eliminate his journalist colleague, today said that her father was "not guilty" and would come out of the case "safely". Ravi Belagere, who brings out 'Hai Bangalore', was arrested yesterday from his house here on charges of hiring a 'supari' killer from Vijayapura in north Karnataka to kill Sunil Heggaravalli. "No one has filed an FIR in this case based on a complaint filed by someone. It is a suo-motu case by the police based on Shahi's (the contract killer) statement.
