Rep. Francis D. Gibson speaks on the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill that he sponsored as Utah Legislators gather at the State Capitol in Salt Lake City for a special session on Wednesday, July 18, 2018. Just because something is allowed doesn’t mean it is advisable. The three subcommittees of the Utah Inland Port Authority Board may legally meet behind closed doors under the state’s Open and Public Meetings Act. Each subcommittee consists of four or five members of the 11-member Port Authority board, which doesn’t constitute a quorum.

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire . Tony Barbara , 50, kept five pit bull terriers which he used for blood sport. He also kept a bull terrier for his own protection and two Jack Russell terriers, which he sold to fight. He was convicted last year of allowing animals to be used for fighting. The dogs were seized from his address in Prestwick on July 10, 2006. Barbara was also ordered not to keep any animals without a licence for five years. He was given a 12-month jail sentence, which he is currently serving.

At her weekly therapy sessions, Julie revealed her most uncomfortable secrets: depression, debt, childhood sexual abuse. Her psychiatrist at Massachusetts General Hospital would then type a summary into Julie’s computerized medical record. With that, more than 200 pages of sensitive notes became available to any doctor who cared for her within the sprawling Partners HealthCare system. She discovered this only when one doctor later referenced the notes. Julie, a 43-year-old lawyer, was unnerved, then angry. “The details are really nobody’s business,” she said. But Partners disagrees.

Craig Watson (top) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on a North Shields store. Two men have been jailed for an armed robbery at a North Shields store. Lee James Stephenson and Craig Robert William Watson were sentenced at Newcastle Crown Court for a string of offences. Stephenson, 39, of Loxley Close, New York, was sentenced to 12 years after a trial for the robbery, possession of heroin, common assault, joint offences of theft from a vehicle, joint attempted robbery, and joint burglary.

WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning to the U.S. claiming he had been kidnapped, only to disappear again, is back in U.S. custody, officials said Sunday. Cpl. Wassef Ali Hassoun, 34, turned himself in and was being flown Sunday from an undisclosed location in the Middle East to Norfolk, Va. He is to be moved Monday to Camp Lejeune in North Carolina, according to a spokesman, Capt. Eric Flanagan. Maj. Gen. Raymond Fox, commander of the 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force at Lejeune, will determine whether to court martial Hassoun.

CNET 's reporters are covering the launch of the much-hyped iPhone 4 . Stay tuned for updates from New York's Lincoln Center and beyond. 12:09 p.m. PDT: Well folks, Steve Jobs is on stage in New York's Lincoln Theater. Here's a live look at the event. The theater is jammed with journalists and bloggers. There are hundreds of reporters and photographers in the balcony alone. We've also got a big-screen setup in the photo department, so expect some great snaps. Apple has made some tweaks to the Web site for today's event.

The 27th annual Southwest Iowa Hot Air Balloon Days is underway this weekend in Creston. Balloon committee spokesman Bill Fastenow says the winds are the determining factor of whether or not the balloons will fly and, of course, their destination. Fastenow says this (Saturday) afternoon at 4:30, there’s a balloonists’ meeting, followed by a “night glow” at the Creston Airport south of town, which he says is a pretty sight to see. Creston Chamber of Commerce executive director Ellen Gerharz says at least 57 balloonists have signed up to take part in this weekend’s events.

The daughter of a leading Kannada tabloid editor , who was arrested for allegedly hiring a contract killer to eliminate a journalist , told the police on Friday that her father does not know anything about it. A special team has been constituted to probe the case, the police said. Police have arrested four people in this connection including the daughter of Avinash (36) alias Boney, editor in-chief of the popular tabloid Vishwavani. The tabloid has carried sensational stories on the lives of leading celebrities. The police had earlier registered a case under the Indian Penal Code and the Karnataka Control of Organised Crime Act against Boney and others.

Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested by the joint terrorism task force in a plot to use a van filled with explosives on the Fourth of July. A man who pledged allegiance to Al Qaeda sought to kill members of the military and conducted reconnaissance in downtown Cleveland for a planned attack on July 4 -- but the Independence Day plot was foiled after a months-long investigation, federal officials said Monday. FBI Special Agent in Charge Stephen Anthony said Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested at 10 a.m. Sunday by the joint terrorism task force.

A new logo to help identify how the community feels about the Seminole County school system soon will be developed, using at least one of the top four winning entries in the county's Logo Competition. School board members said they wanted a new logo because the system's current emblem -- that of a school crossing sign -- doesn't reflect the district's academic achievements. The competition was divided into four age groups, 10 and under as the elementary group, 11 to 14 in the juniors group, 15 to 18 in the seniors group and 19 and over in the adult group.

OMAHA, Neb. – Nebraska men's basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion of driving under the influence and leaving the scene of an accident in Omaha last weekend. According to a police report, Biggs backed his Chevrolet Suburban into a Bellevue man's vehicle about 1:35 a.m. Sunday. Biggs spoke briefly to the other driver and drove off. Police stopped Biggs several miles away. His blood-alcohol content measured .134, over the legal limit of .08. The 20-year-old Biggs also was cited for minor in possession and unsafe backing.

January 6 , 2017 Affordable Care Act , health insurance , Uncategorized . A new poll released Friday finds one-third of the public says President Donald Trump made the country less safe from terrorism threats and nearly as many says he’s made the country less welcoming to immigrants and racial groups, including blacks. The survey of 1,000 American adults by the Pew Research Center also highlights differences in views by education levels, gender, partisanship and racial group. In general, the survey found that negative opinions about the newly inaugurated president have intensified since he took office, and they’re even worse among Democrats.

A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light . The technique involves using lasers and lights to make a tumour so toxic that it explodes. It’s hoped it will offer an alternative to surgery for treating some cancers . The new treatment involves using light to make cancer cells so unstable that it makes them explode. It works like this: light hits DNA in the cell, altering its structure slightly so that it cannot read information correctly. The DNA can’t copy itself properly so it doesn’t grow and divide.

Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer wiped the floor with Wall Street's third-quarter estimates, but one comment made by CEO Ian Read during the earnings call suggests weakness on the horizon. Pharmaceutical juggernaut Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) dazzled Wall Street once again by reporting better-than-expected third-quarter earnings results before the opening bell on Wednesday. For the quarter, Pfizer delivered $12.09 billion in revenue, a 2% year-over-year decline, while its reported net income dropped 20% to $2.13 billion from $2.67 billion. Pfizer's EPS dropped a similar 19% to $0.34 from $0.42.

HARRISBURG, Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's Office announced it is releasing more than $55 million in funding to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the money will be distributed based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. Excluding Philadelphia, all of the state's remaining 66 counties will receive money. That includes at least $57,000 to every county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. Volunteers at the Lake Silkworth Fire Department are dispatched at all hours of the day all over Luzerne County's Back Mountain.

Former Rep. Stephanie Herseth Sandlin (D-S.D.) is eager to start her K Street practice and has not decided whether she will run for elected office again. “I’m excited about this professional move,” she told Roll Call on Wednesday. The ex-Congresswoman, who lost her seat in November to Rep. Kristi Noem (R), has joined the firm Olsson Frank Weeda Terman Bode Matz as a principal. “I am continuing to work on the issues I’m passionate about,” Herseth Sandlin said.

Ray Trew has stepped down as chairman of Notts County and has announced that the League Two club is for sale. Trew, 58, became the Magpies’ first chairman in May 1993 and was appointed to the role in May 2015 after previous chairman Chris Kane was jailed for 13 years for his part in a £3.5m VAT fraud. Kane’s conviction forced Trew to step down as chairman of the Magpies and he resumed the role last May. However, he has now decided to step down from his role as chairman and the club is now up for sale.

Members of the Boone Area Chamber of Commerce community participated in the inaugural Committed to the Cause volunteer day, Wednesday, December 7th. The day of service took the place of a December business after-hours event. Chamber members and staff volunteered at three local non-profits: Hunger and Health Coalition, Watauga County Habitat for Humanity, and Hospitality House. The High Country Association of Realtors, Johnson, Price, Sprinkle CPA, and Go Postal were among the leading contributors to a canned food drive that coincided with volunteer events. Just over 375 pounds of food were delivered to Hunger and Health Coalition from the community-wide collection.

Saturday night 's game was exactly like Friday night 's game for the Amarillo Bulls in terms of score and outcome, only this time around it was in front of a crowd of 3,185 at the Budweiser Bullpen. The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country ’ s embassy in the Jordanian capital Amman after it was targeted by arsonists, the Foreign Ministry said. A fire damaged the embassy early Monday morning, and the ministry issued a statement saying that the Israeli staff had been evacuated from the building “out of caution”. It also said that “Israeli security forces are dealing with the incident in cooperation with Jordanian security forces.”
“The embassy is still standing and being monitored,” the statement said.

MOUNT PLEASANT , Sanpete County — School officials are asking students who aren ’ t up to date on immunizations or have no immunizations to keep their children at home, the district announced Thursday. There has been 10 outbreaks of whooping cough and a measles scare in Utah schools, with many students and staff getting sick. Whooping cough is a highly contagious respiratory disease that has no cure, and if not treated can last for 6 to 12 months. Measles are airborne diseases that can cause pneumonia, deafness or brain damage in young children.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at a museum after a team of archaeologists discovered the perfectly preserved body. Researchers were carrying out a dig at an ancient cemetary on the south-western Egyptian island of Qusiya when they uncovered the 500-year-old remains. Although badly damaged by the elements, she is still in a remarkably good state of preservation considering she is almost 500 years old, researchers said. In addition to her body, the archaeologists have discovered two mummies of children, one of whom is also in good condition.

Seton Catholic’s Jenna Barker set a sectional record by winning the 1,600-meter run in 5 minutes, 13.04 seconds, and also won the 800, as several area athletes qualified for the regional during Tuesday’s IHSAA girls track and field sectional at Connersville High School. Other individual sectional champions included Riley Austin of Richmond in both the 200 and the long jump, Nakala Bennett of Richmond in the 100, Hanna Stamm of Seton Catholic in the 3,200, and Austin, Lindsey Griffin, Payton Vanmiddlesworth and Riley Wetzel of Richmond in the 400 relay.

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year, Summit County’s real estate sales hit a downturn in March, leading to a noticeable dip in the county’s first-quarter figures, according to Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide variety of statistics associated with the local real estate market, and Summit saw a roughly 12 percent decline in both its number of real estate transactions and their combined value for the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company’s most recent market report.

It was a Saturday morning . August . I remember it vividly . I was online , sat up in bed with a few tabs open. I saw a post on Facebook from a mutual friend – “She is here. She is here.” I did a double take. “She who?” , I wondered “Who is here”? The name rang no bells . It could be a post on anything . It could be something completely irrelevant or mundane . So I continued scanning through posts and the next one came. It was the same friend again – “I think we need to pray.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook 's full-screen mobile ads , but Wendy 's social marketers already seem to have figured out how to make the biggest impact with them — and it's pretty simple. Instead of going for a full-width image with text, Wendy 's took the traditional 9:16 ratio format of Facebook advertising — but then made the most of it with some simple copywriting and a striking photo of one of its menu items. Finals Week . It ’ s here . We can help . Thursday , December 6 at 3pm : Zooniverse: A New Approach to Science Education. Join us as Dr. Michael Strong presents his work on citizen science and the Zooniverse project. The Zooniverse is a set of crowd-funded projects that allow anyone and everyone to contribute to scientific discovery. The Zooniverse projects involve large numbers of volunteers from all around the world contributing observations and classifications. Over 12 million volunteers have helped make discoveries, with over 2 million volunteers having contributed to one project or more. Come to this free presentation to learn more.

The Internet has changed beyond anything could have foreseen just five years ago . It is no longer a browsing medium, but a full-fledged social media platform with 2.8 billion active users on the internet. These changes have been a boon for many of the world’s largest and most innovative brands. But as many as 90 percent of all brands are still struggling to effectively leverage the power of the Internet in marketing and advertising. The problem lies in their failure to properly segment their audiences. This is an especially difficult problem for global brands and retailers that offer products and services to customers across a variety of geographic regions.

As she walked the city streets, the actress was dressed casually and comfortably for the day in a pair of skinny jeans, black knee-high boots that laced up the front, a button up shirt and a camel coloured jacket. Her husband also looked relaxed and smart as he sported a grey beanie on his head with matching shades, a plain black shirt and a grey and white striped cardigan.

Anyone who’s ever been frustrated at the task of shooting video in low light should be poised to freak out over Canon’s weird and amazing new camera. It’s a video camera that shoots full HD color footage in almost complete darkness. The ‘multi-purpose’ camera, dubbed only MH20F-SH, has a full-frame sensor with 2.26 megapixels. The reason for the meager resolution is because each pixel is very large—19 microns to be exact. That’s 7.5x larger than, say, the pixels found on a flagship DSLR like the Canon 1Dx.

BLAKELY, Pa. --More than 170,000 pounds of food was handed out to those in need in Lackawanna County. Newswatch 16 found cars lined up outside Peckville Assembly of God Church waiting to take advantage of the generosity. The church gave out hundreds of hams, turkeys and other meat as well as fresh produce and toiletries. "I do not know how to explain it to you but the food helps me pay medical bills because I save money here and I pay my bills, ya know?" said William Carter of Dickson City. Peckville Assembly of God Church gives out free food every Friday.

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years. Despite intense scientific inquiry, there are still major gaps in our knowledge about early human life. One major question that remains unanswered: when humans were first capable of complex cognition? In other words, when did early humans develop sophisticated cognitive abilities, such as prioritization and cultural transmission, that we would recognize today? A new study in Nature addresses this; after six years of excavation, archaeologists have unearthed technologically-advanced stone tools that were created about 71,000 years ago.

As Conservative Party leader William Hague made his way through the flock of the faithful at a lunchtime rally Tuesday in the village of Bournemouth, his blue-suited minders were keeping an anxious eye out for trouble. After all, these are difficult times in British politics and the polls say it may be the Conservatives' turn next time. So it was not entirely surprising when a heckler from the crowd began shouting about the possibility of a Labour victory on May 6. The crowd of about 200 Conservative supporters responded by booing and hissing.

Microsoft will release the first monthly Patch Tuesday for the calendar year next week, which will include security patches for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, Internet Explorer and Edge. There are already 10 confirmed security vulnerabilities that will be patched next week, with the company expected to release more in the coming weeks. Google has long had a testy relationship with China, with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese market after alleging that state-backed hackers had targeted the company's systems and employees. Chairman Eric Schmidt's forthcoming book, "The New Digital Age," will not smooth things over, judging by a description of the work by the Wall Street Journal, which has reviewed galleys of the unreleased title. "... in this all-Internet world, China, the book says again and again, is a dangerous and menacing superpower," Tom Gara writes.

Californians, of all people, should recognize what it means to drive people off their land. In the 1850s and 1860s, the state funded yearly expeditions that emptied entire areas of their Native American presence. But this is not only a historical phenomenon: In the West Bank, Israeli settlers and the Israeli government have attempted for decades to eradicate the small Palestinian village of Susiya. The village has existed near Hebron since at least the 19th century. In the 1980s, it was declared an archaeological site to enable settlers to move in and replace the former inhabitants.

The University of Sri Jayewardenepura celebrated 60 years of excellence in higher education on 18th February 2019 , reaching a milestone of 60 years since the establishment of the University. The Chief Guest of the inaugural event was Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa Minister of Education and Higher Education and Guest of Honour was His Excellency Prof. Lakshman Dissanayake Ambassador for Sri Lanka to Germany.

DALLAS - Like many Americans, Martin Jacobson was overjoyed that Navy SEALs had captured and killed Osama bin Laden. But the Dallas resident felt a deeper connection to the men who hunted down the mastermind of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks. Decades ago, he was one of them. During World War II, Jacobson was part of elite groups that were predecessors to the SEALs. The secretive force is used to staying out of the spotlight, but it's back in the headlines following the bin Laden killing. "I'm just proud of the SEALs," said Jacobson, 89.

THOMAS Duffy is a sculptor who is preparing a commemorative bronze to celebrate the life of a father he never knew. Thomas is the son of Tommy Duffy, who was killed in December, 1972, when a car bomb exploded in Dublin’s Sackville Place. He was born just a few months after those terrible events and has only known his father through hearing stories from family members who knew his father. He has now been commissioned by Dublin City Council and CIE, to prepare a bronze sculpture to be set in the pavement at Sackville Place commemorating the victims of the 72 and 73 bombings.

Richard Randolph Lamb , a resident of Dunsmuir , passed away on September 17 , 2009 at Mercy Medical Center . He was born in Cottage Grove , Oregon on July 25 , 1931 . He is survived by his wife of 58 years , Helen Louise (Burton) Lamb; two daughters , Judy Ann Lamb of Jacksonville , North Carolina , and Patty Jean Lamb of Oakland, California ; three granddaughters , Tiffany , Ashley and Melissa ; two great-grandsons , Austin and Colton . Richard was employed by Pacific Power Company from 1952 to 1985 . He was an avid golfer .

Ray Trew has stepped down as chairman of Notts County and has announced that the League Two club is for sale. Trew became owner and chairman in 2010 but said he made the decision after his family were subjected to "foul and mindless abuse" in recent days. Notts, who appointed Jamie Fullarton as manager in January, are 16th in League Two having been relegated last season. BBC Radio Nottingham reports local businessman Alan Hardy is in talks to buy the club. "It is with very mixed emotions that I announce the end of my tenure," Trew wrote in an open letter to fans.

The tide is turning at Frankston , with the Dolphins scoring successive victories for the first time in almost six months. In last week’s 34-16 win over the Western Magpies in the Victorian Sub-Districts Rugby League round 10, the side boasted the biggest win in the competition this year. The win also put the Dolphins level on points with the Magpies, with both sides now sitting on a four-game winning streaks. Jarred Mellor-Jones kicked four goals and played an important role at lock-forward and hooker in the back-row, while the other standout performer was Ben Hewitt, who played his first game for the club and was outstanding.

The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association has released numbers confirming the expectations of many analysts : the number of actively registered ships in Korea decreased by more than 18% from 11,355 ships at the end of 2008 to 9,119 ships by the end of November 2009. A total of 217 new ships were registered during this period. Of these new ships, 80.6% (or 180 ships) were ships for offshore businesses, with the remainder being ships for other uses. Shipbuilding activity also showed a decrease from 10,440 ships ordered by the end of 2008 to 7,486 ships in November.

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown ’ s relationship . The drama, tentatively titled “ The Bobby Brown Story,” will be an eight-part miniseries based on Brown ’ s life and career, according to Variety .com. The miniseries, which is currently in production , will detail Brown ’ s meteoric rise to fame as a backup dancer for pop-star teen group New Edition , who became the top-selling act of the ’ 80s . Variety said Brown , who now is the lead singer of R&B group B2K , could be in a cameo appearance.

Each year , the palike and state authorities ensure that Bangaloreans are forewarned before Diwali about being safe . However this year no such announcement has been made and the Diwali celebration have begun with full zeal in most parts of the city . Elected representative of the local area have asked the fire brigade officials that there has to be strict monitoring of illegal fire works and fire crackers being sold. It should also be made mandatory that all fire works must have the BIS mark before it being sold . It should not be possible for any shop to sell fire works without BIS mark .

Hull - Where the US goes the UK often follows. This is especially true of negatives. If the US has extreme weather we usually experience similar a few days later. If violent crime increases across the Pond likewise in the UK. Then there is shopping madness. The UK is taking up traditional US activities such as Christmas shopping bargain days that leave customers with empty wallets and a range of unwanted goods. Black Friday has just passed and today is Cyber Monday. Each have become big shopping days on both sides of the Pond.

A family travels to a remote island in southern Chile. In the trip they try to convince the grandparents to support them financially to build a hotel in the place. Nicolás, the man who took them over on his boat, disappears, leaving the family trapped on the island, the smiles begin to disappear. With cold, without water and without certainties, tempers are diluted, exposing the tensions that each member of the family hides. Selva (13) discovers that death is just the shedding of our skin. We can become wolfs, goats, shadows or anything that fantasy allows.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform . Battles , a safety , was brought in as a part-time participant after the Steelers had to part with Troy Polamalu and Ryan Clark as free agents . It's safe to say Cleveland Browns cornerback and ASU alum Damarious Randall wasn't expecting a response like this. After the Warriors advanced to the NBA Finals on Monday night to set up a rematch with the Cleveland Cavaliers, Randall made a guarantee on Twitter: "If the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2018 NBA finals I’ll buy everyone who retweets this a jersey..."
Well, as of Wednesday afternoon, Randall's tweet has been retweeted over 800,000 times. That's a lot of jerseys -- more than Randall could likely afford to give away.

NEW DELHI: A day after declaring its candidate for the seventh Lok Sabha seat, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday made it clear that there would be neither any alliance with the Congress nor a rollback of any of its candidates in Delhi. Asserting that "enough is enough", senior AAP leader Gopal Rai said these are the final seven candidates of the party and there is no question of "any roll back". The ruling AAP had earlier on March 2, announced the names of its candidates for the six Lok Sabha seats.

Google is updating its Google Drive Android app with a new Material Design look , as well as a few useful new features. The new Google Drive app lets you create, edit, and share your files right from your Android device. The revamped Google Drive experience looks like any other Google product, making it easier to tell which files you're looking at. The Google Drive app for Android has also been updated with new sharing controls. You can now decide who to share a file with and set them to receive notifications about the file, even when they're not using Google Drive.

Drones come in a wide variety of different shapes and sizes these days , but generally speaking , most of them fall into one of three different size groups: micro , micro , and standard size . If you're looking to fly a drone as a recreational pilot in the US, the standard-size drones are the size you need . These drones are larger than micro ones , and can typically fly at a higher maximum distance . However , there are exceptions to the standard rule , and in fact , you may want to consider buying a micro-sized drone for some of your aerial photography work .

(WXIA) -- New Year's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year. This year, the Governor's Office of Highway Safety is doing more to prevent alcohol-related crashes. According to a release, law enforcement will distribute 50,000 drink coasters in some of the state's busiest bar districts. The coasters will contain a QR code to guide patrons to a directory of services that will help them get home safely if they've had too much to drink. THe GOHS also offers a smartphone app that connects users to cab and tow companies. Check out the Drive Sober app.

WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel on Thursday for causing an "extreme hardship on many families and businesses" and promised to tighten sanitation standards. Steve Levitt of Hy-Line International, testifying before a House appropriations subcommittee, said the company has tightened internal procedures and implemented new technology to safeguard against future salmonella outbreaks. "We want to do everything we can to assure this never happens again," he told the panel, which had been investigating why hundreds of people became sick after eating eggs produced by Iowa Fresh Egg Co. in December.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders . The move involves placing a bench against a backboard and using your body weight to lift a dumbbell or weight. This exercise should only be performed with lighter weights to avoid a strain on the shoulder muscles. The bench press is best performed with your arms extended away from your body, as opposed to bringing your hands together during the rep, or with a dumbbell held in each hand, as is done in a flat bench press.

Craig Watson ( top ) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on a post office, where a security guard was shot in the face. A court heard how Watson, then aged 17, and Stephenson, then 14, went into the premises in St Mary’s Walk, Blackpool, armed with a sawn-off shotgun and a knife, and demanded money from the postmaster. A court heard how Watson, now aged 18, was sentenced for two counts of robbery, and for possessing a firearm while committing an indictable offence and possessing an imitation firearm.

You know what I’m talking about. Those roundaway girls with their big booties,” a deadpan Hamm/Draper tells the “Def Comedy Jam” audience, clad in a gray suit, scotch in hand.

LAS VEGAS—Bitdefender has updated its network security gadget, now known as New Bitdefender Box or Box Version 2, which is designed to protect home networks and Internet of Things devices from outside attack. The original Bitdefender Box extended security protection to devices that could not run antivirus software themselves, specifically IoT devices. By moving security protection to the network level, Box products protect all the devices on the network, including fridges, game consoles, and security cameras.

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames in Hampton Court Park. The boy was reported missing at about 5.45pm on Saturday (April 27) after he had been spotted by other members of his family and had gone underwater. Three teams of volunteer divers from Hampton, Chessington and Sunbury Scuba Search & Rescue Unit attended the incident, and the body was recovered after an extensive search. The boy’s family, who are being supported by a family liaison officer, have been informed of the incident and are being kept updated on the progress of the search.

WASHINGTON ( Alliance News ) - Gold prices held steady on Thursday after the Fed 's latest report on the economy and consumer sentiment showed the central bank's outlook for further interest rate hikes has dimmed. The Fed said on Thursday that while it still anticipates at least two rate increases this year, it is now expecting the pace of tightening to slow this year. The Fed also said in a separate statement on Thursday that consumer sentiment improved slightly in April, although it remained well below its average level during 2007-09. Gold prices had tumbled 1.2 percent to $1,291.80 by 0802 GMT.

About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh on Friday, calling on the governments of the Kingdom of Thailand, Kingdom of Vietnam and Kingdom of Laos not to grant the companies the land. "The Thai government should not approve the company to have the land because the company has been accused of polluting the Mekong River and destroying natural resources, but the Lao government recently approved the company to have 86,000 hectares of land," Sopha Seng, deputy governor of Kandal's Svay Prey district, said, speaking during a press conference at the Thai Embassy on Friday.

Scout Gil Brandt of the Dallas Cowboys , the last member of the original group that built the Cowboys from scratch to become the most successful franchise in NFL history, passed away Tuesday in his Dallas home after a short illness. Brandt was 86. His death leaves Hall of Fame quarterbacks Roger Staubach and Troy Aikman as the only Cowboys still with the team. “We are so grateful to everyone who had a hand in making our organization the great one it is,” owner Jerry Jones said in a statement Tuesday night. “We lost a lot of good men today.

Moshiach ( also known as messiah ) is the long awaited Jewish leader who will usher in an era of peace and prosperity. Moshiach will rule over Israel in its biblical borders and will bring an era of global peace. In Jewish tradition, the Messiah has not come and we are still in the time of exile. Jews wait for their messiah to come to liberate them from their current state of exile, to gather the lost tribes and to live in a world without suffering or pain. Mashiach will be of the descendants of King David. He will bring a period of prosperity and peace.

Plenty of reasons exist to be skeptical of the 'smart home ' in its current form , but Amazon 's Alexa may be one of the smartest reasons to be optimistic about home automation. Since its arrival in late 2014, the Echo has slowly become a central part of Amazon's hardware strategy: The company recently announced that more than half of all Amazon-branded devices purchased last year were its smart speakers, and it's planning to open a store dedicated to Echo, Echo Dot, and Alexa features. There are lots of good reasons to own an Echo.

A new logo to help identify how the community feels about the Seminole County school system soon will be developed. The logo, which will take the place of the "Sunburst," will be part of a $32,500 project. The district plans to hold a contest for the design of the new symbol. Schools Superintendent Charles Dahlgren said the logo will be for the entire system, including elementary, middle, junior high and high schools. The contest will be open to all district students, staff members and others in the community who are interested in taking part.

While this is not the first time the Rainiers have brought out the reindeer, they’ve never made a stop in the Puget Sound region this early in the year. ( WXIA ) -- New Year 's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year . This year could be even more dangerous than ever. That's because two of the deadliest drugs known to man, alcohol and heroin , have combined. Heroin-laced with fentanyl , the potent opioid that killed Prince , is a growing problem. Georgia Poison Center is getting calls daily from people worried they took fentanyl . "People aren't aware and they think it is heroin but it is 10 times more potent," executive director Dr. Jennifer Sullivan said .

KENTON, Del. - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a Listeria outbreak has been inspected 10 times since the year 2000. An FDA spokeswoman says during that time, the presence of Listeria was never found at Roos Food's Inc. The agency also never received complaints. The recent outbreak left eight people sick. Seven were in Maryland. One died in California. FDA inspectors found a multitude of violations inside and outside the plant during the inspection that took place between February 18 - March 4, 2014.

Long flights can be rough on the body, so it’s not uncommon to see people walking around the plane to stretch their legs. However one woman took it even farther by performing a yoga flow in the middle of the aisle. Kate Kay, a yoga teacher who was traveling for training, was captured on a now viral video by another passenger, showing her performing leg stretches, camel pose and a forward fold. Dressed for the occasion in patterned yoga pants and wearing headphones, Kay seems unaffected by those around her as she goes through the moves.

Leon Conaway , 56 , who was owner and operator of Twisted Roots , entered a plea agreement that recommending that he serve 36 years in prison for first-degree murder for the slaying of his wife in 2005. He pleaded guilty Thursday to second- degree murder . Conaway was scheduled to go on trial on Feb. 28 . But, he changed his mind at the 11 th hour. In exchange for his plea, the prosecution said it would not pursue a sentencing enhancement , which would add an additional 15 years to his prison sentence for being a gang member during the murder .

Casey Brumbeloe , a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School , has been selected to serve on the Alabama State Student Advisory Council for Special Education for 2012-2013. She was honored with this appointment at the 12th annual Alabama Special Education Conference in Montgomery last week. Brumbeloe, 18, was chosen for her outstanding scholastic ability and her dedication to serving children with disabilities through her participation as a student advocate. As one of 20 students across the state to be selected for the statewide council, Casey will represent the 13th Congressional District and will serve a one-year term beginning May 1.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative . Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it has registered to sell retirement plans as a fiduciary. This means that it's not responsible for investment performance. Instead, it's legally bound to make recommendations for investments that would be in the best interest of the customer. That's good news for the industry and investors, who should see a boost in plan offerings and lower plan management costs, experts say. Betterment says it already has 210,000 clients and plans to open up to new customers in the fourth quarter of this year.

TICKETS for Manchester United's pre-season friendly against Barcelona are on sale for almost £1,000 each. And a season ticket at Liverpool, at £710, costs less too. Fans are being told to pay £973 for the most expensive seat at the 68,500-capacity Levi's Stadium in California when the footballing giants meet on July 25. It's £48.66 for the cheapest ticket. The Levi's Stadium, which is home to the San Francisco 49ers, is hosting an MLS game between San Jose Earthquakes and Houston Dynamo a day before. Fans who want to see United in action will have to purchase a ticket for that game as well.

There ’ s a Speed Graphic camera , once standard equipment in newsrooms across the country . You may have seen one in some of the old movies. It was designed for the news photographers back in the day before there was any digital stuff to carry around.

Former Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in the killing of Laquan McDonald, who was gunned down while on the ground by the officer’s gunfire. Van Dyke, 40, was charged in 2015 with first-degree murder, aggravated battery and official misconduct after he shot McDonald 16 times as the 17-year-old walked down an empty street carrying a small knife. Following his sentencing, which comes nearly three years after Chicago police revealed the dashcam footage of the shooting, Van Dyke will be taken into custody to begin his six-year sentence.

Shall we pause for just a moment to define impact investing ? Great ! Now that they ’ re gone, here’ s a quick recap. An impact investor puts their own capital into companies, organisations, or projects in the expectation of achieving both a financial return and a measurable social, or environmental, positive impact. It’s an attractive idea, both on the giving and on the receiving side, but what are the real risks, and why is it only a very small percentage of the investment capital in Australia is being directed in this way?

Sanford already has private attorneys. Garber said he was hired to protect the institution of the governor's office and to help lawmakers realize the gravity of their deliberations. "The eyes of the world are on South Carolina," Garber said Tuesday, adding lawmakers' decision on whether to impeach Sanford will have ramifications for future S.C. governors and the state. Garber said Sanford's disappearance for five days in June to secretly visit his lover in Argentina does not meet the high standard required for impeachment. The state Constitution says serious crimes or other serious misconduct are the only reasons for impeachment.

( Newser ) – After a car fatally hit a 70-year-old pedestrian , the driver 's insurance company sought payment from the deceased man s estate. The insurer s lawyers sent letters to the man's widow, arguing she was responsible because she signed the insurance forms for the policy. It's a tactic that's not unheard of. The practice is known as "assignment," and it's legal in 38 states. It allows an insurer to recover from a third party instead of the person responsible for the accident. "It's legal. It's not ethical."

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law requiring anti-domestic violence messages in video games rated "mature." The lawyer says the law, which went into effect on January 1, is "an unconstitutional violation of the First Amendment." He says it is too vague and is aimed at protecting children, which is not the government's function. A federal district court judge ruled against the law, saying it was too vague, but the California Supreme Court reversed the judge, saying it was not too vague.

WASHINGTON — South Florida has long been a laboratory for some of the nation ’ s roughest politics , with candidates spending hundreds of millions of dollars to promote their causes and tear down their opponents in campaign after campaign . But this election cycle could be the mother lode. The combination of a Democratic presidential primary and two closely contested House races has set the area abuzz with a frenzy of money as the campaign enters its home stretch . Since the last presidential primary here in March, nearly $130 million in political ad spending has been paid for by South Florida candidates and their allied groups .

Randy Pausch died last Friday . He was the Carnegie Mellon Professor who ’ s “ Last Lecture ” became an internet sensation and was published as a book. Pausch had the chance to see his childhood dream ( being an astronaut) come true . He went to space in 2005 and was part of the astronaut crew on a NASA Space Shuttle mission. Pausch had to give a lecture at CMU in March 2007 . He called this his “ Final Lecture ” . He knew his terminal cancer and that it would kill him soon .

Now the-90-year-old from Portsmouth has had last wish granted to see the Blues play one last time thanks to a new scheme at her care home. The Ferns Care Home in Fareham arranged for Gloria to watch her favourite team take on Rochdale at Fratton Park – and she was delighted with the result. JERUSALEM (JTA) — Israel’s military used unnecessary force against protesters in Lebanon who tried to breach the border during demonstrations on Nakba Day, a United Nations report said. The report, given to members of the U.N. Security Council and obtained by the Israeli daily newspaper Haaretz, was prepared by U.N. special coordinator for Lebanon, Michael Williams. Israel’s Foreign Ministry has severed contact with Williams until further notice over the report, according to the newspaper. Seven Lebanese protesters died during the May 14 demonstrations marking the day that Israel became an independent state.

Dundee United are to begin talks in the next few days in an attempt to prevent Scotland striker Steven Thompson leaving the club for nothing in the summer. New Tannadice owner Eddie Thompson is angry that recently sacked manager Alex Smith and the previous board had not already moved to secure the 23-year-old on a new deal. Striker Thompson is out of contract next summer. By then, he will have turned 24 and be able to leave for another club without United being due any compensation. He can begin talking to potential new clubs in January.

The infamous Kiran Dhawan murder case is all set to take centre stage once again with the police trying to trace a mysterious woman who appeared on the scene after 22 years. The police are trying to get in touch with the woman, whose name and address they do not have, through a media house to find out whether she has any information on the case. "We do not know who she is, but she is a mystery woman who we need to know more about," said Additional Commissioner of Police (Crime) Ravindra Yadav.

After the Chiefs ’ season came to an end in the AFC Championship Game , Dee Ford said he has no plans to change his tattoo . Ford has been in the headlines recently due to the content of his tattoo, especially after the NFL announced that they were making a policy change that prohibits players from wearing sleeves during games. The Chiefs OLB, however, remains committed to his tattoo and will keep his sleeve as part of the team’s uniform. In 2017, Ford made it clear that he wasn’t planning to change the tattoo, saying he plans on keeping it as long as possible.

Nobody can predict with accuracy when stock markets will end their record-setting bull run . But the best way for investors to be prepared is to start thinking now about what steps to take once a bear market does begin. In the meantime, investors will have to be prepared for continued volatility in the markets . The best way to prepare for a bear market is to stay well diversified and avoid chasing the highest returns . This also makes it much easier to rebalance a portfolio once a bear market does begin. This means that investors should continue to be broadly diversified across a mix of both equities and fixed income investments.

Mickey Boodaei has been a leading entrepreneur in the security space for years . He co-founded Imperva , which went public, as a 34 year old. More recently he was an Executive Chairman of CyberArk , which was acquired at a $4.2B valuation, also taking it public. He is currently the Chairman of AppThera, a venture fund for AI companies focused on Cybersecurity. A 2018 Forbes profile described him as “the Israeli Steve Jobs of cyber security.” Before Imperva, Boodaei was a principal at Paladin Capital, a leading venture capital firm.

Shares of AOL Inc. shot up 19 % in premarket trade Tuesday , after the Internet content company agreed to buy the remaining 25 % of the video-streaming service Hulu that it didn't own. AOL agreed to pay about $1.4 billion for the stake, people familiar with the transaction said, and AOL said Tuesday that it expects to close the deal in the first half of this year. AOL also agreed to pay about $200 million to take Hulu off the hook for certain liabilities, people familiar with the matter added.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state. Repeat drunk driving offenders could soon face harsher penalties for their actions. New Jersey law now limits punishment for affected offenders to a traffic offense. Bail typically is set at $2,500. The traffic offense designation allows drivers charged with drunken driving to continue to drive while awaiting their court date. Awaiting consideration on the Assembly floor is a bill to end that practice. Instead, A3057 would boost punishment for a person convicted of driving under the influence two times or more within 60 days to a fourth-degree crime.

Britain's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his first event after injury. Brownlee's 2017 season ended in August when he had hip surgery. His time of 3 hours 35 minutes 32 seconds was more than six minutes ahead of second-placed Swiss Sven Riederer. The Dubai event is the first of a triple crown series, with Brownlee on course for a $1m (£703,000) bonus if he claims all three. An Ironman 70.3, or half Ironman, combines a 1.2-mile swim, a 56-mile bike ride, and a 13.1-mile run.

The best element of M. Night Shyamalan's 2017 horror film, Split - and one of the few things it did right - happened at the very end. The brief, surprising reveal of Bruce Willis reprising his David Dunn character from Unbreakable created a shared universe that Shyamalan was all-too-eager to exploit. Unfortunately, there's a wide gulf between teasing fans with a momentary appearance and building a story around it. Glass, the third film in what has become a trilogy, comes across as a mix of half-formed ideas baked into an uneven casserole.

KARACHI: Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah on Tuesday extended Pakistan Rangers, Sindh’s special powers, which were due to expire on Jan 10, for another 90 days. Mr Shah approved a summary to extend the special powers from Jan 11 to April 10, 2018 in view of Rangers’ achievements in targeted operations against terrorists, targeted killers and extortionists. In addition to this, the chief minister granted time scale and service structure to lower grade employees of the irrigation department. The employees had been appointed on non-promotional posts and the decision will benefit 28,971 of them.

Vodafone Hutchison Australia (VHA) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G networks in Australia, saying although his company is forging ahead, he doesn’t anticipate consumer devices to be in market until at least the end of 2019. Berroeta declined to talk about any spectrum ambitions for Australian 5G, instead stressing that the new “ecosystem” for the mobile technology need to be put into place first before carriers started pushing product. He said he expected “most of the market” would be launching 5G either side of a one or two month window period when it arrived.

NEW YORK — Just before noon on Wednesday, Australian ambassador and president of the United Nations Arms Trade Treaty conference, Peter Woolcott, released his final version of the global gun control agreement. Upon publication of the document, Woolcott informed delegates that they have 24 hours to confer with their respective governments and then report tomorrow for a final vote. LOS ANGELES – A bid to grant subpoena power to the watchdog commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department will be challenged at a hearing Friday. The county Board of Supervisors has approved an $11 million settlement for the families of those killed or injured by the county’s deputies in the last two years. Supervisors also have approved $12 million to cover the commission’s investigation into the department, a probe that’s cost $2.6 million so far. The commission is now asking for subpoena power to look into allegations of misconduct and to hold public hearings.

DENVER (AP) — The nonpartisan administrator of Colorado’s state Senate has warned staff, aides and interns that policy forbids them from speaking to journalists about workplace issues — including sexual harassment. KUNC-FM reported Tuesday that Senate Secretary Effie Ameen sent two emails reminding workers that giving interviews to reporters is a violation of chamber policy. Ameen sent the emails in February and March as the Senate’s GOP leadership was insisting that sexual misconduct and workplace harassment complaints against lawmakers either be handled confidentially — per the Legislature’s workplace harassment policy — or by prosecutors.

Long flights can be rough on the body , so it ’ s not uncommon to see people walking around with their heads down , slumping their shoulders . It ’ s probably not a great idea , because the neck muscles in the back are connected to the spine , which is responsible for supporting the entire body . When your neck is hunched , all of the weight of your upper body is shifted onto the shoulders , which can lead to tense , sore , and stiff muscles . To avoid all of the above , it ’ s important to stay active on a long flight .

A police officer has been struck from the force for his behaviour with his partner during their relationship . A report from the Independent Office for Police Conduct heard from 11 witnesses and also obtained a number of screenshots from the pair's social media accounts. The IPC has now issued a final report in the case and has recommended a number of further steps including training for the police force. The married police officer and his partner had a relationship over a number of years before they separated in February 2014. During the relationship, he sent his partner messages and screenshots of conversations between him and other members of the force.

An adviser to Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas has quit in protest at the continuing stalemate in talks with Israel. Ahmad Melhem's departure follows that of Palestinian Foreign Minister Riyad al-Maliki.

U.S. trade policy has become the top concern among chief financial officers , according to a CNBC quarterly survey . The trade war dominated CFO concerns for a second time this year, with tariffs and global trade tensions overshadowing worries about the domestic economy and rising labor costs. “We’re seeing more of an impact this time from the tariffs than in the first quarter,” said Doug Wood, CFO of global shipping company DHL. “That’s largely because the first time around we were still in a soft-landing phase, but now we’re in full-on trade-war mode,” he said.

GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Officials with the Piedmont Triad International Airport announced Thursday that Allegiant Air will begin a new, nonstop low-fare flight service from PTI to Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. The service will begin June 6 with twice-weekly flights from PTI on Thursdays and Sundays. “We’re pleased to announce yet another affordable and convenient way for our Piedmont Triad customers to get away,” said Allegiant president Andrew Levy. The flight time is estimated to be about two hours. Allegiant is offering a special introductory, one-way fare of $64.99.

Dec 25 ( Reuters ) - The Saudi market fell on Tuesday , as plunging oil prices pressured petrochemical stocks, while consumer-oriented companies rose on a weakening riyal. The index shed 1.2 percent to 8,138 points, as petrochemicals stocks slid 4 percent, dragging the index down on the day and over the past month, according to data on the website of index provider Tadawul. Petrochemical companies were hit by declines in petrochemical prices, while some shares traded at a large discount to the exchange's pricing methodology, said a trader, who did not want to be named.

THE pound has surged against the euro and dollar as Theresa May announced plans to launch a snap election later this year. The Prime Minister plans to hold a General Election on June 8, she said outside Downing Street this morning. The pound is now at its highest level against the US dollar since last December. Sterling ended up 1.6 cents at 1.2762 against the US dollar - a four month high. It has also hit an eight-week high against the euro, ending at 1.1926. The pound had hit a three-week high against the dollar but dropped to 1.25, ahead of May's announcement.

Austria, Spain and South Korea have been approved as founding members of the Asia Infrastructure and Investment Bank (AIIB), the Chinese Finance Ministry announced Saturday. A founding member of the bank has the right to help write its rules and Saturday’s additions bring the number of prospective founders to 41. The exact number of founding members will be finalized on April 15. Any country that joined the AIIB after March 31 will only be allowed to be an ordinary member, which means they have voting rights but less say in making the rules.

From M1917 to M1A2, American tanks have dominated the battlefield. The U.S. Army and Marine Corps are on the cusp of a centennial—the 100th anniversary of the tank in U.S. service. This animated GIF, put together by the folks at partcatalog.com, shows the evolution of the American tank—from the clanky M1917 light tank to the M1A2 Abrams—and shows how the U.S. went from a newcomer to the world of tanks to world leader. The M1917 light tank, for example, was merely a copy of the Renault FT-17. That kind of copycat engineering is an idea that would be unthinkable now.

BLOOMINGTON – The U.S. Attorney ’ s office has charged two local men with conspiring to distribute crack cocaine in Bloomington, in a case stemming from an investigation that began late last year. According to court records, 53-year-old James A. Johnson was arrested Tuesday afternoon after investigators found him with three grams of crack cocaine. His bond was set at $100,000 on a charge of conspiring to possess cocaine base, a felony that could bring a maximum sentence of life in prison or the death sentence if the amount of crack cocaine involved exceeds five grams.

With the economy beginning to stall , Ben Bernanke 's war on the nation 's savers rolls on . A recent report by Bankrate shows savers in the US continue to get hammered as banks cut interest rates on savings deposits even lower . According to a study of 342 savings account rates, 323 banks, credit unions and thrifts reported a reduction in savings account rates since November. According to a study by Bankrate.com, banks and credit unions have slashed their rates an average of 0.16 percent since Nov. 6, when the federal funds rate was slashed a half percentage point to 1%.

Sarah Haire heard rumblings about a storm approaching the coastline , but she expected it all to blow over . However, within 12 hours she was battling flash floods as the sea surged through her garden. The 55-year-old had been in bed for about 15 minutes when it all started at her home in Southview Road, Bognor Regis, just after 7am on Saturday. Her husband, Robert, was on his way to work and she was about to leave to join her daughter on holiday when the weather started to worsen. The pair had to stay in bed as the surge washed over their door.

MELBOURNE , Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4 , 4-6 , 6-3 in the WTA Sydney International on Friday to reach the quarter-finals. Azarenka, who is still working on her match fitness after missing almost six months through injury, looked on the way out when she was broken to fall 5-4 behind in the second set . However, the former world number one recovered to win the tie-breaker and book a match with eighth-seeded Italian Flavia Pennetta. "She played a very solid match," said 23-year-old Azarenka after extending her winning streak to five matches.

Dec 25 (Reuters) - The Saudi market fell on Tuesday, as plunging oil prices pressured petrochemical stocks, while Riyad Bank was the top gainer, reaching a four-year high after saying it was in merger talks with National Commercial Bank (NCB). The Dubai index was the sole gainer of the session, inching up on the back of rises in its banking shares, with most major Gulf bourses slipping on tepid global sentiment and weak oil prices. Oil prices plunged to their lowest level in more than a year on Monday, as fears of an economic slowdown weighed on the market.

Shares of AOL Inc. shot up 19% in premarket trade Tuesday, after the Internet content company agreed to be acquired by Verizon Communications Inc. in a deal valued at $4.4 billion. Under terms of the deal, which will take the form of a tender offer that is followed by a merger, Verizon will pay $50 for each AOL share, which represents a 17% premium to Monday's closing price. I'm no apologist for "moderate Republicans" but it is worth saying that Leach was, in my estimation, fairly clearly the best House Republican. Nevertheless, one can only be thrilled with his defeat.
