Google is trying to save presentation audiences from having to sit through long rambling questions with a new feature it added to its Slides software on Wednesday. Slides Q&A will let audiences send text questions through the Web when listening to a presentation using Google's software. As a presenter is talking, she can see the questions and respond to them, without waiting for someone to speak into a microphone. Google Slides Q&A's presenter view lets presenters see what people in their audience want to know. In addition to submitting questions, audience members can also vote on which ones they want to see answered.

Rawalpindi : The secondary students of Sadeeqa’s Learning System (SLS) Montessori & High School celebrated Autism Awareness Day, says a press release. The Harley Street Senior Branch held a special assembly in this regard creating awareness among the students about the Autism Spectrum Disorder by highlighting its causes, symptoms and ways to cope up with it. The special assembly started off with an introduction about the day outlined in the form of a dialogue between a doctor and a student discussing various features of the disorder. The students were informed about the severity of the disorder depending upon the age, its causes and treatment.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products. A promotion that went awry last month has led BlackBerry to cut ties with T-Mobile after numerous years of working together. BlackBerry on Wednesday announced that it will not renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products when it expires April 25. T-Mobile offended the Canadian phone maker in February when it messaged its BlackBerry users with an offer to switch to the iPhone 5s for $0 down. The Seattle carrier tried to make amends with a second promotion, offering BlackBerry users $200 in credit when they traded in their device for any new T-Mobile phone.

MBOMBELA - National Assembly speaker Baleka Mbete on Saturday appealed to parents in general to be `` polite '' so that their children and youngsters have a better relationship with one another. She said it is imperative that South Africa's society was respectful, polite and considerate in dealing with one another. `` Children and young people must be taught respect and courtesy, '' Mbete said in her address to thousands of matriculants at St Mary's High School in the KwaZulu-Natal Midlands. She was speaking at a special graduation ceremony held on the school's grounds in honour of students from the area who were celebrating after successfully completing their exams.

There are plenty of products out there that make it possible to create narrated walk-throughs of content, but most of these tend to be either static PowerPoint-style slide shows or video-based walk-throughs. What if instead of static images and files, you wanted to walk people through live Web pages, or even a mix of live Web pages and static content such as images and media? That's the purpose of FlowGram's Flowgrams. Available at flowgram.com, Flowgram is a free beta Web service that lets users combine live Web pages and other content and create a shareable narrated walk-through.

Zoho offers a whopping 43 different applications in its Zoho One cloud suite , but it has more in the works. It's not yet clear whether these new features will make it into the next version of the application, or if Zoho intends to release them as separate applications, like the Zoho Campus Learning Suite, the company announced. Microsoft is adding new business intelligence (BI) capabilities to the Azure data warehouse service, aimed at making the service more competitive with the likes of Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services. Google is launching a new feature for Google My Business to help users get discovered on the search engine.

Recently, my elderly mother visited her bank located in Eastland shopping center in West Covina. On leaving, she was approached by a woman holding an infant asking for food money for her baby, claiming she had recently arrived from Italy and had no money or means of support. As is so common with elderly folks I have known, she didn’t hesitate to give the woman five dollars. Being the soft heart she is, my mom quizzed her for all the sad details. The woman thanked her and moved on to others in the parking lot.

A report is expected to be released Tuesday detailing how an unknown cyber hacker broke into South Carolina's computers and stole millions of tax returns from residents dating back years. NBC's Michael Isikoff reports. COLUMBIA, S.C. -- A single malicious email sent to workers at the South Carolina Department of Revenue last August enabled an international hacker to crack into state computers and gain access to 3.8 million tax returns, including Social Security numbers and bank account information, in what experts say is the biggest cyber-attack ever against a state government, according to details in a report released Tuesday.

Not only did former BP chief executive Tony Hayward go sailing on his yacht at the height of the oil-spill crisis, but he’s also not sorry about it. In his first interview since stepping down as CEO of BP, Tony Hayward told the BBC that seeing his son for the first time in three months was just as important. "I have to confess, at the time was pretty angry actually,” he said of the fierce backlash from the White House and people in the Gulf of Mexico. “I hadn't seen my son for three months.

This charming 3 bedroom home is conveniently located just 1/2 mile from shopping and restaurants, across the street from hundreds of acres of DEP of protected lands, and within close proximity to the many activities that out of towners travel to experience in the Catskill Mountains. Tube the Espous, bike the rail-trail, visit the world's largest Kaleidoscope, reminisce with a stroll through Woodstock, or ski three major resorts all within a 20-30 minute drive. This cozy home with one car garage is sited on a 1.2 acre lot with areas that are ideal for a fire-pit surrounded by Adirondack style chairs.

For small businesses that sell on credit , accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet . For example, if you have 100 customers and you sell $ 10,000 per month, your accounts receivable will be 100 times 10, or $ 1,000,000 . It's not surprising that managing cash receipts can be a challenge. The following are a few simple steps you can take to keep track of receivables, whether you have a manual or computerized system. Auditing customers for creditworthiness is an essential part of accounts receivable management .

South Dade will be looking to win its sixth straight Class 3A state title this weekend. South Dade enters the FHSAA state wrestling tournament this weekend as the favorite to win a sixth-straight Class 3A team title, but not as big a favorite as they’ve been in recent seasons. Leading the way for the Bucs are returning state champions Bretli Reyna, Brevin Balmeceda, and Todd Perry. Tyler Orta, Joshua Swan, and Eric Temes have finished on the podium before and their performances this weekend will go a long way toward assuring South Dade wins another team title.

They look a bit frightful , but vultures are nature 's greatest cleanup crew . They 're amazing creatures with a very useful purpose. We can not imagine what this earth would be like without these majestic birds cleaning up the dead carcasses of thousands of animals. If it were not for the vultures nature would look very, very ugly and unpleasant. Vultures are amazing scavengers, and they can often be spotted in the middle of the night flying around . They are also very strong. They can lift 15 to 20 kg (33 lb to 44 lb), more than five times heavier than themselves.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Associate to join our specialist Partnership Compliance team . The team is growing and there is a great opportunity for someone who is ready for the next step up in their career. You will manage a team of up to 30 Compliance staff and be responsible for compliance with regulations, ensuring that all activities carried out by the Compliance team are in line with the firm’s risk appetite and the regulatory requirements. You will work with other team leaders and other compliance teams throughout the firm to ensure consistency in approach.

The spat between the Intelligence agencies of the US and its democratically elected President Donald Trump is not only bizarre but also for that reason, an extraordinary case study for evaluating the mandate that should determine the relationship between the National Intelligence and the Political Executive in a democratic dispensation. Ideally speaking, the national security set up anchored on Intelligence, exercises the sovereign function of detecting and tracking any threat to national security –external or internal –with the aim of neutralising it in time. At the same time, however, it does this on the authority of the elected Political Executive that is the ultimate repository of all sovereignty in a democracy.

WATCH ABOVE: The National Lacrosse League and the Professional Lacrosse Players' Association have yet to reach a new collective bargaining agreement, threatening the start of the 2019 season. Ryan Flaherty reports. The National Lacrosse League (NLL) announced Thursday it reluctantly has no choice but to cancel the first two weekends of the 2018-19 season due to a labour dispute with its players. NLL has been negotiating with the Professional Lacrosse Players’ Association (PLPA) — the exclusive bargaining agent for players — and a collective bargaining agreement has not been reached.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama “Beautiful Boy” – not the slasher-flick “Halloween” – is the most terrifying movie opening at the multiplex this weekend. Starring Steve Carell (“Foxcatcher”) and Timothee Chalamet (“Call Me by Your Name”), the movie is a chilling and unsettling look at a young man’s plunge into meth addiction (and heroin, pills, pot, etc.) and a devoted father’s efforts to save him. It’s a true and horrifying story so powerful that an uninspired director and clichéd script can’t dilute its impact.

DENVER -- During the summer of 2002 , Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to find out how it ignited and what it could have done had it not been stopped when it was. Then the 127-square-mile West Fork Complex of three wildfires threatened the city of Denver. Now the state has to deal with the Black Forest Fire, which burned 50,614 acres of land and destroyed 389 homes as of July 4, 2013. The number of homes that were burned during the three-week blaze is the most of any wildfire in Colorado history.

Four-term Governor Terry Branstad officially begins his fifth term today. Branstad, a Republican, left office in January of 1999 after serving 16 years as governor. In October of 2009, Branstad retired from his job as president of Des Moines University, the state’s largest medical school, and launched what he called a “comeback” bid for governor. Branstad is scheduled to take the oath of office at about 10:15 this morning. Branstad told a group of reporters and editors last week his wife, Chris, has urged him not to give a long, boring speech.

Trisha Pollard believes the Texas social services system relies too much on the courts to police Medicaid fraud and not enough on audits of providers. That may explain why she has filed a whistleblower lawsuit alleging that two major Texas Medicaid health care providers submitted false billing to the state health insurance plan. According to her lawsuit filed last month in Travis County District Court, the two companies -- the Healthcare Services Group and Medistar, Inc. -- overcharged the Texas Medicaid program for services allegedly not rendered. Medistar, which operates a long-term care facility, is headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas.

Speaker Nabih Berri and Syria’s ambassador to Lebanon Friday discussed “Israeli-Western schemes” in the Syrian civil war, a statement from Berri’s office reported. The Lebanese Army Friday set up a security cordon in preparation to blow up a cache of old weapons found in the Sidon area of Sinniq. Lebanese workers staged 28 strikes and 121 protests in 2018, including strikes in the state-run electricity provider Electricite Du Liban and the Lebanese University, a rights monitor reported Friday. An Iranian national has been arrested in Beirut on charges of people smuggling and forging legal documents, according to a report published in Asharq al-Awsat newspaper Friday.

Bella Hadid Wild Partying And Drinking In NYC: RHOBH Star Gigi Hadid Refuses To “Babysit” Little Sister – Too Busy Modeling! Bella Hadid is a party animal, and the 18 year old’s boozing is getting out of control. Bella, the younger sister of model and fashion icon Gigi Hadid, recently moved to New York City to kickstart her own modeling career, but her modeling gigs have taken a backseat to her partying and excessive drinking. This season of Real Housewives of Beverly Hills featured a distraught Yolanda Foster rushing home from a vacation when she learned that her teen daughter had been arrested for a DUI.

The sixth race of the Charlevoix Yacht Club 's summer series was sailed on Aug. 8 in light and variable winds out of the southwest in Lake Michigan . This time we were treated to a sunset race, with a great view of the sky as the sun set behind the club. The winner in the 116 boat fleet was the J/70 "Sweet Tooth", with crew of John Hitchcock, Brian Flynn, Andy Dewire and Brad Frost, and helm of Andy Dewire. Second place went to another J/70, "Storm Warning", skippered by Jake Fish, with crew of John Hitchcock, David Fowles and Steve Hatch.

Malawi Parliament has started soliciting views on interest rate capping bill which an opposition legislator moved in the 193 strong house a few days back. The Members of Parliament on Friday started discussions on the bill sponsored by Mzimba Central legislator Kondwani Nankhumwa, with a majority of members urging Nankhumwa to consult widely before the bill is taken to the committee level. “We are not saying no to interest rate capping. Let’s discuss. Let’s consult more widely. It is not a matter of yes or no. What we want you to do is to give us the pros and cons of the bill.

While giant and spectacular circus shows now roam the Earth , it ’ s good to be reminded how they originated. The first circuses were not a million miles removed from the travelling fairs that roamed Europe in the 1500s. And they were certainly a long way off from the slick and modern circuses of the 21st century. Early fairs were held for various purposes: sometimes to promote a new play, sometimes as a place for traders and performers to sell their goods, and sometimes to simply entertain people who had come out to watch them.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to do just that, Marques Porto says. Initiated in 2003 by former president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, Fome Zero is credited with having taken 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the core actions of the programme was providing poor children with free school lunches, which were purchased by the state from family farms. In this way, support to local small farmers was provided at the same time as offering quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

Ken Block makes amazing gymkhana videos. But NSW Police didn't want Ken Block to make this particular gymkhana video — the one you see right up there — in Sydney. So the Hoonigan team went to New York instead, leaving Australia in its dust. Here's the video they made — the video that could have featured the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and all our most famous city's iconic landmarks. Ken Block's Gymkhana Nine was filmed to coincide with the launch of Forza Horizon 3, set in Australia — so it made sense for Gymkhana Nine to be filmed in Australia.

Upbeat on their maiden housing project in Cavite , property developer Century Properties Group Inc. ( CPG ) and Mitsubishi Corp. are confident that the project will still be able to deliver its target of 2014 turnover despite the unstable prices of the local currency. For CPG, the company is still positive about the project and is on track for completion of the project by June of next year. In terms of construction, work on the project will begin on the first week of September this year and is expected to be finished in June 2014.

Jennifer Garner Spotted Out and About With Her Son , Samuel ! Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck have yet to officially separate, but it sounds like they've already made major progress on the co-parenting front! On Monday, Jennifer Garner was spotted with her 4-year-old son, Samuel , in LA. The mother-son duo were heading out after a morning trip to the park , and they looked to be having a blast together. While Samuel wore a plain white shirt, shorts, sunglasses and a cap, Jennifer sported a striped pantsuit. It looks like Jennifer, 45, and her son may be going on a shopping spree!

A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light. The technique involves a single jab with a chemical then a flash of ultraviolet. Cancer cells in lab mice were found to self-destruct, with up to 95 per cent dead in two hours. Professor Matthew Gdovin revealed the cells — which he injected with the chemical compound nitrobenzaldehyde — turned too acidic to survive. He said after patenting his “photodynamic” therapy: “There are many different types of cancers. “The one thing they have in common is their susceptibility to this induced cell suicide.

SHENANDOAH -- A church in Schuylkill County is preparing to honor the late Fr . Walter Ciszek , S.J ., with its annual Lenten mission. Jim Martin will present “The Way of Perfect Peace: The Life and Mission of Fr. Walter Ciszek” at 12:15 and 7:30 p.m. at St. Casimir Parish, 900 Center Ave. , Shenandoah , Feb. 17-19 . Martin is a Jesuit priest, writer and media consultant to the Society of Jesus. He is an executive producer of the feature-length documentary movie, “Called By Love,” which is about the life of Ciszek.

President Jacob Zuma believes that the public protector’s report on state capture was a political tool meant to be used to deal with certain individuals. In an exclusive interview with ANN7 on Monday evening, Zuma spoke out about the state of capture report by former public protector Thuli Madonsela, in which she recommended that Zuma establish a commission of inquiry into state capture and that Chief Justice Mogoeng Mogoeng choose the judge to preside over it. The report looked into whether Zuma’s friends, the controversial Gupta family, had undue influence on the executive.

PARIS (Reuters) - Longchamp, one of France’s leading handbag makers, plans to increase its presence in China, its chief executive said, in sharp contrast to retrenchment by rivals and despite the economic slowdown and changing consumer culture there. Many leading luxury brands such as Kering’s (PRTP.PA) Gucci and LVMH’s (LVMH.PA) Louis Vuitton have put the brakes on further store openings in China as part of campaigns to preserve their exclusive image. “We are far from having fully tapped China,” Jean Cassegrain, chief executive of the privately-owned group, told Reuters in an interview.

ROSES to actor Donal Logue , known for roles on everything from “ ER ” and “ Grounded for Life ” to the cult classic movie “ Sons of Anarchy ” as a gangster, after his 16-year-old son Arlo Logue was last weekend found by police in Brooklyn’s Prospect Park in critical condition after apparently overdosing on what police found was a large quantity of what they believed was heroin. He later died at the hospital. According to a friend of Donal’s, he’s frantic about finding the dealer who sold his son the drug that may have killed him.

Parts of Prince William Forrest Park in Virginia will re-open Monday after a March windstorm closed the park to visitors, according to a Prince William County Parks and Recreation public service announcement. The park was closed March 7 after a March 5 windstorm blew down trees and took out power lines throughout the Prince William Forest Park, which is the largest natural forest preserve in the Washington D.C. metro region. Parks and Recreation crews are still working to fix the power lines in the park, and the park will not be fully open until electricity service is restored.

The best Halloween costumes are inspired by the year’s most memorable moments, and 2016 has been nothing if not memorable. We've had the Summer Olympics and a US presidential election, which dominate headlines (and Facebook timelines!) every four years. Throw in a masterpiece visual album from Beyoncé, the hype surrounding Pokémon Go, and the candy-colored, quotable craziness of Suicide Squad, and 2016 is basically begging for a Halloween costume bonanza. We have become experts on all things Halloween — producing over one billion pageviews’ worth of Halloween content. That’s where we come in.

Albion striker Simon Cox has emerged as a a transfer target for Championship club Derby County . Rams boss Nigel Pearson is understood to have scouted the striker on several occasions already this season and is now ready to table an official bid. The 19-goal hitman would command a fee of at least £2million. Meanwhile, Derby defender Craig Forsyth could be on his way out of the club after being told he can find another club if he wants regular football. The Scottish defender made just 16 appearances in 2015/16 after a knee injury ended his season prematurely in November, and he is now seeking first-team action elsewhere.

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown’s relationship. And the network has made sure to hire a veteran actress, who starred opposite the singer in Waiting To Exhale, to direct the biopic. Angela Bassett, 55, will make her directorial debut for the TV movie that will centre on the late pop star, who died in 2012. Lifetime announced that the movie will follow the Houston and Brown through their first meeting and tumultuous marriage. It also promises to chronicle the I Will Always Love You singer’s rise to fame.

There are a range of useful commands which can be accessed through the game console , or entered into the chat box . These include a range of basic game commands, such as attack, defend, etc., and advanced commands that allow more control over gameplay. Note that if you don't like the way any command is implemented, you can use the Console to create your own. See the Console section for more details. Game commands can be accessed by pressing the corresponding keys on your keyboard. See the Key Bindings page for details of which key binds to what.

Cemetery Road is cleared of the June 27th lava flow and has been repaved . PĀHOA , December 16 , 2015 – The June lava flow at Kilauea ’s Puu ‘Ō‘ō vent reached an estimated 400 feet at 5:00 p.m. today, prompting...
Crews working to clear roads and remove debris after the lava flow
PĀHOA, Hawaiʻi - The June lava flow from Kīlauea Volcano is still active in lower Puna . Hawaiian Volcano Observatory scientists estimate that the flow is now about 1,000 yards (916 m) from the closest occupied structure and about 50 yards (46 m) from Highway 130 .

It's been more than a decade since Eminem's one and only starring role in 8 Mile, and you would be fair to assume his acting career had begun and ended right there. But the erstwhile Marshall Mathers was in the running for years to play the lead role in Antoine Fuqua's boxing drama Southpaw, which, like so many other projects, wound up languishing in development. Now the project has been picked up by the Weinstein Company, and though Eminem isn't technically out of the running, he may be on the verge of being replaced by some of the biggest starts out there.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to melt in the fierce heat of Volgograd when they take on Nigeria in only their second ever World Cup match on Friday after impressively holding twice champions Argentina to a draw at the weekend. World Cup debutantes Iceland are dreaming of the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the most outstanding stories of international football in recent years. In their way stand not only Nigeria, who are desperate for a win after losing their opening game 2-0 to Croatia, but also the challenge of searing temperatures in the southern Russian city.

She’d grown up in a predominantly white, working class housing estate. “We were the only black people, and I was called racist names on a regular basis,” she recalls. “In bed, I would pray and ask to be taught to teach the children to be kind to me and others. “This then drew me to having a ‘rainbow of friends’ — Jewish, Muslim, Hindu, Buddhist, Rastafarian and Christian. I was always wanting to connect with people’s heart and soul, regardless of faith or culture.

WasteCo Services provides roll off commercial dumpster rentals throughout metro New Orleans for homes , businesses and industrial sites . Roll off container rentals are perfect for those jobs that generate large amounts of waste material in metro New Orleans. Construction waste: Building demolition, roofing projects, yard clean out, etc. Our Roll Off dumpster containers come in a variety of sizes and can be delivered quickly to any location in metro New Orleans. If you're not sure which roll off dumpster rental size will best fit your needs, our staff is always happy to help.

The Grant bar and grill is a lively place with local musicians playing Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights and Sunday afternoons on the outdoor dining deck. If The Old Fish House could talk, just imagine the mesmerizing stories she’d share about 100 years of residence alongside the Indian River Lagoon. She could tell us about the early days when entire families slept on their fishing boats. We’d hear tales about the break of morning on the river, when husbands took those same boats and joined the fishing fleet going out to sea while families stayed behind with wives working hard in the fish house, processing fish.

LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour at the weekend , in recognition of his contribution to music. The Grammy award-winning star was awarded the prize alongside singer Lionel Richie, country musician Gloria Estefan, dancer Carmen de Lavallade and TV producer and writer Norman Lear. The New York native, 57, who has also appeared in a string of TV shows and Hollywood films, was praised by President Barack Obama as a pioneer in hip hop music and credited with being the “godfather of rap” at the award ceremony at the John F Kennedy centre in Washington.

The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record. NL Partners of Portland, Maine, previously handled the account. Work will be handled out of the Fuseideas' Portland office and include broadcast, print, out-of-home, point-of-purchase, digital and social media programs for the lottery. The agency will also handle media buying and planning duties. New work debuts in the spring. The Maine State Lottery spent $655,000 on measured media in 2013 and $565,000 in 2014, according to Kantar Media. The Variable was named agency of record for Soffe, an athletic apparel brand, following a competitive pitch.

Will Chelsea switch gears vs. Arsenal? Judging by his body language, you would never think Chelsea is only two points off the top of the Premier League table. After an extra-time defeat to Sunderland in Tuesday’s Capital One Cup quarterfinal, Jose Mourinho cut a bedraggled figure, a strange mixture of irritability, weariness and defiance. "We may have to take a step back in order to be more consistent at the back,” he said. “It’s something I don’t want to do, to play more counterattacking, but I’m giving it serious thought.

Part two of Naomi Klein 's report on the events that triggered a momentous new kind of politics in Argentina. Part one was published in our March 1999 issue; the complete article will appear in an upcoming issue. The 25th anniversary of Argentina's most famous protest march—the March on the City of the Dead—is on April 22. That's when the mothers of the "desaparecidos" (the disappeared children and adults of the last military junta) marched to the city of La Plata to demand to know the whereabouts of their loved ones.

South Bend (IN) -- Thursday morning, the Irish took the practice field for the final time before Saturday's Blue-Gold game. One of the biggest questions the team faced entering spring ball still has yet to be answered: who will step up at linebacker? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is the closest thing the unit has to an 'absolute' at this point, but he seems ok with the uncertainty. He believes the position has made big strides over the last month and a half, but is in no rush to have everything in place with Week 1 still months away.

Authorizes Director of the Oregon Department of Aviation to request Department of Transportation to provide certain central business services for the department; specifies when those services are required; directs Department of Transportation to provide certain services under contract; authorizes Director of Department of Aviation to contract with Department of Transportation to provide services. House Feb 25, 2015: Public Hearing scheduled. House Feb 25, 2015: Work Session held. House Feb 25, 2015: Recommendation: Do pass. House Feb 25, 2015: Referred to Ways and Means. House Feb 26, 2015: Work Session held.

Seabees from Naval Mobile Construction Battalion (NMCB) 7 and members of the U.S. Army Alpha Company, 427th Brigade Support Battalion, stand in formation during a transfer ceremony at Camp Moreell, Southwest Asia, May 23. Seabees operated Camp Moreell, named for Adm. Ben Moreell, “Father of the Seabees,” for almost 10 years as the main Seabee ground base and assembly point for many Sailors who deployed across Southwest Asia before transferring responsibilities to the Army. The primary hub for Seabee deployments to and from Iraq and Afghanistan was closed during a ceremony held on Ali Al Salem Air Base, Kuwait, May 23.

At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn , Jack Flynn saw a short man pin a yellow rose at the foot of the casket. It was a gesture Jack remembered from the time when he was a young man. “It was from a girl, I guess,” Jack said. “I wonder if she remembers him or if he meant anything to her. I don’t remember that. I’ve never seen him. I don’t even know who he is, but he seems like he’d be nice.

South Dade will be looking to win its sixth straight Class 3A state title this weekend . South Dade enters Saturday’s matchup at No. 1 Miami Northwestern (10-0) as the fourth seed in the 2017 Class 3A playoffs. Kickoff is scheduled for 8:00 PM EST in a matchup that will be available to stream on NFHS Live. The Panthers won their third straight district title this season and are seeking a sixth straight trip to the state final four. South Dade has reached the FHSAA Class 3A state title game in each of the last five years, but has gone 0-for-5 since its first state title back in 2004.

“ Interaction of Color , ” the landmark 1963 book by Josef Albers — the German-born artist and educator who coined the idea of the “ color wheel ” during his years teaching at the Bauhaus School in Germany — is often described as one of the most important books of the twentieth century. The colorful book, illustrated with the artist’s precise geometric paintings, was intended as a tool to assist in teaching basic art principles and color theory. Albers had previously taught and written extensively about color theory, but “ Interaction of Color ” was meant for a different kind of reading.

Hetton-born Northern Powergrid boss remembers dad as he gets OBE The Queen ’ s New Year ’ s Honours list has been published, and Hetton-born Simon Groves has been honoured. A North East executive who lives in a £2million home in Jesmond has been recognised with an OBE in the New Year's Honours list for his services to the energy industry. Simon Groves, 53, was awarded an OBE and said he was "deeply touched" to be honoured in the 2018 list. Mr Groves, the chief executive of Northern Powergrid, also paid tribute to his late dad.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer ’ s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. In the study, researchers used a molecule known as CB-181276 to treat mice that were given a dose of amyloid beta proteins. These proteins are the ones that build up in the brain to form plaques, which are associated with Alzheimer’s disease. A study has shown that Alzheimer's disease could be cured using a simple synthetic estrogen, which scientists believe can help clear out the protein plaques that build up in the brain and cause dementia.

The Sparks added some much-needed inside muscle Wednesday when they completed a three-team trade with the Charlotte Sting and the Utah Starzz. Charlotte shipped the Sparks' third pick in this week's WNBA draft (20) and the Sparks' third pick in next year's draft (21). The Starzz received a 1997 first-round pick (21), which was obtained by the Sparks from Seattle. In exchange for second-round draft selections in 1999 (21), 2000 (21) and 2001 (12), the Sparks also obtained point guard Lindsay Whalen from Utah.

Richard Randolph Lamb, a resident of Dunsmuir, passed away on September 17, 2009 at Mercy Medical Center in Mount Shasta. Richard was born in Fairview, Montana. He moved to Siskiyou County from Oregon in 1919. Richard was a veteran of the US Navy serving in the Pacific Fleet during World War II. He worked as a railroad engineer for Southern Pacific Railroad for 34 years. Richard was a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars of Dunsmuir. His hobbies included bowling, cars, music, traveling and love for his family.

DELRAY BEACH — Overdoses are on the decline in Delray Beach , continuing a trend that started last year . But that doesn't mean Delray Beach officials are going to ease up on the war they've waged against heroin and other illegal drugs in the city. The City Commission recently approved a nearly $1 million budget for the police department to combat the drug problem in the city and surrounding areas. The police department had budgeted $984,030 for the current budget year, and the City Commission approved an additional $100,454. The extra money will pay for a new patrol car to conduct surveillance operations and a new officer.

ALBANY — Gov. Andrew Cuomo — who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers — called the popular social media site an “elitist bulletin board” Tuesday and said he doesn’t look at it. “We created an echo chamber for the elitists to talk to themselves and, this little bubble of an unreal universe that banned political intelligence, believes is representative of the world,” he said in a WAMC radio interview. Cuomo has two Twitter accounts, one with 853,000 followers and the other with 10,400. He said during his re-election campaign last year, he was told by reporters to watch Twitter goings-on.

Brands should resist the temptation to take on a hot-button issue in the Super Bowl as a way to stand out, according to new research from Kantar. The consumer data and insight company said that while Super Bowl ads typically are remembered for 30 days, the issue brands take on in their spots is remembered for about 30 hours. A total of 1,349 consumers were surveyed to assess how well-received a brand’s Super Bowl spot was, and to measure how much of a memorable experience it was, versus the overall impact it created.

Oden Technologies , a fledgling startup that ’ s setting out to make factories smarter via big data and its own industrial- grade computer, announced $1.65M in seed funding Thursday. The round was led by M12, Microsoft’s venture firm. M12, formerly known as Microsoft Ventures, is the corporate’s in-house VC division that invests in promising startups working in the cloud and digital transformation sectors. It’s the startup’s first institutional investment. The company also recently closed a deal with the Massachusetts Manufacturing Extension Center (MassMEP) for its MEP SMART Program.

The Frenchwoman who received the world 's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday in a move that is part rehab and part re-education. The transplant took place Dec. 30 at the Lausanne University Hospital, and was performed by a team of surgeons led by French doctor Bernard Devauchelle and Swiss doctor Gerald Zangger. The face and part of the scalp of a woman identified only as "Blanche M." was transplanted onto the body of a 38-year-old French woman named Isabelle Dinoire. Dinoire was mauled in November 2005, by a dog that had escaped its owner's home while she was visiting.

A search for ‘ toxic mold ’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘ studies , ’ but few conclusive research papers that back up the claims. The mold that we encounter every day is a beneficial plant. It produces spores, which are reproductive parts that float on the wind to find new homes, just as plants do. Molds produce spores that float on the wind until they land and germinate to start growing on what’s available. The new plant will then produce spores and repeat the cycle. This cycle is what grows toxic molds.

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen , who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow , a site dedicated to the intellectual, social, and cultural history of Europe that includes a weekly newsletter. Her PhD thesis, “Historians on the Move: Nationhood and National Identity in the Age of Globalisation” was published by Manchester University Press in 2014. Her first book, Nationbuilding and Identity Politics in Modern Europe, is due to be published by Manchester University Press in October 2017. She is also co-editor of the collection Nation, State, and Society in the Twenty-First Century , published in 2015 by Bloomsbury Press.

Professionals gearing up for Olathe’s public firework display on Tuesday are taking extensive safety precautions and following many regulations that many families forget about in backyard displays. Fireworks caused about 11,100 injuries nationwide in 2016, with children younger than 15 accounting for 31 percent of those injuries, according to the U.S Consumer Product Safety Commission. In 2015, the office of the Kansas State Fire Marshall counted 137 firework-related injuries. The year before, nearly 40 percent of firework injuries harmed children 12 or younger. Municipality policies vary in Kansas and Missouri.

King County Sheriff's Office said the two men were riding mountain bikes in the Cascades near North Bend, east of Seattle, when they encountered the mountain lion.

THE first acknowledgement of Brent Moloney's redemption for an after-match drinking binge came midway through the season when he was quietly reinstated to the club's leadership group. In the third quarter of 2018, luxury home prices increased 3.2% year over year to an average of $1.7 million, according to the latest data from Redfin. Redfin classifies luxury homes as those that sold among the top 5% most expensive in the quarter. According to the company, sales of homes priced at or above $2 million increased for the ninth consecutive quarter. However, this is the smallest rate of growth since early 2016. Furthermore, the number of homes for sale priced at or above $2 million fell 6% year over year compared with one year prior.

Manatees are large , gray aquatic mammals . They have fat bodies — I believe that “ husky ” is a more accurate term. They are the world’s slowest swimmers. They reach 10 to 12 feet in length and weigh about 1000 pounds. They are herbivores, living on plants such as aquatic grasses. The manatee has no natural predators, but it is killed by humans in collisions with watercraft or by entanglement in crab traps and shrimp nets . They are considered threatened species in Florida . The Florida manatee is named in honor of Florida , which has the highest concentration of the species in the world.

A popular Belgium waffles franchise has opened in Dubai with the help of the government ’ s agency to support investors and businesses in foreign markets, the Belgian Trade and Investment Board. I have just been reminded of why I quit financial journalism after 11 years in the saddle , including a decade at The New York Times, five at Bloomberg News and five years at Barron's. It was not because of the money, which was good at all three venues. It was because it is a brutal business where it's easy to get run over and where it is almost impossible to succeed unless you play the game very hard -- and even then you can fall victim to other people's games. And this is before you even step into the brawl that takes place within newsrooms.

Keen to kickstart pension reforms , the finance ministry has asked the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority ( PFRDA) for the implementation of pension reform scheme ( PRAN), which was notified on April 1. The finance ministry wants the pension regulator to implement the scheme from April 1, 2016, a senior finance ministry official told TOI. The official added that while the government had issued draft rules for the scheme in January last year, it did not issue final rules as it wanted to put in place various issues before implementation of the scheme.

LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his severely sprained right ankle. An MRI exam on Monday confirmed the Kings' leading scorer will need corrective surgery that will keep him out indefinitely. Kopitar injured his ankle when he fell awkwardly during the Kings' victory over Colorado last Saturday. Coach Terry Murray initially said the Slovenian All-Star broke his ankle and would be out for at least six weeks, but the Kings eventually determined the injury was a high ankle sprain. Kopitar leads the Kings with 25 goals and 43 assists.

Progressive Networks' RealAudio and RealVideo streaming products got a shot in the arm today with the news that Microsoft plans to take a minority investment in the firm and license its key products, RealAudio and RealVideo 4.0. As part of the deal, Microsoft will incorporate Progressive technologies into Internet Explorer clients and the NetShow streaming server, and the firms will collaborate on making respective server and client products work together. In turn, Progressive will support Microsoft's Active Streaming Format (ASF) as well as its own file formats, and use Microsoft's DirectShow and DirectDraw APIs and other technologies in the next versions of its Windows clients.

US President Donald Trump said his homeland security officials will make a plea to congressional leaders for a border wall with Mexico, just as a government shutdown looms over disagreements between Democrats and the White House. Trump made the comment in a 30-minute interview on Sunday with Fox News. He told the channel that he wanted a border wall, but said there was not enough time before a March 23 deadline to reach an agreement. The Republican president has demanded billions of dollars from the Democrats in return for support for a wall, an idea unpopular with most of the party.

A family dog has been shot dead after police chased down two teens accused of stealing a car on the Gold Coast. Officers say the pair ran from police after crashing a stolen vehicle in Miami on Saturday night, and when they saw a family dog near the car they shot at it. The 17-year-old girl is in a critical condition in a hospital bed in Brisbane, while her 15-year-old companion was also hospitalised. Neighbours heard the commotion outside the home and rushed out to find officers had already entered the home and shot the family’s German Shepherd.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin G. Clark to the permanent job of director of the Oklahoma Department of Corrections. The vote is effective immediately and will expire June 1, 2006, unless Gov. Brad Henry acts before then. The 3-0 vote in the Board meeting came after nearly two hours of public comments at the Oklahoma State Penitentiary in McAlester and another hour-and-45 minutes of private deliberation. "I want to thank all those who participated and expressed their views to the board today," Clark said following the vote.

This clears the way for debt agencies to charge higher fees on overdue loans. According to a Tuesday analysis from the Consumer Federation of America (CFA), millions of Americans have fallen behind on their student loans. The data, obtained from the U.S. Department of Education, reveals 42.4 million people in the U.S. owed $1.3 trillion in federal student loans by the end of 2016. The lead seal is the first found bearing the image of St. Sabas, local big shot 1,500 years ago. A rare seal from the Crusader era has been found in the Jerusalem neighborhood of Kiryat Yovel. The lead seal, which dates to some 800 years ago, bears the likeness of St. Sabas, one of the most important people active in Jerusalem during the Byzantine period, some 1,500 years ago. Despite the importance of St. Sabas — whose Syriac name is Mar Saba — to Christian history in Israel, no seals with his image had been found before.

PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week, Preble County Sheriff Mike Simpson discussed summer driving practices as younger, less experienced drivers become more active during the summer. According to Simpson, during the summer roadways often become more active and younger drivers tend to be on the road more because they are no longer in school. “With kids out of school or kids back from college, there a lot more of younger drivers on the roadways going back and forth from events or work now that they aren’t in schools for 6-7 hours a day,” Simpson said.

The Planning Commission approved a sidewalk extension along a portion of the Laguna Canyon 's frontage road despite opposition from some residents who felt the path posed a danger. The path, which was built in 1990, is to be extended along the east side of Montage Laguna Beach Hotel. The commissioners, however, approved the request with restrictions. The commission required that the walkway's design and materials be reviewed and approved by the California Coastal Commission. The materials must be similar to those used in other sections along the frontage road.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow. One needs to look only at the considerable increase in commissioned facilities to find evidence of this. Consumers are no longer impressed by data centers spanning several thousand square meters, containing 1000 or more racks—these have become de rigeur. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, for the last two years the Russian data-center market is ahead of India, China and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, based on recent construction data from the same period, Russia places second only to Brazil from BRICS nations in terms of total area.

BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications, allegedly by Chinese hackers, that revealed EU concern about U.S. Donald Trump, Russia and Iran, the bloc said on Wednesday. “The Council Secretariat is aware of allegations regarding a potential leak of sensitive information and is actively investigating the issue,” the body that represents EU governments in Brussels said in a statement. The Secretariat declined to comment further but said it “takes the security of its facilities, including its IT systems, extremely seriously”, referring to concerns about vulnerabilities in its data systems across 28 EU states.

TRUSTEES of Settle's Victoria Hall were celebrating this week after hearing they would receive a grant of more than £200,000 to help with its restoration. It was revealed on Wednesday that the Settle Victoria Hall Company would receive a grant of £201,500 for the restoration of the old music hall. Without the grant, many people feared the building would have fallen out of use and closed. The starting date for the restoration work is now planned for July 31. The plans include an extension to give the building a new lease of life as a community centre and theatre.

A father who broke his back trying to stop thieves from stealing his car has stunned doctors by walking down the aisle at his son’s wedding. Bryan Wright, from Sapcote Road, Burbage, was crippled and left with a punctured lung, eight broken ribs and a broken collarbone when he tried to stop thieves getting away with his car last February. But despite being told he would never walk again, Bryan, 54, defied doctors by walking down the aisle at his son Oliver’s wedding on Friday to Kelly Pickering after months of practice and hard work.

At NSE , shares of Nestle climbed 5.35 per cent to Rs 6,185.05 . At BSE the stocks surged by 5.26 per cent to Rs 6,191.40 and at the MSE (Malaysian stock exchange) the shares gained 0.55 per cent or Rs 31 to Rs 5,548. Nestle India share prices rallied to their highest level in over a decade on Wednesday, gaining as much as 6.85 per cent, in line with a broad rally across Asian markets as investors digested positive global cues such as US jobs data and dovish commentary by a top Federal Reserve official.

Kent , United Kingdom ( March 25 , 2019 ) – Hawk-woods , developer of power solutions for the broadcast and professional video markets , will demonstrate its next generation 24/7 power and power management solutions for television studios at this year's Broadcast Asia. Kent, UK, March 22nd, 2019 - Hawk-woods, developer of power and power management systems for the broadcast market, and its exclusive distributor in Singapore, will be presenting their next generation of 24/7 power solutions for television studios at the Broadcast Asia 2019, which takes place from 19th to 21st June at Singapore EXPO in hall W1, stand number W1D3-07.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook's full-screen mobile ads, but Wendy's social marketers already seem to be having lots of fun with the new format. The fast-food chain is running a campaign that uses a combination of photos, videos and GIFs to show how each layer of its hamburgers are made—like wavering pieces of cheese and a grilled beef patty. "The Wendy's quality story carries a lot of equity with our fans and we wanted to invite them into that story, literally layer by layer," said Mike Bueno, director, digital marketing at Wendy's.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile 's license to sell its products . A promotion that went awry last year for the two companies will come to an end on 1 April. T-Mobile customers who want to keep their BlackBerry devices can do this by purchasing the phone at full cost and then paying $ 25 a month to T-Mobile. However, the carrier is only going to sell 20,000 of the devices in the next four months. The company will then stop selling the devices. T-Mobile started selling BlackBerrys on 12 December 2012, shortly after the launch of its iPhone 5, but the relationship was short lived.

“Interaction of Color,” the landmark 1963 book by Josef Albers — the German-born artist and educator who taught at the Bauhaus, Black Mountain College and Yale University over the course of his storied career — isn’t just for aspiring artists. Its mesmerizing illustrations are a revelation for anyone interested in color theory and human perception. On Thursday, to mark the book’s 50th anniversary, Yale University Press, the publisher of the original edition, will offer a fresh way to engage with Albers’s lessons by releasing the “Interaction of Color” App for the iPad.

The portfolios were acquired from a large regional owner-operator. Edgar Wright has never made a bad movie . He ’ s never even made less than a very good one. He ’ s a talented and creative film-maker who never gets it wrong. He started as a documentary director, where his natural storytelling talents were at their most apparent. He has, since then, worked his way up, and he is now a highly respected member of the film industry. He has also, in the space of three films, firmly established his reputation as a man who likes to create films where the audience can have fun, and have a laugh.

TOKYO ( AFP ) - Nearly half of Tokyo 's residents could not name a single Paralympian and international sporting stars were not enough to get youngsters to take up physical education classes in the run up to the Games, survey data showed Monday. The city's governor, Yoichi Masuzoe, also said that 84.4 percent of the city's residents were "not aware" of the International Paralympic Committee ( IPC ) and 46.5 percent did not know any Paralympian. According to the data from a survey of over 500 Tokyo residents, just 5.4 percent of students aged 16 to 17 chose physical education as their favorite subject.

President Jacob Zuma believes that the public protector ’ s report on state capture was a political tool meant to undermine the government. There is no stronger motivation to bury the hatchet than ratings and pending contract negotiations. High above Midtown Manhattan, the front-runner in the Republican race for the presidency and the leading woman in prime-time news met to settle a score. Donald Trump and Megyn Kelly, who have spent the better part of the election cycle publicly feuding, privately fuming, or ignoring one another, met at Trump Tower on Monday, seemingly ending the silence between them. “Yes, the doormen appeared a bit stunned when I walked in,” Kelly said on her Fox News show Wednesday night.

The Duchess of Sussex's maternity wardrobe may cost a royal sum, but yours doesn't have to. The Meghan Markle effect is in full swing — or should we say full term. Since the Duchess of Sussex — who is due to give birth to her first child sometime in the next month — announced her pregnancy last fall, fashionistas have been watching her every public move, keen on observing what she wears and how she wears it. Such scrutiny isn’t new for Markle, whose style has grown to be iconic since stepping foot into the royal limelight.

BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Boston-based private equity real estate firm, Muirfield Investment Partners, is pleased to announce that blockchain specialist and CTO of IBM Blockchain, Gari Singh, has joined the firm as an advisor. Muirfield is leading the effort to reinvent and improve private equity investing through the use of blockchain technology and Mr. Singh’s technical expertise will help guide Muirfield’s efforts in both the near and long-term. LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour at the weekend, in a ceremony which also recognised Gloria Estefan and Lionel Richie. LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour. The 'Mama Said Knock You Out' hitmaker was recognised with the US' highest achievement for a performer in a ceremony on Saturday (02.12.17) evening, with Lionel Richie, Gloria Estefan, 'All in the Family' producer Norman Lear and dancer-and-actress Carmen de Lavallade also picking up the accolade at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington D.C..

A popular chippy which closed in the summer is set to re-open under new management - with a trendy twist. The former Nash's on Harrogate Road in Chapel Allerton shut in August after the family decided to sell the business, leaving the suburb without a fish and chip shop for the first time since the 1960s. Now it has been taken over by new owners who intend to re-open it as a fish restaurant and beer hall. The building was purchased by local estate agents Stoneacre, who were keen to retain its heritage as a fish and chip shop.

A family travels to a remote island in southern Chile . In the trip they try to convince the grandparents to accompany them and spend their holiday with the family. The story tells about the life of a 85 year-old woman who has spent years in the island, in an unhealthy environment, with no contact from the world. The film takes a look at the loneliness and alienation, that characterize a certain part of the older population that is forced to spend most of their time in their homes, waiting for the time they will be no longer useful to the society.

Donald Trump 's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter 's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the social media platform. In September, Trump himself asked that Twitter "stop the Fake NYTimes and show TRILLIONS of $ given to bad actors. Trump has used the social media site for years, but has faced a slew of critics for his use of Twitter. In March, Trump tweeted that the "mainstream media " is to blame for the rise of terrorism. Earlier this month, a report by BuzzFeed revealed Trump's tweets are often written by a group of "amateurs and hobbyists".

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Cultural Center, 2650 Sistrunk Blvd., in Fort Lauderdale. The concert starts at 6 p.m. Tickets are $10, and students with ID cards get in free. To order tickets, call 754-206-5000. Dillard, a public magnet school, has a nationally recognized jazz band and a jazz studies program. The 30-member ensemble has received national and international accolades, and has performed at the prestigious Lincoln Center Festival in New York.

Russian President Vladimir Putin called Turkey’s downing of a Russian fighter jet today (24 November) a stab in the back administered by “the accomplices of terrorists,” saying the incident would have serious consequences. Speaking in the Russian Black Sea resort of Sochi on Tuesday before a meeting with Jordan’s King Abdullah, Putin said the downed plane had been attacked inside Syria when it was 1 kilometre from the Turkish border and had come down 4 kilometres inside Syria. That contradicted Turkey’s assertion that the aircraft had been warned multiple times that it was straying into Turkish airspace before it was shot down.

A family dog has been shot dead after police chased down two teens accused of stealing a car on the Gold Coast on Thursday. Police said the dog was acting aggressively toward a police dog but his owner said he was "just a big playful boy", who "didn't deserve to be shot". Desmond, a 15-month-old Golden Retriever-Staffy cross, was shot dead by police on the Gold Coast on Thursday. About 5.20pm on Thursday, officers spotted and pursued a car that had allegedly been stolen from the Gold Coast suburb of Jacobs Well the same morning.

NEW YORK — A lawyer whose rant against workers speaking Spanish at a New York City restaurant issued an apology Friday for a video that has been seen more than 1 million times. Jose Taveras posted on Facebook Thursday that the video was intended as a joke, saying he was “not trying to get people in trouble.” Taveras was later seen in the background of the video, which was shot at an El Rio Grande restaurant in Brooklyn. The video went viral after it was circulated widely on social media and news outlets.

A man was booked for allegedly flashing a 45-year-old woman while she was out on a morning walk in Sector 10 on April 9. A case of obscenity was also filed against the accused in this regard. In her statement to the police, the victim said she was walking in the market area when a man on a bicycle came in her way and asked her to take a right turn to go towards the Sector 9 main road. While she was crossing the road, the accused allegedly flashed at her and she immediately turned back and informed him that he was behaving inappropriately, she stated.

Washington D.C. , Jul 31 , 2018 / 03:01 pm ( ) .- The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority was ordered Thursday by a local judge to release surveillance footage of two suspects accused of raping a woman on the subway in June. After the victim testified, the judge said there was probable cause to believe a rape occurred and that the victim had been taken into custody. According to WJLA 7 News in Washington, there was no mention of the video during the trial. A video released by the Metro Police Department on July 1 showed two men getting off at the West Hyattsville stop shortly after the incident.

President Barack Obama has postponed two stops on his four-nation Asian tour because of the government shutdown . The White House says Obama and his family were scheduled to travel to Malaysia on Saturday, but will now leave on Monday. Obama's tour includes stops in Myanmar, the Philippines and Indonesia. Obama's trip to Indonesia is to attend the East Asia Summit. The administration says the change in plans will allow the president to return to Washington in advance of a possible vote in the Senate to break the logjam that has closed parts of the federal government and sent thousands of federal employees home without pay.

Art Vs. Science took to the stage at Club NME at Camden 's KOKO on Friday ( May 7 ) to launch the latest issue of their fanzine, along with playing an exclusive live session. Everyone knows where and what they were doing when this nightmare called 9/11 happened . Chuck was getting ready for his first day of pre-school when the world as we know it was changed forever. Stark County ’ s unemployment rate in August fell to 6.8 percent , the lowest it ’ s been since December 2001, according to numbers released Thursday by the state’s Department of Workforce Development. The number of people working in the county is up by more than 16,000 in the last year. Stark has a total population of more than 367,000 and is home to the University of Mount Union and Kent State University ’ s Stark campus. Other nearby colleges with campuses in the county include Malone University, Mount Vernon Nazarene University, Walsh University and Walsh’s Stark campus.

Why’s an incendiary Dutch journalist on the payroll of the ex-Alaska governor’s political action committee? A Mother Jones investigation. In recent months, Sarah Palin’s political action committee, SarahPAC, has paid thousands of dollars to a mysterious company that’s gone to significant lengths to mask its ownership. Addresses linked to the firm lead to mail drops. It has no website. No phone number. Not even the California lawyer who incorporated the company knew who was behind it. But a Mother Jones investigation has found that this firm is run by an unlikely foreign political operative.

Vodafone has announced changes to its roaming data charges. The new changes will benefit those who useless than 5MB of data per day while abroad. The network's daily charge in Europe from 15 June will be £1 per megabyte for the first 5MB, then £5 for every 5MB thereafter. Outside Europe, the charge is £3 per megabyte for the first 5MB, then £15 per 5MB. The changes will benefit those with minimal data requirements - but those who need to be connected to the internet at all times will be charged more for the privilege.

Tom Petty – who was on stage alongside Prince when the late superstar played in tribute to George Harrison at his 2002 induction ceremony with Ringo Starr and others – is one of several rock and pop stars who will honor Harrison on the upcoming episode. The episode, titled "Prince and the Purple Rain era" – which also honors the singer and featured performances by Sheila E., Stevie Wonder, Miley Cyrus, and Janelle Monae – will air Oct. 28 on HBO. It's hard to underestimate the success and increasing power of Amazon. Their market cap hovers just under $1 trillion. Their growth rates have been astounding. By most estimates Amazon now accounts for nearly 50% of all US e-commerce revenues, roughly 5% of all retail and is significantly bigger than their next 10 competitors combined. One study has some 55% of all online product searches starting at Amazon. ( Host ) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars in kickbacks paid by drugmakers to prescribe the antipsychotics Abilify, Zyprexa, Seroquel, Risperdal and Geodon. Earlier this month a federal jury in California found that the manufacturers of the drugs gave kickbacks to physicians for promoting the use of these powerful drugs for off label use, and the jury awarded $5 million in damages to a former sales representative of one of those companies. A federal judge ordered the companies to turn over records of the payments made to doctors and physician organizations.

Parts of Prince William Forrest Park in Virginia will re-open Monday after a March windstorm closed the park to visitors for weeks. A National Park Service news release says areas that are clear of fallen and hazardous trees will open Monday. Visitors can enter the park from Park Entrance Road off of Joplin Road beginning at 9 am. Piedmont Forest Trail, Laurel Trail Loop, Birch Bluff Trail, and Crossings Trail will be open to the public. The Pine Grove Picnic Area and Telegraph Picnic Area will also open Monday. High winds that blew through Prince William Forest Park last week knocked down a number of trees.

WASHINGTON (CN) – Republicans heaped ridicule on Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood at a Wednesday hearing after LaHood suggested that bicycling and walking are just as good ways to get around as cars. To laughter, Republican House members suggested LaHood was taking drugs, dismissed the very idea of bike lanes and derided any change to a car-dependent society. “What job is going to be created by having a bike lane?” asked Ohio Republican Steven LaTourette. He suggested that environmental sustainability projects have “stolen” $300 million from other programs and to attacked LaHood’s encouragement of bicycling, on a personal level.

Each year, the palike and state authorities ensure that Bangaloreans are forewarned before Diwali about being safe. However, just like the past years, over 60 firecracker-related casualties have already been reported in the city this year as well. Shockingly, this year kids aged between 4 and 14 have sustained eye injuries as a result of ignoring fire safety precautions. The city has been aglow since Tuesday with the festive spirit, but hospitals in city received a total of 60 casualties related to firecrackers. To add to this number however, since yesterday local clinics in several residential areas have been seeing patients coming in on an hourly basis.

It happens: You hit the snooze button once, twice, then three times, so when you're finally showered, dressed and ready to tackle the day, you're already behind schedule. Oftentimes that causes you to skip breakfast completely. Turns out, your breakfast habit is one time-saving step that should not be skipped. First off, eating a nutritious, high-protein, balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to kick-start your brain, improving concentration and performance. Plus breakfast is linked to better weight control, as it provides your body energy and may reduce hunger later in the day.

`` Of all the German surface warships , the British feared Bismarck the most . Her size , speed , and firepower made her nearly impossible to take in a surface action . Bismarck was not simply an improved version of the earlier battleship . The ship was larger and had greater armor and firepower than her contemporaries of the 1920`s and 1930`s . She was also faster than her peers . Bismarck was armed with 8 15 `` guns in four turrets , 20 5 `` guns in four twin mounts , and 16 3 `` anti aircraft guns . She also carried a pair of torpedo tubes .

MOUNT PLEASANT, Sanpete County — School officials are asking students who aren’t up to date on immunizations to stay home for several weeks as Sanpete County deals with a mumps outbreak. There are two confirmed cases of mumps in Sanpete County, according to North Sanpete School District Superintendent Dr. Sam Ray. One of those is a student in the school district, he said. Another potential mumps case is currently pending while health officials await test results, Ray said. Ray did not say which school the student who has mumps attends, but said North Sanpete High School is “involved” in the outbreak.

A new poll reveals that more Americans would choose the Internet as their only news source than TV , radio or newspapers. The poll, conducted last week by the Pew Research Center, also found that young adults (ages 18 to 39) are the most likely to get all of their news from online sources. For those of us old enough to remember when the Internet was called the "Information Superhighway," this shouldn't come as a great surprise. A lot of us thought that it would be great for information exchange and that it would end up becoming the main news source of the masses.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. Gulfwest Company Limited is a Jeddah-based Saudi company that imports US beef, which is used by five-star hotels, fine-dining restaurants, upscale casual dining and fast food restaurants, and catering companies. The company said in a statement that the Gulfwest Food Expo held on Nov.26 is the first-of-its-kind event organized by a food product importer in Saudi Arabia.

January 6, 2017 Affordable Care Act, health insurance, Uncategorized. A new poll released Friday finds one in five voters want the Affordable Care Act repealed before a replacement plan is ready, highlighting challenges for a new Congress. Incoming president Donald Trump tweeted to GOP legislators “be careful” earlier this week. To break it down, 20 percent of people surveyed want it gone immediately with details worked out later, while another 28 percent say wait to repeal until a replacement plan has been announced, the Kaiser Family Foundation said.

As Conservative Party leader William Hague made his way through the flock of the faithful at a lunchtime rally Tuesday and an emcee introduced "the next prime minister of Britain," even many of his supporters let out an involuntary guffaw. The conservative Times of London newspaper had just thrown its support to the Labor Party for the first time ever, endorsing Prime Minister Tony Blair for a second term. The nation's leading betting house, Ladbrokes, had already closed its book on Thursday's election and said it had begun paying out on a Labor victory.

A report is expected to be released Tuesday detailing how an unknown cyber hacker broke into South Carolina 's computers in September and accessed the files of state agency employees. The Office of the Attorney General told The Associated Press that the investigation by the FBI is ongoing and that the report is expected to provide details on how the intrusion into South Carolina government computer systems took place. The State newspaper reported Monday that at least 12 state agencies were affected by the hacking attack. The newspaper did not say if the intrusion into state computers took place during the 2015-16 election season.

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale. The theme of the concert is the “Discovery of Jazz,” tracing its roots from the beginning of the 20th Century to the present. The jazz ensemble, led by director Christopher Dorsey, earned First Place in this year’s Essentially Ellington High School Jazz Competition and Festival in New York City, the nation’s most prestigious high school jazz competition. The band also earned First Place in Savannah, Georgia’s Swing Central competition.

WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning to his unit three years ago was jailed Monday on charges of desertion. Pfc. Michael A. Saba, 20, of Troy, Mich., appeared before U.S. District Magistrate Judge Thomas M. O'Grady for the first time Monday morning in Washington. He is charged with desertion, missing movement, making a false official statement and attempting to possess a controlled substance. The charges could result in a total sentence of 25 years in prison. The U.S. Marine Corps says Saba was arrested Saturday in South Carolina.

The images we have published out of Yemen may be as unsettling as anything we have used before. Here’s why we made the decision to publish them. Amal Hussain is a 7-year-old Yemeni girl with a haunting gaze whose image sits atop our latest report from Yemen, a country plunged into war and on the brink of a catastrophic famine. Amal is skin and bones, and her head is turned away, as if she cannot bear to meet the eyes of those looking at her. Some readers may feel they want to look away, too.

QUETTA - At least eleven people including two women and two children died and 18 others sustained injuries in a suicide bomb blast in the Pishin district, a police official said on Saturday. The explosion took place at around 10:00 am in the district's Siddiqabad when a bomber targeted the vehicle of a tribal leader near a polling station where voters were queuing for their turn to cast vote. The police official said that at least seven people were killed on the spot in the blast and two others succumbed to their injuries in the hospital.

The lead seal is the first found bearing the image of St. Sabas , local big shot 1,500 years ago. His name is found in the first seal (# 310) in the second series. His iconography is found on many coins minted in the Byzantine and Armenian provinces during the reigns of various rulers. On the obverse there is a cross and in the center there are four small crosses and an icon of the saint, a book with the Gospels on his shoulder. The reverse is an ornament that looks like an old-style shield. These coins are made from two types of metal: brass or copper.

Drones come in a wide variety of different shapes and sizes these days, but generally speaking, most of them still fall within one of two categories. There are those of the multi-rotor variety (quadcopters, hexacopters, octocopters, etc), and those of the winged variety. Both categories have their own set of advantages and disadvantages. Multi-rotor aircraft are typically more stable and easy to fly, but also much slower than wing drones that focus on forward acceleration. Conversely, winged drones can fly faster and further than their hovering counterparts, but are harder to pilot, since they can’t perform vertical takeoffs and landings.
