Cemetery Road is cleared of the June 27th lava flow and has been repaved. PĀHOA, December 16, 2015 – The County of Hawai‘i Department of Public Works is pleased to announce that the Cemetery Road Restoration project has been completed and the functionality of the original 12 foot one lane roadway has been restored. The reconstruction work of removing the lava associated with the October 25, 2014 Pu‘u O‘o Volcanic Eruption that crossed onto Cemetery Road and paving the 500-foot stretch of roadway was completed within the forty working day time frame.

JAIPRAKASH HOSPITAL is undergoing a face-lift these days with the wards being whitewashed, painting of walls, etc. Some new facilities are also being added in the hospital. The hospital’s OPD, paediatric ward, female ward and other areas have been revamped and bear a new look. Next on the agenda for a face-lift is the hospital’s upper floor. The amount sanctioned by the State Government for augmentation of facilities at the hospital is being utilised for refurbishment. An additional Rs 18 lakh has been sanctioned for carrying out further improvements at the hospital.

Fiji Council of Social Services ( FCOSS ) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by all social service agencies. Fiji Council of Social Service is a non-government organization that represents the interests and concerns of non governmental organizations, and community based organisations in Fiji, and in particular those involved in social services delivery. The FCOSS is supported by AusAid, and UN Women, and the Ministry of Social Welfare. In a press statement the group said that FCOSS had initiated a process to establish a mechanism to ensure accountability by social service service providers to their target groups.

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law requiring police to collect a DNA sample from anyone arrested on suspicion of a felony. The law is part of a 2004 voter initiative that gradually expanded the categories of people in the criminal justice system from whom DNA is collected with cheek swabs. The four plaintiffs are challenging a provision that went into effect in 2009 and requires the DNA sampling from all felony arrestees, regardless of whether they are ever charged or convicted of a crime.

NEW YORK — A lawyer whose rant against workers speaking Spanish at a New York City restaurant issued an apology on Tuesday. "To the people I insulted, I apologize. Seeing myself online opened my eyes — the manner in which I expressed myself is unacceptable and is not the person I am. I see my words and actions hurt people, and for that I am deeply sorry. While people should be able to express themselves freely, they should do so calmly and respectfully. What the video did not convey is the real me. I am not racist.

Getty Images photographer John Moore will receive the inaugural Impact Award from the Lucie Awards program Sunday at Carnegie Hall in New York City. The awards honor great achievements in photography. Moore will join eight other honorees who will be recognized for their work at the gala ceremony. It's not the first award for the photojournalist who grew up in Irving and graduated from the University of Texas at Austin. He won the 2005 Pulitzer Prize for breaking news photography in 2005, two awards from the Overseas Press Club and Photographer of the Year from Pictures of the Year International, among other honors.

UNITED NATIONS, July 6, updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire on July 8, the day before South Sudan declares independence, as of June 6 at the UN in New York the Security Council resolution to create a new force in South Sudan has not yet been passed. At a meeting of Deputy Permanent Representatives on July 5, one member voiced opposition to forming the new Mission until after South Sudan formally declares independence, and found some suppporters. They pointed at a paragraph in the draft resolution which welcomes the creation of South Sudan.

Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called on Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the PM House with both sides agreeing to resolve outstanding issues through peaceful means. Zarif, who is in the country on a three-day official visit, conveyed his personal greetings and best wishes to the Pakistani prime minister. Iran and Pakistan enjoy historic relations, and it is important that the two countries keep up good relations in all sectors so that peace, stability, and development can be promoted in the region, Zarif said while addressing a joint press conference with Khan after the meeting.

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year , Summit County ’ s real estate market has started to shift. According to Summit Board of REALTORS® Market Action Report for February , sales volume has been up 26.4 percent, while the median price has slipped 4.4 percent from a year ago. So far, buyers are taking advantage of a more affordable market to scoop up homes before seller demand increases. Sales are up in Park City , Kimball Junction and Kamas.

Girls Like Biology, Boys Like Physics? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls or boys. In addition to reporting participation on AP exams by racial and ethnic groups, the College Board's eighth annual "AP Report to the Nation" includes the gender breakdown for all subjects tested. The data are for public school test-takers from the class of 2011. Some of what I learned may not surprise readers.

AUGUSTA , Maine ( AP ) — The Maine Warden Service says a hunter 's body has been found in an area where there had been an ongoing search for him since Thursday. Authorities said Saturday that they are investigating the death of the 67-year-old man as an apparent accident. The name of the man has not been released but the Maine Warden Service says he was an out of state hunter. Police had been searching for the man since Thursday, when his dog was found in the woods in Augusta. Rescue crews had been called in to search for the missing man.

In the third quarter of 2018 , luxury home prices increased 3.2 % year over year to an average of $ 1,630,000, according to the latest residential real estate market survey by Douglas Elliman, an increase from 2.9% the previous quarter. Douglas Elliman expects that prices in the fourth quarter of this year will be even higher. In addition, sales volume increased by 13.6% over the previous quarter, up from $ 653.2 million in the previous quarter, which is the highest quarterly value recorded by Elliman in the last two years, and the average time of sale was 146 days.

May 20 ( UPI ) -- One man was killed and another was hospitalized after they were attacked by a bear while hiking in rural Alaska, authorities said. The Alaska Department of Fish and Game said that two men were hiking Monday afternoon at the Chilikadrotna River when they heard growling in the bushes. The men decided not to go any closer to find out what the sound was, but when they heard more growling and a rustling in the bushes, they began to walk back to their camp. As they walked toward the camp, they came upon a black bear standing in their path.

TORONTO — Businesses are asking for major changes to the King St. pilot project or they’ll be considering their options including legal action, says the head of the Ontario Restaurant Hotel and Motel Association. ORHMA President and CEO Tony Elenis said his group has a meeting with Mayor John Tory this Friday where they’re hoping to hear the city will lift its restrictions on private vehicles after 7 p.m. and on weekends. Measures taken by the city to attract customers back to King Street – including $5 off parking – have failed, he said.

It will be the Blues' last ever league match at Fratton Park after they were forced to leave their home of more than a century due to an agreement with Fratton Park Ltd to sell the land they own to the company. Dublin: Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland's first bill on abortion, legalising the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem the woman's life at risk from her pregnancy, as the predominantly Catholic country took its first legislative step away from an outright ban. Exhausted legislators applauded Friday's 127-31 vote, while outside the parliament gates abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their smartphones. It capped a grueling debate that locked lawmakers in argument from Wednesday morning to 5am Thursday and, after a pause for sleep, through midnight Friday.

From M1917 to M1A2 , American tanks have dominated the battlefield . The U.S. Army and Marine Corps are on the cutting edge of the military’s use of tanks. From the 1980s, the United States Army has begun to phase out its old M48 series of tanks in favor of a more modern and effective design. However, the M48 has proven itself on the battlefield and has become the U.S. military’s most widely-deployed main battle tank. Designed to address the need for a heavy armored infantry support vehicle, the M48 has become a workhorse and a battle-tested favorite.

About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh yesterday, before protesting in front of the provincial hall and calling for Prime Minister Hun Sen to help them. Getty Images photographer John Moore will receive the inaugural Impact Award from the Lucie Awards program Sunday at Carnegie Hall. The program, which recognizes “individuals whose actions have had a profound effect on the field of photojournalism and have raised public awareness for a cause or social issue,” is a joint venture of the Foundation of the Worldwide Photography Organization, the Lucie Foundation and the World Photography Academy. Moore’s work in 2015 focused on the migrant crisis from Syria to Greece, the devastation caused by the Ebola virus and other natural disasters and the rise of ISIS and other Islamic fundamentalists.

Battfleck is officially no more! Ben Affleck is officially out as Bruce Wayne in The Batman. And he is passing the torch to a new actor, who has yet to be cast. The weight-loss company has seen a 66 per cent drop in share prices since the firm's November 2015 high after the former TV host announced she would become the face of the firm. As Oprah Winfrey and her fellow board members hunt for the next CEO of Weight Watchers International (WTW), analysts who follow the company have put forward some suggestions about the top priorities for a successful turnaround. OTTAWA , March 20 ( Reuters ) - In a fresh blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper, the chief justice of Canada's Supreme Court said on Tuesday he will step aside during an upcoming judicial probe into a scandal involving the country's spy agency. Canada's federal police agency, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), are probing allegations that Prime Minister's Office staff inappropriately pressured the government's national-security agency to investigate political opponents, including a well-known Canadian journalist and a well-known environmental activist.

Northern Ireland was today branded the race hate capital of Europe, in a report on racist violence in the province. Human rights campaigner Doreen Lawrence, mother of murdered black teenager Stephen Lawrence, was in Belfast for the launch of the report by the Northern Ireland Council for Ethnic Minorities (NICEM). The report identified institutionalised racism in the criminal justice system and asked how it should be addressed. Racist violence has been growing in Northern Ireland in recent years, not just against blacks and Asians, but almost anyone considered an outsider.

GENEVA – The Head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict, Justice Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory as he presented the report of the Mission* to the Human Rights Council. Following its three-month investigation, the four-person Mission concluded that serious violations of international human rights and humanitarian law were committed by Israel in the context of its military operations in Gaza from December 27, 2008 to January 18, 2009, and that Israel committed actions amounting to war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.

WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel on Wednesday and admitted that his family operation "got big quite a while before we stopped acting like we were small." "What I mean by that is we were big before we started adopting sophisticated procedures to be sure we met all of the government requirements," the egg producer, Austin J. DeCoster, said in testimony before a House Energy and Commerce subcommittee. He is the founder of an egg empire that has been linked over three decades to multiple deadly outbreaks of salmonella poisoning in many states.

The drama started when Jenelle Evans and her mother Barbara were hanging out . While the two have had a turbulent relationship in the past, Barbara was the only supportive family that Jenelle had when she got into trouble and was kicked off of The Hills and Teen Mom. Jenelle Evans, her husband Courtland Rogers, and her mother Barbara Evans are arguing on Twitter with each other after the Teen Mom star’s husband, Courtland, was arrested for allegedly stabbing his ex-girlfriend. The reality star was not present for the arrest and had no comment on the matter.

Part two of Naomi Klein's report on the events that triggered a momentous new kind of politics in Argentina. Up until quite recently, Argentina pursued a policy of official amnesia when it came to the crimes of the Dirty War. Sure, the human rights non-governmental organisations still issued numerous scathing reports, the Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo still marched and the children of disappeared parents still showed up, from time to time, outside the homes of ex-military figures to throw red paint. But before the Argentinazo, most middle-class Argentinians regarded such actions as macabre rituals from a bygone era.

Vodafone Hutchison Australia ( VHA ) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G, warning the new wireless standard will take time to gain traction. The telco veteran, who has held key roles in the US, UK, and Europe, was one of four high profile speakers at the Informa Telecoms Media Subscriber Experience (SX) summit in Sydney on Friday. Speaking in the context of 5G, Berroeta observed that "we have to get ready before we launch 5G, because the network investment is going to be large".

The overstuffed roster for X-Men : Days of Future Past just got a little bit smaller . Although Anna Paquin's Rogue was expected to be part of the film, she won't be showing up. The news was revealed by the actress herself in an Instagram post . "I've just been told by @jimmytucci that my character, #rogue, will NOT be in the movie #days of future past," said the actress, whose character was killed off in The Last Stand . "But if she is, you know where to find me ;)."

A search for ‘toxic mold’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘studies,’ but few are based in science—and many are motivated by profit. Recently a patient of mine was hospitalized for liver failure due to alcohol. His history of liver disease was well documented, but he adamantly denied that anyone had warned him to avoid alcohol. An initial confession of “a few drinks” turned into much more with a little probing by different medical providers. Despite his liver being in a significant amount of shock, he was stable and lucky enough to still have most liver function intact.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state . A measure to raise the state’s gas tax has stalled because legislators are not willing to raise taxes. However, one bill on the House floor is designed to ease the financial burden of New Jersey’s drivers and truckers, according to Gov. Chris Christie. Assembly Bill 783 would exempt diesel fuel from the state sales tax. The governor signed the bill into law, which will take effect in June 2016. The change is estimated to save truckers more than $30 million per year.

Mindfulness and meditation have made deep inroads into the corporate world . The benefits are proving out , notes this Business Insider story, in studies and research on stress, pain, anxiety, addiction, happiness, and sleep. Mindfulness is becoming a cornerstone of some of the world’s best companies’ wellness, training, and leadership programs. But it can be difficult for a company to roll out and scale a mindfulness program effectively. Facilitating the practice of meditation is a skill, not a rote procedure. And it takes years to develop expertise.

Suzuki unearthed improper tests on 6,401 units out of 12,819 since 2012. In a major blow to the Japanese carmaker, Suzuki Motor announced that the company used improper fuel economy and emissions tests on its vehicles in Japan. According to Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport of Japan, Suzuki, along with Mazda and Toyota have accepted to having cheated on the emissions tests and submitted a report of samples of manufactured vehicles selected during the quality assurance process. Moreover, the samples were found to have been tested under incorrect driving conditions. However, the company is not considering product recall at this moment.

AURORA, Ill. – A suburban teen has died after a tragic accident in the parking lot of a high school. Police say 17-year-old Stephen Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, after he was injured Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. Police say the teen was riding on the passenger side running board of an SUV in the parking lot when he lost his grip, according to WGN. He fell backwards and struck the pavement. Police say Woodcock suffered head and other injuries. He was treated by paramedics at the scene then airlifted to the hospital.

Albion striker Simon Cox has emerged as a a transfer target for Championship club Derby County. Rams boss Nigel Clough is keeping close tabs on the 23-year-old and will consider a loan swoop if there is any encouragement from the Hawthorns. Sources in the East Midlands confirmed today that the former Reading and Swindon man is on a list of forwards being watched by Clough, who is looking to strengthen his strikeforce. The Pride Park chief is also keen on Scunthorpe's highly-rated Gary Hooper, Sheffield United's Billy Sharp and Everton's James Vaughan, who he signed on loan last season.

As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof Project, the Standardisation Directorate in the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority (MCCAA) has held a second workshop to launch the public consultation on the Draft National Standard for Green Roofs. As part of the EU's 2020 Strategy, which aims to reduce energy requirements by a minimum of 20 per cent by 2020, the Commission's Energy Efficiency Plan 2011 has identified that buildings have the greatest energy-saving potential. The plan focuses on mechanisms to reduce the energy requirements of existing buildings - public buildings in particular - and the role of dissemination projects in introducing energy-efficient measures.

Manatees are large, gray aquatic mammals. They have fat bodies — I believe that “husky” is how clothing companies would attempt to get manatees to buy big jeans — that taper to a flat, paddle-shaped tail. Average adult manatees are about 10 feet long and weigh 800 to 1,200 pounds. Manatees are among God’s ugliest creatures in the ocean, and there are a lot of strange-looking seagoing creatures. Those are facts — well, the ugly observation is an opinion, but it’s obvious enough to be fact — that I learned from the Save the Manatee Club website.

New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio isn ’ t visiting Israel until August . But that doesn ’ t mean he is avoiding the Jewish state. Last month the mayor’ s 15-year-old daughter Chiara spent five weeks in Israel on an educational trip with 50 other kids from across the United States. The group, sponsored by Taglit-Birthright, a popular non-profit organization that encourages young Jewish adults to travel to Israel for free and meet other Jews around the world, visited Jerusalem, Tel Aviv, Masada, and other historic and holy sites. Mayor Bill De Blasio, and his family, visited Israel in 2014.

SANTA MARIA , Brazil – Penny-pinching by a band known for its onstage pyrotechnic displays may have cost more than 200 lives at a Brazilian nightclub early Monday. Dozens of club-goers in the city of Santa Maria are thought to have been crushed to death when panic set in after the band decided to cut the show short. “Those 214 youngsters died in the stampede as people were trying to flee the venue in a hurry,” said Rio Grande do Sul state governor Tarso Genro. The incident happened at the Kiss Nightclub, the most famous venue in Santa Maria, which has a population of just 280,000 people.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders. The move is performed in a face-up position on a workout bench set at an angle. You then grasp dumbbells or a barbell in an overhand position, and extend and bend your elbows to elevate the weight over your chest. Incline chest press machines that simulate the movement in a fixed plane are another way to perform the move. The incline press is one of several exercises that help create symmetry and strength in the muscles of the upper body.

Did Donald Trump Release Donald Trump’s Tax Return? For a moment, it seemed that Rachel Maddow was in possession of a genuine scoop. And then, all of a sudden, it didn’t….Thanks to MSNBC, the suggestion that Trump has “paid no taxes in 18 years” has now been definitively proven to be false. Moreover, Trump seems to have paid a higher tax rate in 2005 than did most political figures, and to have enjoyed a sizeable income to boot. Whether the report was cherry-picked we cannot possibly know.

The sad demise of late veteran actor Kader Khan has left a void in the Hindi film industry that cannot be filled. Condolences have been pouring in for the late actor and his bereaved family ever since the news came out. The actor, who passed away at a hospital in Canada, was remembered on his funeral held recently in Canada. On Wednesdays, family members and fans of the actor gathered in Toronto to pay their last respects. At Kader Khan’s funeral in Toronto, Canada, actor’s son Sarfaraz thanked everyone for coming and being through this tough journey.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach ( R-IA ) went down to defeat in the massacre of 2006 . I 'm no fan of his and he has voted with George Bush on Iraq and spending too much but I am surprised that people would vote for the Republican candidate Steve Rahr, who is in fact a liberal Democrat , instead of the guy who was in the majority of the Republican Party. It was more a referendum against George Bush than anything and I suspect this will be the same for the election 2008 . We have to be careful not to elect liberals .

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara . What was initially reported as a serious crash with two people trapped has evolved into a motor vehicle crash with one person trapped. The police and fire service are now at the scene. It was reported to police at about 8.15am that two vehicles were involved and there were two occupants in each vehicle. Two of the vehicles were towing boats and two were travelling together. Police are investigating after a man was shot with a pellet rifle on Christmas Eve.

It was a situation which baffled many around the world , let alone the passengers on board the British Airways BA38 . A flight was grounded for 3 hours in New York , after an apparent hijacking. The pilot reportedly took the plane to a remote area after the hijacker, who was a female passenger, demanded the plane be sent to a particular country. Passengers of British Airways flight BA 38 were forced to remain aboard their plane in New York for more than three hours after the pilot reportedly received an email from a passenger alleging that she was a hijacker and was trying to fly the aircraft to Iran.

In Lean Times , Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie do the trick. But only for a short while. Fried green tomatoes and bourbon bacon jam on a peppercorn-balsamic vinegar waffle. In this economy, people are taking any job offered. Even a job as a pie maker. In fact, some are even turning to a pie shop in desperate times. As more and more bakers and food-service workers are losing jobs, and as bakers have closed shop in recent months, a few restaurants are turning to pie-making to get customers in the door.

COUNTY and district councillor for Axminster , Cllr Ian Hall , has spoken out on his support for the recently submitted development of 200 homes on land between Chard and Chardstock . Cllr Hall, who is chairman of South West Water’s Area 5 Committee , says the development , which is in an Area of Natural Beauty (ANB) , will not impact the area’s beautiful scenery as the Chardstock to Crewkerne road has been diverted away from the site . He says: “Any development in the area can only have a positive effect.

Millennials are not a homogenous group of individuals, so a one-size-fits-all marcomms approach won't work. Millennials want healthy food and are willing to spend more on it. Oh wait, no – Millennials are in debt and want healthy food at affordable prices. They are also self-entitled. But they’re creative and tech-savvy, so that’s a good thing. And don’t try traditional advertising with them, stick to social media. If all of this sounds familiar, that’s because it’s a small glimpse of the countless contradicting reports on Millennials.

The Board of Intermediate Education Karachi ( BIEK ) on Thursday reported 20 cases of cheating to the board ’s controller general in the first year inter examination being held at 14 centres. In a press release issued here on Friday, the controller general said that 20 cases had been reported to the board of cheating, impersonation and malpractice. However, no student had been expelled from any exam centre as a result of any of these cheating activities yet. The board has taken stern action against those found guilty of such activities, it added.

It was a situation which baffled many around the world, let alone the passengers on board the British Airways plane. Yesterday a British Airways passenger jet due to fly from London to Dusseldorf landed in Edinburgh by mistake after the incorrect flight plan was given to its pilots. The BA3271 flight was operated by German firm WDL Aviation - which was responsible for the aircraft and cabin crew - on behalf of BA as part of a leasing deal. It is understood one possibility is that on its final flight on Sunday, the plane had flown to Edinburgh and back and so the same flight plan was repeated again on Monday morning.

Ballinhassig 4-17 Castlelyons 1-12: A polished second-half performance powered Ballinhassig to a comprehensive win over Castlelyons in the Cork Premier IHC quarter-final on Saturday evening. Inspired by Danny O’Callaghan and backboned by five members of the Cork intermediate team, the Carrigdhoun side displayed many of the attributes that may see them make a swift return to senior ranks. While the forwards will grab the headlines, it was the performance of O’Callaghan and the solidity of the Blues’ half backline that launched their second-half offensive and a return of 2-11 (2-10 from play) on the scoreboard.

It looked like the scene after an earthquake. A sea of orange boxes littered the floors, shoes stuffed in every crevice, while confused people stood in shock. But this was no natural disaster. This was Black Friday at a Nike factory store in Seattle. Horrified shoppers at the Seattle Premium Outlets in Tulalip, Washington, shared pictures and video of the store's dismal condition after the holiday weekend. They show people carelessly crushing the boxes that protect Nike shoes while walking through the outlet, mindlessly grabbing and discarding sneakers as they go.

[prMac.com] San Rafael, California - Audio technology company, Soundness is pleased to announce availability of SoundSoap+, based on the award-winning SoundSoap audio noise reduction software for Mac and Windows. SoundSoap is consumer-friendly software that solves audio noise problems like unwanted hiss and background noises, clicks, pops, crackles, electrical hum, rumble, clipping, and low volume in media files. SoundSoap+ includes all the features of SoundSoap, and provides several powerful additional controls for pinpoint accuracy in audio restoration work. SoundSoap is so easy to use that even average consumers can use it to fix audio noise problems, without requiring any audio expertise.

The US is pursuing a plan to push Palestinians into northern Sinai and transfer part of the West Bank to Israel in return for an end to terrorism, Israeli newspaper Haaretz reported Wednesday. According to the paper, Egypt has agreed to an American proposal under which Israel would withdraw all its troops from Gaza, in return for an end to Palestinian rocket attacks, and give the Palestinian Authority control of the coastal enclave. In exchange, the Palestinians would be expected to relocate to a zone in northern Sinai, where they would receive international support for rebuilding Gaza, the paper said.

The New York Knicks approach the quarter-mark of the schedule with a middling 9-9 record as they aim to end their 43-year championship drought. Coach Jeff Hornacek and the Knicks will have the upper hand against opponents in December. In the 15 games they will play this month, only five of those will be against teams with winning records. They’ll host the 5-13 Minnesota Timberwolves on Friday. Joakim Noah, Derrick Rose and Carmelo Anthony are arguably the biggest names on the roster, but they are not playing up to expectations. Anthony’s team-leading 22.2-point scoring average is up slightly from last season.

She posted about Bozman in the “Out and About in Troy, Illinois” Facebook group to see if anyone had connections to get him inside. After that, it took off. Troy residents brought him food, water, blankets, warm clothes and boots throughout the day, and were able to raise enough money to buy him a bus ticket to New York, where he had a friend he could stay with. Warm at last, he boarded the bus Wednesday night with a backpack full of supplies and a pocketful of cash from helpful Troy residents.

CARILLON BEACH � Organic living comes naturally to Leia and Andy Mayer , and their Sunrise Market & Caf� is one of the few places to find organically grown and homemade food in the Carillon Beach area. As the name implies, the Carillon Beach market and cafe has a distinctive organic feel to it, with an open kitchen and an attached cafe serving organic breakfast and lunch dishes. Along with the organic coffee, eggs and pastries that the Mayers have on the menu, they serve fresh sandwiches and salads. They also have organic beer and wine available.

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire. Tony Barbara, 50, was found guilty of having two pit bull terrier-type dogs for fighting despite being subject to a 10-year ban from keeping the animals. Kilmarnock Sheriff Court heard animal welfare officers and police searched Barbara's home in High Street, Newmilns, East Ayrshire, on November 12 2014 after being given a tip-off. The officers found two dogs with puncture wounds and scars. The animals, named Kira and Jackie, had been kept in crates in the kitchen and the bedroom.

Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies will move to BU's Engineering and Science building. Two companies plan to create 39 jobs and invest $540,000 over the next five years while residing in tax-free zones at Binghamton University, Gov. Andrew Cuomo's office announced Monday. Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies Inc., which will move to the Engineering and Science Building at BU, were two of the 17 companies unveiled Monday as the newest participants in Start-Up NY, a program that offers no taxes for 10 years in locations near or on college campuses.

Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma , Calif. on Thursday, March 1, 2012. (Gary Reyes/ Staff)
Waste hauler bids to save composting operation in Petaluma
Petaluma Regional Recycling wants to keep processing food waste from Sonoma County and Marin County residents, even after the cities and counties they serve have signed a new deal to send their trash to a county landfill instead. The trash company’s new proposal calls for processing the waste at a waste-handling facility in Marin County, but would keep the operation going in Petaluma.

TORONTO — Businesses are asking for major changes to the King St. pilot project or they ’ ll be considering other locations to open, Councillor Paula Fletcher says. The pilot project has been met with criticism from some city businesses and residents and the councillor is calling on the public to help by providing feedback on what works and doesn’t. The 1.5 kilometre test project has reduced the number of lanes from four to two, and added two dedicated transit lanes on King St. W. from Bathurst St. to Lake Shore Blvd. W.
Some businesses along the street are concerned the changes have cut into their foot traffic.

FULHAM have raided Southampton for left-back Matt Targett , Norwich City are set to seal a deal with Aberdeen for Greg Cunningham , while Brentford are about to land Fulham striker Chris Martin . The Cottagers have confirmed the loan capture of the Saints youngster , who will spend the remainder of the 2017/18 campaign with the west London side. Meanwhile the Canaries are set to sign the Cork defender after agreeing a £1m fee for the 25-year-old. The former Sunderland man has been a mainstay in the Saints' starting XI since making the step up from League One in 2016/17.

WASHINGTON — South Florida has long been a laboratory for some of the nation’s roughest politics, with techniques like phantom candidates created by political rivals to siphon off votes from their opponents, or so-called boleteras hired to illegally fill out stacks of absentee ballots on behalf of elderly or disabled voters. But there was never anything quite like the 2016 election campaign, when a handful of Democratic House candidates became targets of a Russian influence operation that made thousands of pages of documents stolen by hackers from the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee in Washington available to Florida reporters and bloggers.

Japanese manufacturer Mitsubishi will make its first major move into the full-sized MPV market this summer with a stylish and well equipped seven seater based on the Outlander PHEV platform. Mitsubishi calls its latest large family car the Mitsubishi S-Cross, a name derived from a combination of sporty styling, crossover capabilities and eco-technology. Although the Outlander PHEV (plug-in hybrid) will be the first vehicle from the brand to use this new name, Mitsubishi expects its new crossover offering to appeal to buyers who are looking for a larger, more luxurious SUV with more interior space than the regular Outlander.

As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof Project , the Standardisation Directorate in the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority ( MCCAA ) has prepared a Standard for a voluntary code of practice for developers, building contractors, and suppliers of green roofs, in particular, those that are covered with plants, in the construction of buildings and other structures in Malta. It also applies to those responsible for maintenance and operation, including owners. The Standard is available for download below, and may also be purchased at any MCCAA Standards Office at a cost of €40.

My daughter, a resident advisor at her college, recently groaned while mentioning that she’d likely get additional foreign exchange students to supervise this fall. When I asked why that’s a bad thing, she said the foreign exchange kids tend to presume Americans are stupid unless proven otherwise. They assume Americans aren’t as well-traveled, or as fluent in foreign languages or as knowledgeable about world cultures. I said what any Good American would: Why don’t they stay home, then? Oh, she replied, they don’t think our colleges are stupid.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his left hand and could miss 8-10 weeks. The Kings said that he will undergo the procedure at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. Kopitar was hurt Saturday in a 2-0 loss at Anaheim in the final regular-season game, but the team opted to hold off on an examination until the playoffs began. The Kings opened the postseason on Tuesday with a 2-0 loss at St. Louis. Kopitar finished with 24 goals and 65 points in 80 games this season.

Contiki has launched its European campaign , ‘ Manny does Contiki ’ , featuring their hottest new star , Manny Mudrak , 25 years old , a Contiki tour leader from Budapest , Hungary , who was chosen by a panel of judges after thousands of applicants were narrowed to the final few . Manny , who will be leading tours to Europe , Morocco and the United States for Contiki , will appear in TV and online commercials and will have a dedicated Facebook page where followers can post photos , videos , and comments about Contiki experiences .

After The Floods , Colorado Hospital Braces For Winter : Shots - Health News A hospital in Estes Park , Colo., which was isolated by the recent floods, expects to lose 25 percent of its nurses. The nurses' union wants them to go elsewhere, but the hospital is not sure where they will go, and no one wants to be a hero. Following the floods last month, which washed out hundreds of miles of roads in northern Colorado, some hospitals have had difficulty getting enough doctors, nurses and supplies. When it rains in Boulder County, Colo., the area becomes very popular.

It 's customary to leave a tip when eating out , but one particular gratuity added to an order for an alcoholic beverage is often overlooked. "Tipping out" refers to the act of paying a bartender for drinks that are served, but which are not consumed by the patron himself. It is a common practice throughout the world, but especially in North America. Some countries, like Italy, Spain and France, ban tipping in their laws, while others, such as the United Kingdom and Australia, allow for it.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku, Chromecast, or Fire TV are, but Nvidia’s Shield TV is still a capable streaming media player, so much so that it made its way on to our list of the best streamers you can buy. Still, if you own one, you might be getting jealous as you see support for Amazon’s Alexa voice-powered assistant popping up on other devices left and right. Fret not, however, as Nvidia has announced that its Android-powered streaming box will be getting support for Alexa control as well.

The ride-hailer returns to Taiwan with a redesigned business model that it claims will meet local regulations this time . Uber's return to Taiwan came about in part after the company redesigned its business model. Uber will be allowed to resume services in Taiwan from January, the Ministry of Transportation and Communications said Monday, following a review of its business model. However, the ministry stressed it was not in the position to decide whether Uber's services should be granted a license, saying only that the ride-hailing firm's new business model complied with regulations. The final decision lies in the hands of local transport authorities.

Relatives of the deceased bravely listened as the circumstances of the deaths were heard in detail . Harrowing details of the deaths were revealed, including how the young women died in their homes and how they had all suffered horrific injuries, with one woman's head being almost completely severed. Prosecutor Mark Dennis opened proceedings on Tuesday morning, saying: "The four victims, who are represented here, each had their own unique life story. But their stories ended in the very same place. On 19 October, they all died. They died alone at home.

Led Zeppelin stole from the ‘60s group Spirit? And did “The Voice” steal from “American Idol”? A recent court case has the estate of the composer of “Taurus” claiming “Stairway To Heaven” is in violation of copyright laws. Creatives have been borrowing from each other for centuries. But what constitutes actual harm -- business, artistic, or otherwise? How much of the original art moved to the new effort? This is always the blurry part. Lawsuits over music copyright have been going on for more than a century.

To a watching world, the sight of Britain on fire this week has surely been shocking. The looting and torching has revealed an inner-city London, Birmingham and Manchester seldom glimpsed in the England usually offered for export via soft-focus period dramas, Hugh Grant movies or stories on Will and Kate. If the revelation has puzzled outsiders, it has confused Britons no less. The mood here is a mixture of rage, fear and bafflement. Not that we’re not used to riots: We are. England caught fire during that other royal-wedding year, 1981.

WASHINGTON - RFK Stadium, the once and future home of major league baseball in the nation's capital, doesn't yet look like a field of dreams. It's configured for soccer, not baseball. The field must be replaced, and the dugouts, locker rooms and press box need upgrades. On a rainy day last week, a quarter of the field was mud and tire tracks. It looked like Vince Lombardi should be coaching football here - which he once did for the Washington Redskins. But that was in 1969.

Khloe Kardashian and Kylie Jenner apparently share a ‘ similar ’ due date , following their speculative pregnancies . The sisters have never confirmed if they are expecting children , but people believe they could both be in the family way . The pair are rumored to have had their baby daddies father them , and if they do , the timing couldn’t be more perfect . It is believed they are both due to give birth on 4 th December . Even though this is all speculation and the girls have never confirmed , many fans feel the chances of this happening are pretty high .

Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called on Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the PM House with both sides underlining the need to promote bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. PM Khan said Pakistan and Iran were the key to growth and prosperity in the region through enhancing connectivity and promoting people to people linkages, Radio Pakistan reported. The prime minister thanked the Iranian Supreme Leader’s support for Kashmiris struggle for self-determination. Zarif delivered a message of Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, inviting the Prime Minister for the upcoming Asian Cooperation Dialogue Summit in Iran in October this year.

Good afternoon and welcome to our live coverage of an "incident" in Bourke Street in Melbourne's CBD. Police have arrested a man after responding to reports of a car fire. A significant amount of smoke can be seen in Melbourne's CBD. "Police are currently at an incident on Bourke Street in the CBD," Victoria Police said in a statement. "Police initially responded to a report of a car on fire near the corner of Swanston Street about 4:20pm (AEDT). "A man was arrested at the scene and has been taken to hospital under police guard in a critical condition.

Nite Funk is the collaboration between the critically acclaimed R&B vocalist Nite Jewel (Ramona Gonzales) and Grammy Award winning producer and DJ, Dâm-Funk (BPIT). WASHINGTON ( CN ) – Republicans heaped ridicule on Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood at a Wednesday hearing after LaHood suggested that a gas tax holiday would not save American families from rising gasoline prices. Gas prices are rising quickly, and Republican presidential candidates have been trying to use the situation as a campaign issue against their rivals. “The gas tax holiday is really just a scam,” LaHood told reporters on Tuesday, adding that it would not have a “significant impact” on gasoline prices. LaHood later tried to explain himself at a Wednesday hearing on the president’s $410 billion economic recovery plan.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku , Chromecast , or Fire TV are , but the Apple TV 4K is an incredibly strong device and one of the best video streamers available right now. If you're already in the ecosystem, then you can't really go wrong with the Apple TV 4K. There are some excellent video streamers out there that are cheaper, more powerful, or more versatile, but they may not work as well with the Apple ecosystem as this device does, and even if they do, they won't look as good.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it ’ s not coming from the seas, or from the mountains or the jungle, where the Abu Sayyaf group makes its hideouts. Today’s terror takes a different form: It’s coming from the jail cell of accused kidnapper Samad Surik, who is said to be holding 49 hostages in his tiny three-sided cell. Surik, an Islamic preacher and a former village councilor here, was arrested by Marines in September last year after he was implicated by the abduction of six Malaysian seamen from Sabah on Sept. 5, 2000.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency, rather than by the current district system. More than half of voters backed the change in the island's first ever referendum, which saw a 45% turnout. Option A - one island-wide district - won with 6,017 votes, representing 52% of the final count. It means all 38 Guernsey deputies will be elected in a single vote on the same day, every four years, from June 2020. More stories from Guernsey and the referendum latest. Option A campaigner Deputy Carl Meerveld said he was "ecstatic and relieved."

It's a very, very difficult task to go and win a football game, it really is. I think we're going to be up for that challenge.

Anyone who ’ s ever been frustrated at the task of shooting video in low light should be poised to give a cheer, or maybe even a fist pump, because Canon has just announced a camera that promises to do just that — the new Canon EOS C100 digital video camera. As a long-time shooter, I was a little hesitant to try this camera out — my experience shooting low light video for years has been that video shot on a 5D Mark III, 7D, or other full-frame camera just doesn’t compare to video shot with a DSLR using a lens that is specifically designed for video.

Sportswriters Matt Goul and Steve Navaroli share news and views about high school sports in York and Adams counties . It’s the end of an era, as well as an exciting new start, in Adams County. Monday marked the last game played on the football field at Bermudian Springs High School, which closed for a new facility in 2005. But it was a triumphant night in New Oxford as the Knights beat Bermudian 41-13, in a game that had huge importance for both teams. New Oxford moved into a tie with Bermudian for third place in the Mid Penn Commonwealth with a 5-2 mark, 2-1 in the division.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $7.5 million worth of the digital currency Bitcoin. The device is now buried somewhere in a vast landfill site near the home of owner James Howells -- who only realized his mistake when it was too late. "It is soul destroying to be honest,” Howells told NBC News on Thursday. "I haven’t had much sleep over the past few days. Every second of the day I am thinking about what could have been."

A popular chippy which closed in the summer is set to re-open under new management - with a trendy twist. A sign in the window at the former The Fish House, in Hull, on Prospect Road, says that it will reopen in the new year and it is hoped that it could open its doors as early as January 2. The Fish House had a huge following with customers travelling from as far as Driffield to get there fish and chips. On its Facebook page, The Fish House Hull, the restaurant said: "We can now confirm that as of January we will be opening up as new owners.

BRUSSELS ( Reuters ) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications , allegedly by China, the EU executive said on Monday, in a sign of Beijing's increasing interest in global information technology networks. The Commission, the executive arm of the EU, was notified about the hack on 10 December last year but said in a statement it was unable to find the source of the attack. It is not the first time the European Union has suffered cyber attacks. In 2009, officials said Chinese hackers stole classified documents.

The New York Knicks approach the quarter-mark of the schedule with a middling 9-9 record as they aim to end a nine-year playoff drought in 2015-16. The 27th-place New York Islanders have the league’s worst record at 3-15-4 and have lost eight straight. The Nets face the Brooklyn-based team on Friday for the third time this season and fourth overall. They lost their first meeting by a 106-96 score on Oct. 29, but rebounded with a 112-106 victory on Dec. 31 behind 30 points from Brooklyn native and former Nets guard Jeremy Lin.

BASEL , Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases of HIV that it attributes to the use of its drug Valcyte. Roche said it notified health authorities in countries where the cases have occurred, including France, Poland, Spain, Turkey, Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States. Health authorities in the United States have been notified of six cases, the U.K.’s National Health Service was notified of five cases, five in Australia, and two cases were reported in Poland, Roche said in a statement.

A Catholic church in Port Aransas is left without a priest after he was removed Wednesday by the bishop of the San Antonio Archdiocese for reasons that are unknown. The Rev. William R. Cepeda, a priest from the Diocese of Brownsville, was appointed pastor at St. Andrew the Apostle Catholic Church at 11:30 Wednesday morning, the archdiocese reported in a news release. “Father Cepeda has served as pastor of Sacred Heart Parish in Corpus Christi since 2016 and will remain in that position while continuing to serve at St. Andrew,” the news release states.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI), Nagpur, and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to look into a proposal by Agra Nagar Nigam to set up a waste-to-energy plant. Agra falls under the Taj Trapezium Zone, an area of about 10,400 sq km spread over the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and the Bharatpur district of Rajasthan. Agra Nagar Nigam, an urban local body, sought permission of the top court to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site.

The centerpiece of the rebuild is the warehouse , which was constructed in 1943 , according to the date scrawled on the roof trusses.The roof is a cement and sand mix with a gravel cap.It is 21 feet tall, 155 feet wide by 120 feet in length.It has a 16 inch thick center core which was originally filled with bricks, but in the 80’s the interior was filled with foam insulation. The floor of the center has been completely replaced with steel and the walls on the inside have been insulated and finished with gypsum board and plaster.

A five-day event to promote cultural tourism using creative media will be held in August in the Gobi Desert , China's northwestern region of Xinjiang, said event organizers here. During the 5th International Conference on Urumqi Tourism, tourism development and media cooperation, more than 100 tourism organizations and companies will gather in the city of Hotan in Xinjiang's south to exchange experiences and seek innovation. The conference will invite tourism industry experts from South Korea, Malaysia, Indonesia and China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region to explore how to better promote their tourism products using digital media, said organizers with the Tourism Development Commission of Xinjiang.

After the Chiefs’ season came to an end in the AFC Championship Game, Dee Ford said he has no problem with the team using the franchise tag to keep him in the fold in 2019. The Chiefs have not made any announcements about their plans on that front, but it certainly sounds like there are no plans to let Ford get away this offseason. The defensive look is expected to change with Steve Spagnuolo taking over as defensive coordinator for Bob Sutton, but pass rushers are always at a premium and General Manager Brett Veach didn’t sound like he’s preparing to say goodbye to Ford.

The weight-loss company has seen a 66 per cent drop in share prices since the firm 's November 2015 high of $US26.97, with the stock now trading at $US9.04. "The market has come to terms with the fact that the diet company has not delivered on promises to the investment community and consumers. It is time for Weight Watchers to get back to the basics: focusing on delivering the benefits of the weight-loss program to consumers, and generating free cash flow to investors", says Morningstar analyst R.J. Hottovy in a note.

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to cast ballots today in the first nationwide election in 36 years without the Democratic party in the White House. But the only place where they were queuing up was in a single voting precinct of the state’s most Democratic county. By the time the first voters arrived in the state of 130,000 voters in the predominantly black city of Greenville at 5 am, 12 hours before polls opened, they were told there were too few ballots in the bag and they’d have to come back later on.

Not only did former BP chief executive Tony Hayward go sailing on his yacht at the height of the oil-spill crisis, but he also got his wife pregnant during that time. According to the Wall Street Journal, Hayward, now the boss of mining giant Rio Tinto, is reportedly expecting the couple’s third child with wife, Louise, who gave birth to son, William, on July 23. The baby is due at the end of September and will be named after Hayward's late father, Bill, reports the Journal. The couple have two boys, Peter and Nicholas, aged 8 and 6.

Margaret O’Brien, 69, moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971, got married, had three children and worked for the local council for more than 25 years as a dinner lady, meals on wheels driver, lollipop lady and cleaner. A spinal injury a few years ago meant she had to give up her job, leading her to apply for benefits for the first time. In 2015, she was told her disability payments had been suspended because she was an illegal immigrant. The letter informed her “of our intention to remove you from the UK to your country of nationality if you do not depart voluntarily.

ABC TV political discussion program Insiders is coming to Byron Bay . Host Barrie Cassidy will guide a visiting panel of ABC journalists to examine what's hot and not in the world of politics. Byron Bay residents are invited to take part in a panel discussion, hosted by Barrie Cassidy, for the nationally broadcasted TV political discussion program Insiders. Cassidy will be joined by guests to discuss what’s hot and what’s not in the current political and social scene and hear what the locals think. The discussion panel will feature the NSW Labor Leader, the Greens Leader and a local journalist.

DENVER -- During the summer of 2002, Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to let potential tourists know the state was still open for business. That comment all but short-circuited the state’s summer vacation season. This time around, the travel and tourism folks want potential visitors to know less than one-percent of public lands are impacted by wildland fires. When Owens uttered his comments, Colorado had 24 million visitors which spent about $7 billion annually. Denver had 10 million visitors who spent about $2.3 billion. In 2011, Colorado welcomed 58 million visitors who spent $10.7 billion.

Without much fuss or fanfare, but, happily, with plenty of shoppers, Salisbury quietly reopened its central shopping centre on Saturday, almost three months after it became the site of an international incident. The Maltings, which connects the coach park to the city centre, has been off-limits to the public and shielded by safety cordons and tents since the former spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found slumped on one of its park benches after being poisoned. Market traders were moved behind the shopping precinct by Wiltshire county council while the decontamination operation was under way.

NEW DELHI : A day after declaring its candidate for the seventh Lok Sabha seat , the Aam Aadmi Party on Wednesday released a list of its candidates for three assembly segments. The party will be contesting the 2014 Lok Sabha elections in all 7 Lok Sabha seats in Delhi. The party will be releasing the names of all the 69 candidates from Delhi in three phases. Aam Aadmi Party’s spokesman Dilip Pandey said that party chief Arvind Kejriwal will release the remaining names of the candidates for the assembly polls. AAP will be contesting in all the constituencies and the list of the remaining candidates will be released on April 30.

A communications professor at Texas A&M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the newspaper industry on our nation’s politics, so she did some research, which has been published in the Journal of Communication. If you have noticed what seems like a sharp increase in political polarization in the past few years, you are not imagining things. And, as Johanna Dunaway, and some colleagues at Colorado State and Louisiana State universities, found out, that polarization happened during a period of steady decrease in the number of local newspapers and journalists across the country.

Oden Technologies, a fledgling startup that’s setting out to make factories smarter via big data and its industrial internet of things (IIoT) platform, has raised $10 million in a series A round of funding led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Ventures, Inbox Capital, and a number of other seed investors. Founded out of London in 2014, Oden Technologies provides the hardware and software that lets manufacturers access analytics to track faults and establish patterns that may impact performance. It’s ultimately all about improving efficiency and cutting down on production waste.

It is easy to lose democratic mechanisms but difficult to get them back, says the incoming General Secretary of the Lutheran World Federation. Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday.Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday. FCOSS executive director, Vani Catanasiga says close to 50 representatives from Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa, Rakiraki district councils of social services (DCOSS) endorsed the Code of Accountability after a two day meeting in Lautoka.

[Written by Jonathan Starling] It is not unusual to read and hear complaints about the amount of trash talk that the two main parties indulge, a phenomenon which seems to be magnified during election campaigns. And yet, seldom do these two parties actively seek to engage in real trash talk. And by that, I mean talking about trash in the literal sense! And yet the issue of trash and waste in general is one that affects us all, touching on matters of public health, social cohesion and tourism, amongst others!

The first time I heard these verses was in a small storefront church in Kiev, Ukraine. I remember because it was the same Sunday morning that Princess Diana’s tragic death was reported. I had recently left my job on Wall Street and was living in Kiev with my mother after my father had passed away and I was there because I was not having much luck in finding my way forward. I recall the wood-paneled walls of the room where I sat in the back, slightly embarrassed by the evangelical enthusiasm of my fellow expats. But when I heard these verses my wandering mind was drawn back.

Blue Turtle Technologies , South Africa 's leading enterprise technology management company , has entered into an alliance with ThreatMetrix , the fastest-growing company in online fraud detection. Together they provide a unique combination of products to combat the risk of online fraud for e-commerce merchants in South Africa and beyond. ThreatMetrix, a privately held cyber security company headquartered in San Jose, CA, is the fastest growing provider of integrated cyber crime prevention solutions designed to secure the digital enterprise against fraud, malicious insider attacks and data loss. ThreatMetrix delivers an open and standards-based SaaS solution enabling enterprises to authenticate their online business customers in real time.

It's customary to leave a tip when eating out, but one particular gratuity added to an order for a milkshake and fries at a New Jersey diner is angering parents. "My daughter was coming to me, telling me that every time she and her friends went to the diner, they're being charged the gratuity," said Melissa Desch. "And when I asked her why, she said, 'Because they're children.'" Desch said her daughter Isabella and other students at the Colfax Schuyler Middle School frequently go to the Wayne Hills Diner, just across the Hamburg Turnpike from the school.

Thr best place to start the mortgage process is to get preapproved by a lender . An important step to getting approved is a mortgage lender’s determination of whether or not you can afford a home. Once you know what price range you’ll be looking to buy at, a lender can determine your affordability. They’ll look at how much you can borrow, how much down payment you have, how much money you have in the bank and your credit score to determine what mortgage amount you can afford. There are many options when it comes to mortgage loans.

Former Rep. Stephanie Herseth Sandlin ( D-S.D . ) is eager to start her K Street practice and has notified lobbying watchdog groups of her upcoming entry to the industry . According to watchdog records obtained by CQ , Herseth Sandlin plans to work as a partner at Brownstein, Hyatt, Farber, Schreck and is working at the firm’s Washington and Denver offices. In her notice to the Senate, she cites her experience in Congress and the House Agriculture Committee. “In addition to legislation, I will focus on executive branch matters including budget, procurement, environmental, land use and transportation matters,” she added.

KARACHI : Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah on Tuesday extended Pakistan Rangers , Sindh ’ s special powers , which are set to expire on October 31, till January 2019. The extension of the Rangers special powers was made by the federal government through notification on October 23 through which its powers to conduct searches, arrest and impose curfews have been extended for another three months in Karachi. The CM made the decision after reviewing the security situation in the city, the notification added. The Sindh government has issued an ordinance for the third extension of the Rangers’ special powers.

New Zealand ’ s Abortion Supervisory Committee is appealing a High Court judge ’ s decision that said there is no legal right for abortion to be funded in New Zealand as a health service. The decision in the Wellington High court was made on June 21. It came in the form of a judgment on a Judicial Review, where the applicants argued that their rights under the Bill of Rights were infringed. In its decision the court said, "A New Zealand publicly funded service for abortion has never been and is not now provided."

A communications professor at Texas A & M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the Facebook news feed, so she decided to test it out herself. Melissa Zimdars, communications professor at Texas A & M University, wanted to know more about the effects of Facebook’s major news feed changes in 2017. So she decided to conduct her own experiment to see how the social network’s algorithm change affected the way people consumed information in the lead-up to the US elections. She tested the data of her students, who all signed up to her experiment.

The voter scam has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's chief election officer is warning residents of a potential scam to get sensitive information from would-be voters following similar concerns in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases to send the voter an absentee ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents can't register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

If you have flexible working arrangements and do not work at a fixed location every day , and are looking to change the terms of your flexible working request, it is possible to make changes to your current working arrangement. This can be done in a variety of ways, for example, a change to your working hours, place of work and working pattern (how long you work on different days) will usually be regarded as a ‘change of terms’. Changing your terms does not necessarily mean your employer will agree to your request.

If this was supposed to be a measuring stick game for the Flyers , they came up a bit short. And if the Devils were to be considered a measuring stick opponent , they came up short. But in a game where there were so many penalties and so many goals, the Flyers had more success than in the 2-0 loss Saturday night. And for a team that is trying to make the playoffs, that’s a big plus. The Flyers didn’t earn a point in their second game of a five-game road trip, falling to 2-4-3 on the road and 5-10-3 overall.

Ely, in northeastern Minnesota, is the gateway to the sprawling Superior National Forest and its 1 million-acre Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, a popular recreation area. Ely is also the home of the North American Bear Center and the International Wolf Center. Whether campers are looking for a true wilderness experience or a somewhat less primitive encounter with nature, the Ely area has campgrounds to suit just about every taste. Just south of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Bear Head Lake State Park (dnr.state.mn.us/state_parks/bear_head_lake/camping.html) is home to a wide array of wildlife, including bald eagles, black bear, moose and wolves.

We had a very colourful guest in our studio today . Meet `` the Union Jack man '' who 's a talented artist from London. He's here to tell us more about his unique way of working and show us a little of his art collection. I was interested to see how he manages to do it. First of all he needs to make a pattern out of 100 pieces. Then he needs to cover his canvas with a lot of paint to start the process of creating the pattern . As a veteran of the movement to combat climate change , I have been conditioned to expect disappointment . So the news that the Obama Administration’s proposal to slash methane emissions from oil and gas wells by 40-45 percent by 2025 came as a surprise. But not a pleasant one. The Environmental Protection Agency estimates that the new limits will save $14-15 billion by the end of the next decade, while the government would lose only about $1 billion in tax revenue over that time. The EPA is seeking public comment on the proposed rule through May 19 .

A meeting on the future of Kirkcaldy town centre should include discussions on disabled access , campaigners have insisted . Kirkcaldy Disability Forum believes access to shopping areas and facilities for the disabled needs to be tackled in tandem with other issues, such as the loss of jobs and the decline of high streets. The group has welcomed the plans for a public meeting with members of the Kirkcaldy Townscape Heritage Initiative to take place in the Town Hall on Tuesday, March 29. A report on the initiative will also be presented at the meeting.

UNITED NATIONS , August 26 -- Amid an increasing drumbeat of media coverage predicting US missile strikes on Syria , at a UN press conference Tuesday Secretary General Ban Ki Moon said he's "deeply concerned" about the "growing risk of confrontation" in the Middle East, urging all parties to make a "calm and measured assessment and to avoid any action that could further escalate or lead to further militarization and destabilization of the situation." It was Ban's only mention of the conflict during a wide-ranging 40 minute question and answer session at which he spoke about Syria's humanitarian crisis and the threat of nuclear weapons in Iran.

The new head of the national children’s hospital board has said it would be “bad business” for the State to allow the main builder of the hospital to step down from its role. The chair designate of the board Fred Barry, who is appearing before the Oireachtas Committee on Health this morning, also said that there was an “underestimation” from a very early stage in relation to what the project would cost, leading to an increased bill of € 1.73 billion up from the estimated € 800 million cost in 2014.

Forget announcing your latest album with a gigantic , budget-crippling open-air concert - Oasis have been hiring street musicians to play their songs on London's South Bank for payouts of £5. The 'Don't Look Back In Anger' group reportedly hired a host of street musicians in a bid to promote their new album 'The Masters', according to the Mirror . The newspaper reports that the quartet, which is set to release its new record on March 21st, has had musicians busking their tunes on the South Bank - with reports suggesting that the band will continue to use the street performers until the album's release.

(CNN) - After 8 hours of deliberations Thursday, a St. Louis jury awarded $4.69 billion to 22 women who sued pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson alleging their ovarian cancer was caused by using its powder as a part of their daily feminine hygiene routine. The jury award includes $550 million in compensatory damages and $4.14 billion in punitive damages. It's the largest verdict against the company that has sold Baby Powder and Shower to Shower brand talcum powder for decades. A jury ruled in Johnson & Johnson's favor in one lawsuit in California last November.

With the economy beginning to stall, Ben Bernanke's war on the nation's savers rolls on. A few of these funds even pay juicy double-digit yields — like the one my Permanent Wealth Investor subscribers have earned 20% on in two years. Dividend harvest funds: These funds buy shares in companies that are about to pay a dividend, and then sell the stock after the dividend is paid. By doing this, they can rotate through companies with different payment dates, and thereby achieve a high dividend payout. The problem is that shares generally trade lower after a dividend is paid, by the amount of the dividend.

There has been a wealth of recent research that has demonstrated that dementia patients greatly benefit from participating in art and music intervention therapies. The benefits of the arts and creative therapy for individuals with dementias is now well established. Music is known to enhance cognitive, linguistic and social functioning as well as to reduce depression symptoms in those living with cognitive impairments, such as dementia. However, art is also effective in treating dementia. It has also been shown to improve motor skill, reduce aggressiveness, reduce anxiety and depression. Art therapy uses art to express and communicate emotions that are difficult to put into words.

The Frenchwoman who received the world's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday, saying in a heavily slurred voice that she now looks "like everyone else" and hopes to resume a normal life. Isabelle Dinoire's speech was difficult to understand, but she explained how she was disfigured by a dog bite last year, and she thanked the family of the donor who gave her new lips, a chin and nose. A fine, circular scar was still visible where the face tissue was attached in the 15-hour operation in Amiens on Nov. 27.

Summary: Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Yaris, Rav4, Land Cruiser and 4Runner vehicles, and Scion FR-S, iM, and TC vehicles manufactured January 28, 2016, to March 14, 2016. The Load Carrying Capacity Modification Label may not reflect the correct added weight of the installed accessories. As a result, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard number 110, "Tire Selection and Rims for Passenger Cars." Consequence: An incorrect label may result in the vehicle being overloaded, increasing the risk of a crash.

The Internet has changed beyond anything could have foreseen just five years ago. How the internet has caught up with the ways of the world . The early web : UNIX command was designed to be used like an ‘interactive computer programme’, and users often typed in commands to search for files, upload and download material, and communicate with the system. Web 2.0 : Users interact with the web in more creative and collaborative ways – the web has become a multimedia tool, which is accessed through an ‘active’ or interactive interface. As the 2020 Games approaches, the Japanese capital has work to do. Montana , Exxon-Mobil At Odds Over Oil Spill Montana and oil giant Exxon-Mobil are at odds over an oil spill in Montana. The company's 200-acre site in Billings, Montana, leaked nearly 285 barrels of oil in the early 1990s. Now, Exxon wants to clean up 250 of those barrels at its own expense and then resume operations. Montana says it will sue to force the company to pay all the costs, including those associated with the state's cleanup. The company insists it followed federal standards, but says it now has new, more stringent standards and doesn't want to waste time complying with old rules.

According to analyses by Net experts, the mass-mailing MyDoom worm, which began propagating yesterday, is the fastest-spreading software virus to date with an effect that could linger for years. MyDoom, which is also know as Novarg and Mimail.R, began spreading over the Internet yesterday. It now accounts for one of every 12 e-mails traveling through cyberspace worldwide, CNet News reported. The virus travels as an e-mail attachment that infects PCs whose users open the malicious file. Once open, the virus installs a stealth program that opens up a “back door” hackers then can use to take over infected computers.

First, we looked at which major brands cost the most to maintain over the first 10 years of a car's life. We grouped all years of all models by brand to compute their average cost by brand. In order to estimate annual maintenance costs, we found the amount spent on every two oil changes (as oil changes are generally done every six months). German imports lead the list by a fair margin, which isn't too surprising. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, are among the cheapest, saving owners on at least $10,000 over ten years compared to a BMW.

A budget crisis facing the Palestinian government is deepening in the wake of last week's election victory by the Islamic resistance group, Hamas. On Thursday the Palestinian Authority (PA) announced it was delaying payment of January salaries to 137,000 government staff by at least two weeks because of post-election budget problems. The PA needs $116 million to cover the monthly payroll. But after Hamas' election victory last week, Israel said it was suspending its monthly tax transfers to the PA, worth about $45 million, pending further review.

England have called up Fulham's uncapped goalkeeper Marcus Bettinelli for the games against Spain and Switzerland, while midfielder Adam Lallana has withdrawn. Bettinelli, 26, was not in Fulham's squad for the first two matches of the season but has regained his place. First-choice keeper Jordan Pickford did not take part in the squad's main training session on Tuesday. Lallana has returned to Liverpool to have a groin strain assessed. The 30-year-old, who did not feature at the World Cup after an injury-disrupted season in 2017-18, joins Raheem Sterling in withdrawing from the squad.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer’s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. “This synthetic hormone improved behavior much the way that estrogen does,” said study leader Dr. Christian Pike, associate professor at the University of Southern California’s School of Gerontology. But unlike estrogen, which enlarges the uterus and is a known risk factor for endometrial and breast cancer, PPT caused no obvious changes to the animals’ reproductive tract. “This may be a promising strategy to maximize hormone therapy benefits and minimize its risk,” said Pike.

The response to the bombs by the crowd at the finish line was, I think, exemplary. Sure, many people fled from the explosions, and reasonably so. But a remarkable number ran, as they say, to the sound of the guns, even though when two bombs go off, one might well expect more. Many of these were professionals. The finish line of a marathon is a fortuitous spot to bomb, in that doctors, policemen, ambulances and so on are stationed there. Some soldiers happened to be on hand. But others were not professionals.

It was another quarter of rapid growth for the optical-equipment maker, but shares fell as investors were uninspired by the revenue forecast. Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) reported its first-quarter results on April 27 after the market closed. While the results came in a bit ahead of its own guidance, traders were selling off shares in Thursday's trading as the company projected that growth is going to slow in the coming quarter. At 3:40 p.m., shares were down nearly 24% from the previous close. Let's dig into the results to see how the company performed in the three areas that I suggested investors should pay attention to.

And I know you probably don't have all the answers , but I just wonder if you could give me some guidance. I feel like I'm going crazy and I need help , but it's just not really coming.

The Green Bay Press-Gazette reports that authorities say they are two to three weeks into a probe into the cause of the fatal crash and it could take as much as a year to learn what happened. They have recovered a cockpit recording that has been sent for analysis, but it could take several days to find out if it is usable, authorities said. They believe the crash was caused by pilot error. But they don’t know how. “It was a pretty violent event,” said Captain Mike Daly.

PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week , Preble County law enforcement officials are asking all drivers to buckle up before hitting the road and to be patient with other drivers during the Labor Day holiday. On Thursday at 12:13 p.m., a two-vehicle crash happened on U.S. 27 near the intersection of St. Rt. 119. The investigation revealed a passenger vehicle driven by 23-year-old Jessica J. Fulton, Eaton, was stopped at a stop sign and was struck from the rear by a semi-tractor trailer driven by 26-year-old Jesse S. Smith, Eaton.

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski will give him the extra options he needs for a sustained run in the Champions League. Arsenal are two games into their Champions League campaign and they have two wins and two clean sheets to show for it. They have won all three of their Premier League games as well. However, Wenger’s biggest problem is his depleted squad. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is already out injured, Yaya Sanogo and Kieran Gibbs are likely to miss out this weekend at Southampton and Abou Diaby is also injured.
